s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Balboa Park Alive!: Exploring Biodiversity Through Mobile Augmented Reality
Contributors: Ying Choon Wu, Biayna Bogosian, Jacob Yenney, Patrick Coleman, Daniel Jalali, Joshua Pallag, Akshit Nassa, Thomas Sharkey
Abstract: Balboa Park Alive! is an AR mobile app that offers immersive and interactive experiences centered on local biodiversity in San Diego's Balboa Park. Designed for families, it encourages conservation and environmental stewardship through activities such as cultivating native plants in the Zoro Garden, releasing butterflies, and simulating pollinator behavior.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Paint the World
Contributors: Elliot Dickman
Abstract: Paint the World is an AR painting application that uses a phone as a physical paintbrush to paint AR scenes. Moving your phone around in the real world leaves a digital paint stroke in AR, similar to an AR version of Tilt Brush that doesn't require any additional hardware.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Conversa AI: A Platform for AI Interviewing and Authentic Conversation
Contributors: Val Jones, Glenn Harless, Radoslav Petkov, Stephen Smith
Abstract: Generative language models have rapidly changed how we explore public knowledge, yet these methods struggle to synthesize authentic individual experiences. We present an authoring platform for personalized AI. We use AI-driven interviewing to gather human expertise with real-time guidance and create interactive videos and presentations with a natural language interface.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: VolumeMatic and the AI3D.foundation Benchmark Card for 3D Generative AI: Text to spatial computing volume app with generated content
Contributors: Yosun Chang
Abstract: What if you can chat to automagically create your own 3D interactive software for mixed reality? We present a visionOS app that lets anyone make their own 3D volume apps for Vision Pro! We introduce a volume-snapable chat interface with context-aware widgets to help users express better in NLP code.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Bird Listening: An Application to Experience the Call and Beauty of Wild Birds
Contributors: Masatoshi Hamanaka
Abstract: Bird listening is an application to find and appreciate 10 types of wild birds by using spatial acoustic bird sounds. When the user faces the direction of a bird's call and holds a digital device in front of them, the bird appears through the leaves of the tree.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: AI3D Desktop: Creating 3D Using AI in Skeuomorphic XR
Contributors: Yosun Chang
Abstract: We explore using a 3D skeuomorphic desktop interface in iteratively generating your AI3D model in spatial computing on Vision Pro. Have precision in creating your AI3D model from perfecting an image — whether imported or AI-designed. We utilize LCM models for quick iterations for both text2image and image2image.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Napkinmatic Ubiquitous Pocket AGI: Utility-context-sensitive 3D AR XR HCI for Vision to LLM
Contributors: Yosun Chang
Abstract: This app lets you connect your LLM to the real world via both converting vision to semantic data to directly interfacing with your vision-based LLM and loading context-sensitive menus. Example: Scan any diagram to be able to understand it and to load its corresponding 3D model (or AI3D generate it).

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: The Future Is Here: Verbal Interaction With NPCs on Mobile.
Contributors: Roberto Lopez Mendez, Sicong Li, Hong Ji Liu
Abstract: This demo showcases the future of user interaction in gaming: verbal communication. The main character interacts verbally with the user using a language model-based brain and performs actions using an MLP-based brain trained with Reinforcement Learning. Implemented on Unity. Everything running locally on mobile.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: CoCapture: Group Photo App Without Assistants
Contributors: Binlin Feng, Keyi Zeng, Mingyang Su, Wen Ku, Feifei Wu, Xiu Li
Abstract: With the CoCapture app, you may capture attractive group photos with friends, landscapes, past selves, or loved ones you can't meet while traveling without seeking strangers for assistance, making every moment more valuable.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Singapore GeAR
Contributors: Takehiko Nagakura, Han Tu, Wenzhe Peng, Chili Cheng, Jenny Zhang, Xiaoyun Zhang, Woongki Sung, Katsuyoshi Ishikawa, Shineng Luke Wu, Jia Hui Joey Ong, Nobuo Iwashita, Hisakata Kobayashi
Abstract: The GEAR.sg App displays the 3D models of The GEAR, recently built research lab in Singapore. Using the smartphone camera, the app presents the building's models and on-site photos on AR picture cards, which illustrate floor plans and allow users to move, flip, and combine them with the virtual models.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Spambots
Contributors: Neil Mendoza
Abstract: Spambots explores what would happen if machine learning was used to empower a group of robotic Spam cans to tell their tales.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Love letters without the recipient
Contributors: Ziyao Lin
Abstract: Love Letters without the Recipient combines artificial intelligence technology, artistic expression, and Eastern philosophy. An AI writing machine continuously performs the futile task of writing ephemeral love letters, infused with the concepts of self-attachment and the impermanence of Eastern Zen philosophy. In this installation, AI becomes the projection of human desires, and the natural imagery generated by AI reflects the Eastern aesthetic of placing emotions in nature.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Cybernetic Oracle
Contributors: Hannen Wolfe
Abstract: Do Large Language Models produce the truth or technological hallucinations? Cybernetic Oracle invites visitors to use cartomancy to gain insight into their past, present and future with a deck of 78 tarot cards and a book of tarot card interpretations designed by the artist in collaboration with generative AI models. The symbolic nature of tarot cards to emphasize generative AI’s predisposition for archetypal representation. The work questions Large Language Models' understanding and interpretation of reality drawing parallels between querying a generative AI model for information and divination.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Rage Against the Archive
Contributors: Anshul Roy
Abstract: Rage Against the Archive' is an experimental browser-based video that critically probes how the New York Public Library's website catalogs and displays dehumanizing ethnographic photos from the 19th-century colonial-era publication ‘The People of India,’ questioning capitalism’s infusion with the archival process, and documents the hacking methodology used to insert different texts using HTML in a symbolic act of Electronic Civil Disobedience.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: I Tell the Moon My Secret and the Moon Tells Me Yours
Contributors: Zoe Qi-Jing Li
Abstract: The robotic arm repeatedly depicts the waveform of the collected secrets, creating light painting photographs with the involvement of Moon. Only when the Moon appears within its field of view can the waveform of the secret be successfully captured by the camera with a long exposure. The visual is determined by the natural environment — only when the Moon is bright and clear in the night sky can this secret possibly be conveyed. The project experiments on the synergic dynamics among uncontrollable natural environments, a precise data-driven robot system and humans, depicting the interconnection between these parties.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Algorithmic Amplification
Contributors: Theodoros Papatheodorou, Jesse Wolpert, Sam Gentle
Abstract: Algorithmic Amplification leverages LLMs and instant voice cloning to create a tangible representation of digital echo chambers, highlighting how language shapes perceptions and reinforces beliefs. It examines AI's effect on language and culture, revealing a paradox: while LLMs are a major AI advancement, they can also amplify societal biases. Participants insert their upper body into an enclosure and express an opinion. Autonomous agents adopt the participant's cloned synthetic voice to validate and reinforce the opinion, simulating a social media echo chamber. Much like online discussions, as time goes by the arguments degenerate, become more extreme, more absolute, all without guidance.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Loss of Sonnet 18
Contributors: Junxiu Tang, Jiayi Zhou, Yifang Wang, Xinhuan Shu, Peiquan Xia, Xiaojiao Chen, Tan Tang, Yingcai Wu
Abstract: This project is an explorative digital art installation that delves into the phenomenon of generation loss in digital signal processing - the inevitable degradation of information (e.g., words) quality through copying and propagation. It transcends the technical realm to probe how this concept applies to the transmission and transformation of words and meanings through time and technology. It consists of a series of videos illustrating the loss of words themselves and their meaning, combined with real-time interpretation from both humans and AI. The project allows the audience to find a border of loss, beyond which, information of words might change.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: We Forge the Chains We Wear in Life
Contributors: Yuichiro Katsumoto
Abstract: We forge the chains we wear in life is an aphorism by Charles Dickens. This chain is a metaphor for heavy and unbreakable things that bind our ideas and emotions. That is, words that tend to possess our minds and souls can also become chains. This inspired me to create a device that forms letters with chains. The device automatically writes the above aphorism as the work title. When the device finishes writing, the words are deconstructed, the letters return to the chains, and blanks remain. Then, the automatic writing begins again.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Disruptive Critters
Contributors: Jonathan Duckworth, James Hullick, Ross Eldridge
Abstract: Disruptive Critters is a playful interactive audiovisual installation designed for live sound art performances by the DuckworthHullickDuo. Amid advances in artificial intelligence, Disruptive Critters provides a humorous exploration of future creativity and digital disruption through the vocalized performative possibilities of autonomous computer-generated critters. Each Critter, with a unique visual identity and vocal repertoire, expresses human emotions, creating layered compositions. The autonomous entities interact dynamically, evolving in sonic complexity and animated form, offering an ambiguous, surprising, and melodic sonic experience. Disruptive Critters challenges traditional sound art that transforms galleries into dynamic performance spaces, offering a unique perspective on human-technology and creativity.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Preceding Emptiness: Alternative Arabic Typographic Technologies
Contributors: Levi Hammett, Mohammad Suleiman, Hind Al Saad, Fatima Abbas
Abstract: Preceding Emptiness was created by xLab co-founders designer Levi Hammett, architect Mohammad Suleiman, together with artist Hind Al Saad, and designer Fatima Abbas. Featured at the VCUarts’ Language-as-Machine exhibition, and the ARS Electronica Festival - the work is the latest light installation in a series that imagines alternative typographic histories by constructing unconventional language-display technologies. It celebrates the formal potential of the Arabic language through bright, blinking words cycling through the segmented display. The words on rotation display the Arabized terms of code statements for Arabic software tools that were first developed by Arab scientists and researchers in the 1980s.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: A Monocular Dialogue
Contributors: Louis-Philippe Demers
Abstract: A Monocular Dialogue incarnates myths in the age of Information and Technology. It is an encounter with a single-eyed robot that stares at you and endlessly whispers its inner ruminations. Underneath this confluence of a Cyclops from Greek mythology and Artificial Intelligence (AI) from modern technology, lie intriguing, albeit metaphorical, similarities.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: [sin-gí]:Data Weaving
Contributors: Hsin-I LIN
Abstract: Data Weaving connects digital language and cultural language, developing sound waves of real-time visual programming. It transcodes sound data of local narratives into woven visual patterns, becoming a touchable textile embedded with body artistries and generating local narratives in cross-cultural sound preservations of digital materials. The textiles of  Data Weaving are stored, arranged, and indexed individual messages in a meaning materialized way, and become a trace of the producers' body marks, as well as a way of interaction in which personal language is memorized and cultural textiles are mutually mended.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: ReCollection: Creating synthetic memories with AI in an interactive art installation
Contributors: weidi zhang, Lijiaozi Cheng, Jieliang Luo
Abstract: This work integrates AI system design with experimental data visualization, providing a collaborative AI art experience that is intimate, accessible, interactive, unpredictable, and immersive. Beyond its potential as a future therapeutic prototype for dementia groups, this work questions and reflects on imagining collective memory, connects language with generative visuals in a poetic way, and provides a critical future ideation for cultural reproduction.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: reconFIGURE: Confronting Audiences with Digital Doppelgängers
Contributors: Florian Christoph Bruggisser, Chris Elvis Leisi, Pascal Lund-Jensen, Martin Fröhlich, Christopher Llyoid Salter
Abstract: This work is significant because it translates cutting-edge technology from research into practical artistic applications. It raises critical questions about the aesthetics and ethics surrounding the concept of 'capture'. It also addresses the challenges of machine vision and related issues, including the uncanny imagination, machine error and the profound impact of AI-generated worlds on our reality. It also allows visitors to engage with these insights through an interactive art installation.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Probabilistic Craft- Materialization of generated images using digital and traditional craft.
Contributors: Sharan R. Elran, Amit R. Zoran
Abstract: This work presents a novel approach to creating physical artwork with image generators by opening a new territory for exploration which combines digital and physical. It lays a conceptual framework as well as a practical workflow for craftspeople to utilize the exciting new opportunities offered by generative AI. This work shows how traditional materials and techniques can articulate contemporary digital patterns while conserving their characteristic visual and tactile qualities.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Unveiling New Artistic Dimensions in Calligraphic Arabic Script with Generative Adversarial Networks
Contributors: Arshia Sobhan Sarbandi, Philippe Pasquier, Adam Tindale
Abstract: Our project merges calligraphic Arabic script with GAN-based generative AI, emphasizing the cultural and artistic significance of blending traditional art with technology. We spotlight generative AI's potential to reimagine underrepresented art forms and underscore the importance of specialized artistic knowledge in this integration. Our artworks demonstrate how this nuanced approach opens new dimensions for traditional arts like calligraphic Arabic script.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: The Olympus Programming Language
Contributors: Daniel Temkin
Abstract: Olympus brings a new approach to esolanging, borrowing from Oulipo and digital literature. It blurs the line between natural language and code. Its vocabulary influences its logic, rather than the reverse. It shows the potential of esolangs as full expressions of artistic vision. It is written in am approachable style, which can be a model for others who are less technical to make the leap into esolanging as art.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Southern Wind Algorist: Merging Nine Algorithms with Nine Gay Stories Written in Classical Chinese
Contributors: Tengchao Zhou
Abstract: Southern Wind Algorist, addressing historical non-Western male homosexuality, brings the content of Chinese Studies and Gay & Lesbian Studies to SIGGRAPH, where such artwork has audiences but is rarely presented, creating an opportunity to reflect on an important aspect of human nature and culture, adding to the diversity and inclusion. Algorist from Algorithms & the Artist, a SIGGRAPH 1995 panel. The artwork features two algorithms originally presented at SIGGRAPH.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Cell Space: Augmented Awareness of Intercorporeality
Contributors: Rem RunGu Lin, Botao Hu, Koo Yongen Ke, Wei Wu, Kang Zhang
Abstract: This paper presents Cell Space as an artwork that makes awareness of the concept of expanded intercorporeality, moving beyond mere physical interaction to a shared bio-digital domain. It offers a new paradigm for applying AR and neurofeedback in contact improvisation, fostering intercorporeal interactions and being sensitive to both individual and collaborative intentionality of its participants.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: GPT-ME: A Human-AI Cognitive Assemblage
Contributors: Avital Meshi
Abstract: GPT and I are integrated into one another's existence through a wearable device. GPT is attached to my body, converting my conversations into prompts. My words reflect GPT's generated outputs rather than my own thoughts. I speak GPT. In this symbiotic relationship, my intelligence turns artificial, and GPT turns embodied.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Critical Climate Machine: A Visual and Musical Exploration of Climate Misinformation through Machine Learning
Contributors: Gaëtan Robillard, Jérôme Nika
Abstract: Pioneering new ways to engage with art, technology, and society, Critical Climate Machine directly addresses current misinformation issues. It seeks to mitigate its effects by mediating accurate scientific content, combining machine learning strategies. In this paper, we aim to critically examine the role of such technologies in creating aesthetic experiences that resonate within scientific discourse and public debate.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Handcrafting in Zero Gravity: Reinventing the Spindle as An Artistic Intervention in Space Research
Contributors: Ebru Kurbak
Abstract: Achieving diversity in techno-scientific research is a major theme in today's discourses. However, earlier tendencies continue in practice. The inclusion of people from diverse backgrounds is increasing, but their situated knowledges are not called upon in defining research agendas. The art project Reinventing the Spindle is an exploration of zero gravity textile crafting as a basis for a larger conversation about the politics of space exploration driven by colonial legacies.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Floating on the Boundary: Perseptions of Reality in a Half-Digital, Half-Physical Bunny
Contributors: Takumi Yokoyama, Kazuya Izumi, Tatsuki Fushimi, Yoichi Ochiai
Abstract: We present ‘Float’ as a integrated display method with grasses-free 3D display, and the findings of user study. This research has uncovered the ‘Physical-Digital Continuous Illusion’—a phenomenon a sense of object existing across different spaces. The exploration within this work critically engages with culture and technology, as it delves into how individuals recognize reality. The results offer a significant, transformative milestone in the digital-physical interaction narrative.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: A Concert in a Vanished Church: Contextualizing Peace Island's Auditory History with Modern Technology
Contributors: Tak Cheung Hui, Yu Chia Kuo
Abstract: Our project aims to revitalize archaeological sites through music technology and transform unearthed artifacts and echoes of past lives into auditory experiences. Ashes to Ashes, a live performance, and an accompanying documentary translate archaeological findings into innovative soundscapes using methods like 3D printing, sound synthesis, and data sonification. This interdisciplinary endeavor bridges historical conservation and artistic innovation, deepening public connection with heritage. Our work exemplifies the transformative power of integrating history, archaeology, and modern music technology in reinterpreting human legacy.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Ephemera: Language as a Virus — AI-driven Interactive and Immersive Art Installation
Contributors: Jiayang Huang, Yue Huang, David Yip, Varvara Guljajeva
Abstract: In this paper, we present the implementation of Ephemera, a speech-based interactive and immersive installation that elucidates our artistic exploration of the intersection between art, technology, and language. Leveraging multimodal AI technology, we navigate the intricacies of censored language and its visual manifestation, offering a nuanced engagement with sensitive content. Furthermore, we delve into the complexities of language, taboos, and AI, critically examining how our systems may reinforce or disrupt established linguistic and cultural norms.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Sisyphus': A Robotic Vignette of Systemic Conflict and Democratic Endeavors
Contributors: Ka Chi Chan
Abstract: The robotic art installation explores the symbiosis of art and technology to probe crucial societal issues. It embodies the eternal struggle between suppressive systems and the spirit of collective defiance, using a cybernetic narrative to mirror the complexities of sociopolitical resistance. By intertwining robotic repetition with themes of democracy and persistence, 'Sisyphus' transcends the confines of artistic expression, urging viewers to reflect on the potential of technology as a medium for critiquing and transforming power dynamics.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Lightning Artist Toolkit: A Hand-Drawn Volumetric Animation Pipeline
Contributors: Nick Fox-Gieg
Abstract: We propose a set of methods for freely integrating live-action volumetric video with frame-by-frame animation created using 6DoF drawing tools—the Lightning Artist Toolkit (Latk), a complete pipeline for hand-drawn volumetric animation, and as far as we know the only open-source example of its kind. Our goal with this project is to make creation in 3D as expressive and intuitive as creation in 2D, retaining the human gesture from its origins in hand-drawn animation on paper.

s_Tag: Animation, Art, Audio/Music, Computer Vision, Design, Diversity & Inclusion, Dynamics/Simulation, Environment, Machine Learning, Pipeline, Real-Time, Rendering, VR/AR/MR, Arts & Design, Gaming & Interactive, New Technologies, Production & Animation, Research & Education, Not Livestreamed, Not Recorded, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: How to Get Your Resume & Reel Noticed
Contributors: Craig Slagel
Abstract: The ACM SIGGRAPH Early Career Development Committee’s Resume and Reel Review program has long offered students and early career professionals the chance to have their work reviewed by industry experts at SIGGRAPH conferences. For the first time, this Birds of a Feather session will feature a panel of industry professionals who will discuss and review a selection from this year’s program live. This unique opportunity allows attendees to see real-time reviews, learn what makes a great resume and reel, and ask questions directly to experts. Students and early career professionals can register for a one-on-one session at https://ecdc.siggraph.org.

s_Tag: Audio/Music, Scientific Visualization, Arts & Design, New Technologies, Production & Animation, Research & Education, Not Livestreamed, Not Recorded, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: The future is fulldome | Immersive Animation Workshop
Contributors: Juli Tagger
Abstract: Join the Immersive Animation Workshop and uncover its incredible journey. Learn how an unfunded project became a reality. This workshop has produced a fulldome film that has won prestigious awards around the globe, such as Japan's Grand Prix and the Audience Choice Award in science visualization, with screenings worldwide. What rules would you use to create unforgettable experiences for an immersive screen? Let's explore the immersive animation manifesto and discuss strategies for producing visually stunning content. Join us for an engaging and inspiring meet-up. Let's do impossible things. Be a part of it! Juli Tagger

s_Tag: Rendering, Research & Education, Not Livestreamed, Not Recorded, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Building Render Farms in Academic Institutions: A Case Study of the School of the Art Institute of Chicago
Contributors: Emily Kuehn, Emily Kuehn
Abstract: This presentation will explore the development of SAIC's render farm, from its initial considerations to the final implementation. It will detail the decision-making process, emphasizing the choice of on-premises servers for their cost-effectiveness, scalability, and utilization of in-house expertise. The session will provide insights into collaborative strategies with IT, technology selection, and the management and deployment of the render farm, imparting valuable lessons for institutions looking to develop or enhance their rendering capabilities. Following the presentation, there will be an informal question and discussion period, where participants can exchange successful rendering strategies at their organizations.

s_Tag: Scientific Visualization, New Technologies, Research & Education, Not Livestreamed, Not Recorded, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: ACM SIGGRAPH Cartographic Visualization Birds of a Feather
Contributors: Theresa-Marie Rhyne
Abstract: The ACM SIGGRAPH Cartographic Visualization (Carto) session explores how viewpoints and techniques from the computer graphics community can be effectively applied to cartographic and spatial data sets. Speakers demonstrate their latest tools and application efforts.

s_Tag: AI, Research, New Technologies, Research & Education, Not Livestreamed, Not Recorded, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Generative AI for Graphics, Vision and 3D
Contributors: Tomasz Bednarz, David Spoelstra, Mitesh Patel
Abstract: What an AI powered future might look like? Rapid evolution of computing capabilities enables transforming process of scientific discovery, creative production and invent new ways to experience and interact with art, music, design, film, literature, theatre, fashion and every other sphere of cultural production. This super unique BoF seeks to bring together technologists, artists, arts organizations and researchers to discuss what impact AI and generative technologies may have for our future.

s_Tag: Computer Vision, Scientific Visualization, Arts & Design, New Technologies, Research & Education, Not Livestreamed, Not Recorded, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Immersive Visualisation for Science, Research, Art and Metaverse Applications
Contributors: Tomasz Bednarz, William Sherman
Abstract: Traditionally (as for the last 10 years), this session is about immersive visualization systems, software, and tools for science, research, scientific visualization, information visualization, art, design and also metaverse. Invited speakers and panelists discuss newest initiatives and developments in immersive space as applied to data exploration, scientific disoveries, and more.

s_Tag: Pipeline, Production & Animation, Not Livestreamed, Not Recorded, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Going Cloud Native
Contributors: Doug Sherman, Liviu Constantinescu
Abstract: This is part of a linked series of Technical Pipeline BoFs, covering the Reference Platform, Renderfarming, Cloud, Pipeline, Storage, and MLOps. Join a participant-driven discussion with key representatives from the graphics community, who will compare experiences and explore techniques related to pushing the production pipeline and correlated resources toward the cloud. This session will focus on peer-to-peer learning, collaboration and creativity, and high-value topics and ideas raised during the session will be elaborated via an ongoing Speaker Series in the Cloud Native Studios user group (https://discord.gg/PU8hygUfbf). Attendees will receive invites to our Beers of a Feather event, the same evening.

s_Tag: Dynamics/Simulation, Arts & Design, Gaming & Interactive, New Technologies, Production & Animation, Research & Education, Not Livestreamed, Not Recorded, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Computer Graphics for Simulation, VR/AR and Human Factors AI/ML
Contributors: John Richardson
Abstract: This BOF discusses the interdependence between CG/VR/ML and Simulation communities [Simulink/MapleSim/SystemModeler]. Primary topics also include interdependence between VR/AR systems and AI/ML from a Human Factors perspective. Interdependence comprises technical components such as standards but also the willingness to cooperate ethically between the CG/AI/ML and the Simulation/Human Factors communities. Secondary topics include anthropomorphic Human Factors programing with English IDE's and also Internet Of Things programming with parallel data flow IDE's and VR. Voice control and automation of user interfaces is discussed. Plus a few thoughts on Geographic Information Systems and Weather Simulation. Lastly, the logic underpinnings of ML

s_Tag: Education, Research & Education, Not Livestreamed, Not Recorded, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Mentoring PhD Students in Computer Graphics
Contributors: Daniel Ritchie
Abstract: This BoF is a space for faculty, postdocs, and anyone else who regularly mentors PhD students in computer graphics to ask questions, share strategies, and generally learn from one another about how to be effective research mentors. Prospective attendees are welcome to propose topics for discussion by submitting this form: https://forms.gle/kBitQLuGbTyMDM266

s_Tag: AI, VR/AR/MR, New Technologies, Not Livestreamed, Not Recorded, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Work Smarter, Not Harder: How AI Empowers You!
Contributors: Viveka Devadas
Abstract: Dive into the future of design at SIGGRAPH! This Birds of a Feather session explores how AI and cutting-edge tech are transforming workflows. Witness AI go beyond automation, revolutionizing design and engineering. Discover how AI unlocks groundbreaking creation, streamlines workflows, and ushers in a new era of intelligent design. Join us and see how AI will change how you work with the latest emerging technologies. Ideal for designers, engineers, and creative pioneers!

s_Tag: Rendering, Gaming & Interactive, Production & Animation, Not Livestreamed, Not Recorded, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Seamless Rendering Interchange in OpenUSD
Contributors: Anders Langlands
Abstract: Join us to hear from representatives from across the OpenUSD ecosystem about the latest efforts to enable seamless interchange of rendering-specific data in USD. This session will focus on materials, lights and cameras, with updates and discussion from OpenPBR, OpenColorIO, USD Camera Working Group, AOUSD and more. Be part of the discussion on how best to represent these types of data so that we can all benefit from reliable, reproducible simulations of matter, light and more across different renderers and applications.

s_Tag: Real-Time, New Technologies, Production & Animation, Not Livestreamed, Not Recorded, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: USD, Hydra and OpenSubdiv: Pixar’s Open Source Meetup
Contributors: Jessica Wang, Florian Zitzelsberger
Abstract: Join the discussion with the developers and users of Universal Scene Description (USD), Hydra and OpenSubdiv, along with many other vendors and practitioners who will showcase the work done in the past year and the plans ahead.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Not Livestreamed, Not Recorded, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Berthouzoz Women in Research Lunch
Contributors: Mackenzie Leake, Fan Feng
Abstract: The Berthouzoz Women in Research Event is an annual networking event organized by WiGRAPH for researchers, faculty, and students. Floraine Berthouzoz started this event as an informal gathering. After her passing in 2015, Floraine’s mentees and colleagues built upon her efforts to create an event that aims to broaden the network of women researchers and provide a friendly and personal environment where graduate students can interact with senior researchers. We will be hosting a panel of women in graphics who will share with us some of their research experiences. The event is open to all researchers, regardless of gender.

sub_Title: Exploring the Future of Cloud Virtual Production and Global Virtual Studios in Digital Art
Contributors: Eric Pinkel
Abstract: Join us for an engaging discussion on the evolution and impact of cloud-based virtual production techniques and the rise of global virtual studios in the digital art landscape. From real-time collaboration to distributed workflows, we'll explore how these advancements are reshaping the way digital artists work, collaborate, and create. Whether you're a seasoned professional, educator, or student, come share your insights, experiences, and visions for the future of digital art production in the cloud.

sub_Title: MLOps in the Pipeline
Contributors: Liviu Constantinescu, Ryan Bottriell, Jesse Lehrman
Abstract: This is part of a linked series of Technical Pipeline BoFs, covering the Reference Platform, Renderfarming, Cloud, Pipeline, Storage, and MLOps. There's been much ado about Generative AI models, but how does one train, deploy, and integrate these into a studio/production pipeline reliably and efficiently? This session aims to bridge the gap between experimental development of machine learning models and their operational deployment. It will present the state of the art and encourage participant-led discussion to identify challenges and solutions, fostering shared understanding and actionable insights. Attendees will receive invites to our 'Beers of a Feather' event, the same evening.

If you're interested in having a say on how the conference and related events proceed in the future, come be part of the conversation.

Industry experts and new entrants are all welcomed, for a sharing of knowledge, experience, and best practices. Mail joe@jdamato.com for any questions or comments.

Industry experts and new entrants are all welcomed, for a sharing of knowledge, experience, and best practices. Mail joe@jdamato.com for any questions or comments.

This is a final opportunity to flag any concerns with next year's Platform before it is finalized (see https://vfxplatform.com/ for details) This is part of a linked series of Technical Pipeline BoFs, covering the VFX Reference Platform, Renderfarming, Cloud, Pipeline, Storage, and MLOps for a sharing of knowledge, experience, and best practices.

sub_Title: Open Review Initiative
Contributors: Erik Strauss
Abstract: The Open Review initiative is an open source project at the Academy Software Foundation focused on collaborative high quality review tools and their interoperability in the media and entertainment industries. Our projects include OpenRV from Autodesk, X Studio from DNEG, and a Media Encoding Guidelines project and test suite. We'll be sharing the latest project updates from each, and discussing ongoing work on collaboration and interchange in media review for VFX and Animation.

s_Tag: Animation, Art, Games, Production, Real-Time, Gaming & Interactive, Production & Animation, Not Livestreamed, Not Recorded, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: What IS a Cinematic?!
Contributors: Emily Hsu, Lina Halper, Greg Mitchell, Matt Ward, Brian Horn, Marianne Hayden
Abstract: Cinematics sit at the cross-section of film, games, and animation. But… what exactly IS a cinematic? A short, a marketing trailer, a story-telling device, in-game? Real-time or pre-rendered? What tools and other similarities do cinematics share with other mediums? How can you prove your ability and fit for gaming jobs with only linear media experience? Some of the founders of the Society for Game Cinematics will facilitate group discussion about the opportunities for cinematics in today’s industry, traversing different pipelines and entertainment industries, ways of crossing over between film and games, and the challenges of defining a cinematic!

sub_Title: Unlocking Potential Through Imagination
Contributors: Saraswathi Balgam
Abstract: Join us for an inspiring discussion on unlocking your potential through imagination. Discover how tapping into your imagination can lead to personal growth, empowerment, and fulfilment. Explore practical techniques and real-life examples that demonstrate the transformative power of imagination in shaping your life and achieving your goals. Whether you're seeking creative inspiration or looking to break through barriers, this session will leave you feeling inspired and motivated to harness the full potential of your imagination. Don't miss out on this opportunity to unlock new possibilities and chart your path to success.

sub_Title: State of Animation and Rigging in the Industry
Contributors: Valerie Bernard, Stuart Bryson
Abstract: Come join a discussion with riggers, animators and engineers about the current animation and rigging workflows, challenges, technology improvements and future trends in the VFX, animation and gaming industry.

s_Tag: Haptics, Imagination, Interaction, Mobile, Museum, VR/AR/MR, New Technologies, Research & Education, Not Livestreamed, Not Recorded, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: The Center for Computer Graphics History
Contributors: Julian Gomez
Abstract: The Center for Computer Graphics History is an independent knowledgebase of computer graphics history. It will serve for both reference and research: - an historical and living record of the development of computer graphics - an educational resource - a research resource - a framework for research into digital representations of history - a framework for research in managing a knowledgebase using 21st century technology, emphasizing XR The Center is virtual and is being built on a graph database. Content will be built on open, public standards. Being an independent institute, content will be sourced from all available possibilities.

s_Tag: Animation, Body, Diversity & Inclusion, Geometry, Imagination, Rendering, Arts & Design, Gaming & Interactive, Production & Animation, Research & Education, Not Livestreamed, Not Recorded, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Counter Racial Bias in Computer Graphics Research: Three Years Later
Contributors: Theodore Kim, A.M. Darke, Alec Jacobson, Lohit Petikam, Curtis Andrus, Holly Rushmeier
Abstract: This BOF is for attendees interested in discussing issues of racial bias embedded in computer graphics research. It is a follow-on from the SIGGRAPH 2021 BOF, Countering Racial Bias in Computer Graphics Research Requires Structural Change, as well as the SIGGRAPH 2022 Talk and BOF, Countering Racial Bias in Computer Graphics Research. We will celebrate progress over the last three years, discuss setbacks, and brainstorm paths forward. This will be a friendly, collaborative space for mutual, authentic engagement across difference. Attendees can be at any stage, including learning about, taking steps toward, or enacting change in computer graphics research.

s_Tag: AI, Games, Interaction, Machine Learning, Workforce Training, New Technologies, Research & Education, Not Livestreamed, Not Recorded, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Prototyping with & Explaining AI Using Improv
Contributors: Patrick Pennefather
Abstract: Does your computational neural network need a break? Drawing from 25 years of experience facilitating improv from music, comedy, writing and clown, Patrick will facilitate an interactive and risk-free play session in a bold attempt to explain and for you to embody the mechanics of how different AI systems work. In addition, strategies from different improvisation traditions will give you plenty of tools to refine generated content iteratively inspiring new types of content creations. Come listen, come play, come and regenerate your creativity. Anticipate guest appearances.

Abstract: Join us for a panel featuring Women in Technical Leadership Roles in the Animation Industry. During this event, panelists would be sharing their career journeys, challenges they have overcome at work, ways they revive themselves through the tough schedules, resources/tips on their respective area of expertise, and thoughts looking ahead into the future.

sub_Title: Metachanges Painting: on Performative Data-Visualization
Contributors: CLARISSA RIBEIRO
Abstract: This BOF session is for attendees interested in 'performative data visualization' and 'generative design' exploring the use of weather data (open weather map) from Open Weather Map for 30 megacities (World Economic Forum), in the design of a graphic interactive experience in p5.js to revisit Roy Ascott's 1959 'Change Painting' and his 'Behaviorables and Futuribles' Manifesto, inviting the audience to performatively become aware of global temperature differences. By touching the screen to draw shapes whose color variation and audio are live weather data visualizations, the work engages viewers actively creating meaning from the available online information, using creative coding.

sub_Title: WiGRAPH Rising Stars in Computer Graphics Workshop - Part I
Contributors: Deepali Aneja, Xuan Luo
Abstract: The WiGRAPH Rising Stars in Computer Graphics program is designed to encourage people of underrepresented genders to become research leaders in computer graphics industry and academia. Rising Stars is a two-year program tailored for researchers within two years of entering the job market. The program will pair each participant with a senior mentor and invite them to join two workshops co-located with SIGGRAPH 2024 and SIGGRAPH 2025. Part I of the workshop will consist of mingling of rising stars participants, a panel, lightning talks from junior rising stars, and lunch.

sub_Title: Unionizing VFX and Games Workers in 2024 with I.A.T.S.E., the Entertainment Union
Contributors: Mark Patch
Abstract: This event will feature workers and organizers from successful organizing campaigns for VFX and Games workers at studios like Marvel, Disney, Lightstorm Entertainment, and Workinman Games. The program will be about the models and experiences of workers in unionizing their colleagues through a supermajority organizing strategy. We will feature 5 speakers and then have a time for Q + A.

sub_Title: Mini Entertainment Technology Summit at SIGGRAPH 2024
Contributors: Serguei Mokhov, Miao Song
Abstract: The Mini ET Summit at SIGGRAPH 2024, building up after its inaugural edition in 2016, promises a global, hybrid gathering of industry experts. Hosted by Drs. Miao Song and Serguei Mokhov, the event will feature past known speakers, such as Dr. Sudhir Mudur and others. Building on the success of CG in Canada in 2017 and an ET Summit summary event in 2018, and 2023 this edition will offer a range of presentations, a short screenings section, and live-streaming, accommodating both in-person attendees and remote presenters. Past events: (https://cciff.ca/Archive/2023/siggraph_c.html) (https://youtu.be/-DmRqrWCXwQ?t=635) (https://www.facebook.com/events/los-angeles-convention-center/cg-in-canada/1368791949857288/) (https://s2016.siggraph.org/birds-feather.html) (https://www.animationmagazine.net/2016/08/cciff-delegates-address-siggraph/)

sub_Title: Understanding and Customizing The O3DE Render Pipeline
Contributors: Molly Alexander
Abstract: O3DE, a full-featured, real-time MIT/Apache2 open source 3D engine, can be used to create high-fidelity games, robotic simulations and immersive 3D worlds. This session will focus on explaining how the O3DE Render Pipeline works, how to leverage its data driven nature, and in general how to customize it to suit your needs or artistic preferences. We will also discuss some endeavors to help O3DE move forward in the film/video space. [For SIGGRAPH site add: This BoF is part of a full day of open source BoFs hosted by the Academy Software Foundation as part of Open Source Days.]

sub_Title: OpenEXR
Contributors: Molly Alexander
Abstract: Join the OpenEXR Technical Steering Committee for an informal discussion about recent features and performance optimizations and future plans for GPU-based decompression and ABI stability. OpenEXR is the specification and reference implementation of the EXR file format, the professional-grade image storage format of the motion picture industry. [For SIGGRAPH site add: This BoF is part of a full day of open source BoFs hosted by the Academy Software Foundation as part of Open Source Days.]

sub_Title: Open MoonRay Update
Contributors: Molly Alexander
Abstract: It's been a bit over a year since DreamWorks' production renderer OpenMoonRay was released to the open-source community. We've been continuously active since then on new features and improvements for production rendering, community engagement and more. Come join as as we discuss the year in review, introduce new features and preview the coming roadmap. We'll also be demoing exciting functionality of OpenMoonRay + Arras distributed rendering. We're eager to chat with all rendering enthusiasts! SIGGRAPH site: This BoF is part of a full day of open source BoFs hosted by the Academy Software Foundation as part of Open Source Days.

sub_Title: OpenColorIO
Contributors: Molly Alexander
Abstract: All OpenColorIO (OCIO) users and contributors are invited to join the OCIO Technical Steering Committee for an informal discussion around OCIO 2.4 features, config updates, and future plans. This will include discussion of the nanoColor project (light-weight OCIO) and the ASWF Color Interop Forum. OCIO is an open source color management solution. [For SIGGRAPH site add: This BoF is part of a full day of open source BoFs hosted by the Academy Software Foundation as part of Open Source Days.]

s_Tag: AI, Animation, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, New Technologies, Production & Animation, Not Livestreamed, Not Recorded, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Academy Software Foundation Zero Trust Working Group
Contributors: Molly Alexander
Abstract: As workflows and assets move to the cloud, perimeter security is no longer adequate in many situations. New models, such as Zero Trust, are being used that require many clients and services to become security aware. For example, they may need to integrate with authentication and authorization services or to interoperate with logging, monitoring, or threat detection systems. The Academy Software Foundation recently announced a new Zero Trust Working Group (WG) to develop standards and best practices for implementing zero trust solutions in media production applications. Join us for a discussion about the new ASWF Zero Trust WG.

s_Tag: VR/AR/MR, Gaming & Interactive, New Technologies, Production & Animation, Research & Education, Not Livestreamed, Not Recorded, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: OpenXR
Contributors: Lisie Aartsen
Abstract: OpenXR is the widely adopted open standard for portable virtual and augmented reality. Discover how OpenXR is transforming the landscape of cross-platform XR development, empowering creators and innovators to deliver seamless, high-quality experiences across a wide range of devices. Engage in lively discussions as we explore the latest advancements, challenges, and best practices in leveraging OpenXR's versatile framework. This BOF offers a unique opportunity to network, exchange ideas, and stay at the forefront of the ever-evolving XR ecosystem.

sub_Title: Drawn In
Contributors: Arthur Collie
Abstract: The world of a busy artist is suddenly turned upside-down when his designs start coming to life. Struggling to find a balance, he realises that blindly pursuing his passion has its drawbacks.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Freelance
Contributors: Magnus Igland Møller, Peter Smith, Luciano A. Muñoz Sessarego
Abstract: A young hopefull knight reports for duty at the kings court. Little does he know that slaying dragons might not be his biggest challenge.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: The Swineherd
Contributors: Magnus Igland MØLLER, Peter Smith
Abstract: Hans Christian Andersen’s The Swineherd as you have never seen it before!

sub_Title: The War Within Announce Cinematic | World of Warcraft
Contributors: Anna Morgan
Abstract: Our heroes Anduin and Thrall find themselves drawn together by a radiant vision emanating from within the heart of the world.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Yellowbird
Contributors: Tsvetelina Zdraveva, Jerred North
Abstract: While living in New York, a young Bulgarian immigrant receives tragic news from overseas, and must choose between going home or staying in the US to maintain her legal status.

sub_Title: Doptelet Mechanism of Action
Contributors: Jack Nelson, Nick Klein, Andrew Swift, Pete Matthews, Emily Drapal
Abstract: This mechanism-of-action animation showcases the treatment of the autoimmune disorder, Immune thrombocytopenia (ITP). This technical and immersive animation shows how the compound may stimulate platelet production without inhibiting native thrombopoietin, which aids in effective platelet generation for chronic ITP patients who may be unresponsive to other treatments.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Coffee Brake
Contributors: Alex Weight, Raphael Gadot, Ross Anderson
Abstract: In drab office confines, Gary and Carol await their daily respite: The tea break. The highlight: A lone doughnut. As the clock strikes 3 the race for the last doughnut ignites, with Gary and Carol transforming their office chairs into turbocharged racing machines. But who will get there first?

sub_Title: LUKI & the Lights
Contributors: Toby Cochran
Abstract: LUKi, a charming and upbeat robot known for living life to the fullest, is diagnosed with the life-altering disease ALS. He must choose how to face life going forward.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Shellfish
Contributors: Justine Aubert, Cassandra Bouton, Grégoire Callies, Maud Chesneau, Anna Danton, Loic Girault, Gatien Peyrude, Justine Raux
Abstract: In a French rocky inlet, Bernard, a small and selfish hermit crab loses his shell. He will has to face dangers of the beach to find an other one. In the company of a weird little crab which helps protecting him, both will lives multiples adventures that will befriend them.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Vidalia
Contributors: Camille Borg, Constance Cartaut, Diane Hamel, Tabatha Hugues, Morgane Jolivel, Emile Lachkar, Bastien L'Hourre, Enzo Regardin, Céline Soubrane
Abstract: In a massacred village, a part of the inhabitants is kidnapped by strange creatures. Only survivors, Cal and Vidalia decide to search for them.

sub_Title: After Grandpa
Contributors: Juliette Michel, Swann Valenza, Florian Gomes Freitas, Axel Sence, Victoria Leviaux
Abstract: Haunted by the terrifying ghost of his Grandpa, Loup, a little boy obsessed with insects, will have to outcome his fear to discover why it came back.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: The Last of Us
Contributors: Stephen James
Abstract: As a main VFX partner for HBO’s hit series ‘The Last of Us’, DNEG was tasked with recreating the dystopian world from Naughty Dog’s acclaimed video game. The DNEG team delivered award-winning VFX, including designing overgrown environments, constructing skylines, building mountains, and destroying buildings, to showcase the post-apocalyptic world.

sub_Title: Goodbye my World
Contributors: Quentin DEVRED, Estelle BONNARDEL, Maxime FOLTZER, Astrid NOVAIS, Florian MAURICE, Baptiste DUCHAMPS
Abstract: The world is about to end, and a man stuck in a fish costum attempts to cross the chaos of the city to reach a mysterious tower.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Still Here
Contributors: Remi Kozyra
Abstract: Still Here est la cinématique de la saison 2024, de League of Legends. Cette dernière met en scène plusieurs visages familiers parmi la liste des champions de LoL. On découvre des batailles épiques de chacun de ces champions affrontant la mort, dans le passé, le présent et le futur.

sub_Title: Cycle
Contributors: Amelie Devauchelle, Eva Degli-Innocenti, Loreline Clément, Lucie Amherdt, Clemence Fischbach
Abstract: Nest, an eleven year old girl, decorates her cocoon : everything is calm and minimalist, surrounded by vegetation with a pastel hue. Suddenly, a shadow changes the brightness of her surroundings.

sub_Title: Wondermom
Contributors: Clémence Provost, Lisa Tardieu, Maud Grainger, Mariam Ulmasova, Manon Benet
Abstract: During her pregnancy, Alice learns from her super mom handbook that nothing is more wonderful than having a child. But when the baby is born, she fonds herself overwhelmed by the idealized expectations she had of motherhood.

sub_Title: True Detective: Night Country - Cinesite VFX and Animation
Contributors: Simon Stanley-Clamp, Simon Wottge, Manuel Reyes, Sabine Janetzka
Abstract: The opening sequence of True Detective: Night Country is almost entirely CG. Much of the caribou movement was created using key frame animation techniques. The groom was developed to include realistic clumping, and clinging snowflakes. Additional VFX include a polar bear and weather throughout the season.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem - Cinesite
Contributors: Chris Kazmier, Ezequiel Mastrasso, Eric Cheung, Chris Springfield
Abstract: Cinesite contributed 21 minutes of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, adding its distinctive visual style to match the rest of the film. Full of exaggerated strokes and effects lines, director Jeff Rowe wanted it to resemble school notebook sketches he made as a teenager, imperfect and with a rough brush feel.

sub_Title: Cuisine Exchange
Contributors: Yves Geleyn, Michael Thurmeier
Abstract: Co-Directors Yves Geleyn and Michael Thurmeier, and Art Director Mike Knapp reunite for the second Kroger holiday campaign to tell a heartwarming tale about how great food connects us all. The spot evokes the same warmth as its predecessor while taking a fresh approach with a classic Kroji look.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: IWÁJÚ - Cinesite
Contributors: Ellen Poon, Adel Abada, Andrew Gartner, Stéphanie Roy
Abstract: Iwájú is a six-part series animated by Cinesite for Disney+, with Pan-African studio Kugali. Set in a futuristic Lagos, Nigeria, creating the vibrant, densely-populated and asset filled mainland market was a significant achievement. Lagos has been created with meticulous attention paid to cultural accuracy, including food, customs, mannerisms and language.

sub_Title: The Sun is Bad
Contributors: Rachel Mow, Ivan Chui, Laura Correal, Quinn Marsh, Liren Sun, Chenrui Lan, Elle Yeung, Hazel Wong, Henry Ni, Rielle Yap Ong, Samson Flanagan
Abstract: Set in Hong Kong during the late 80s, a temperamental girl tries to destroy the sun and stop it from melting her city using toys and whatever she has.

sub_Title: Origami
Contributors: Kei Kanamori
Abstract: Origami is a 3D sculpture created by folding a piece of paper. It does not involve cutting or glueing; any origami can return to its original state once unfolded. This concept resembles life rising from dirt and returning to the Earth at the end of its cycle.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Silhouette
Contributors: Alexis Lafuente, Marc Forest, Antoni Nicolaï, Elliot Dreuille, Baptiste Gueusquin, Chloé Stricher
Abstract: Silhouette tells the story of Claire, a young woman who has just moved to a big city. She soon finds her body gradually disappearing.

sub_Title: Atmospheric Carbon Dioxide Tagged by Source
Contributors: AJ Christensen, Greg Shirah, Helen-Nicole Kostis, Anansa B. Keaton-Ashanti, Mark Subbarao, Brenda Lopez-Silva, Lesley Ott
Abstract: Carbon dioxide is the most prevalent greenhouse gas driving global climate change. Currently, Earth's land and ocean carbon sinks collectively absorb about half of human emissions every year. NASA uses advanced computer modeling techniques to study the influences of sources and sinks on how carbon moves in the atmosphere.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Bent Out of Shape
Contributors: Chloe Merwin
Abstract: When a bright, circular woman moves into a dull, square neighborhood, things begin to change... much to her square neighbor's dismay.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Beyond the Farm
Contributors: Allison Fraidenburg
Abstract: When a sprightly, young goat uncovers a majestic view of ancient Greece, he sings about leaving the farm to explore the world, but is held back by his protective dad.

sub_Title: Dandelion
Contributors: Ling Zhao, Zhengwu Gu
Abstract: In a dystopian world, a coal-burning robot working on a mine one day finds something that he has never seen before - a dandelion.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Head in The Clouds
Contributors: Kaylee Tian Lin Tan
Abstract: A quirky student who daydreams with her head high in the clouds must creatively elude her strict math teacher to remain there.

sub_Title: Spark: Milky Way Evolution
Contributors: Ryan Wyatt, Mike Schmitt
Abstract: The visualization-based Spark: The Universe in Us planetarium show includes an immersive journey through a three-dimensional model of the Milky Way, merging observed and computational data. Astrophysical simulations also turn back the clock on our galaxy’s evolution to reveal the origin of atoms that formed the Solar System.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Meta Quest | Asgard’s Wrath 2 Cinematic Launch
Contributors: Ivan Guerrero, John Likens
Abstract: cinematic launch films, animation was achieved via motion capture with stunt performers, followed by layout, previs in Unreal. Integrating live action plates with UE5 content posed challenges, requiring adaptation of our VFX pipeline. Game assets were enhanced for cinematic quality shared between VFX teams, utilizing Unreal's meta-humans, facial performance capture.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Draw For Change! We Exist, We Resist
Contributors: Sara Fatucci, Mariana Cadenas Sangronis, Evelien De Graef, Hanne Phlypo
Abstract: Enter the vibrant world of Maremoto, join her on an afternoon of making street art and experience what it feels like to move as a woman through a metropolis in Mexico, a country where 10 women are murdered every day and tens of thousands go missing.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Spots of Light
Contributors: Sara Fatucci, Adam Weingrod, Kobi Mizrahi, Sean Thomas Evans
Abstract: Dan Layan tragically lost his sight during an Israeli military intervention in Lebanon in 1982. After 25 years in the dark, an experimental surgical procedure brings him the miraculous opportunity of recovering his sight. This VR experience uses personal archives to allow you to relive this introspective journey.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Errances
Contributors: Gwenael François
Abstract: Errances is a VR trip through a desolate & majestic world aboard a futuristic train. Through electronic music by Ryvage, this immersive meditation reveals our technological choices and consequences.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Emperor
Contributors: Oriane Hurard
Abstract: An interactive and narrative experience which invites the user to travel inside the brain of a father who is suffering from aphasia. Alongside his daughter, we journey into the father’s mental space—imagined as a hand-drawn, monochrome landscape—as she seeks to learn more about his inner self, now obscured by illness.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: A Vocal Landscape
Contributors: Omid Zarei, Anne Jeppesen
Abstract: A Vocal Landscape is a hyperrealistic VR film that explores the strange anatomy of a conversation between two people. Through a dreamlike journey, you travel to an ever-changing room where hyperrealistic visuals highlight the unspoken associations each make: opening a fresh way of looking at the uneven paths of communication.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Astra
Contributors: Wan-Chen HUANG, Aurélie Leduc
Abstract: A Mixed Reality Experience that transports you from Earth to the deepest corners of the cosmos as you embark on a quest to uncover the key ingredients of life in the Universe. Step foot on planets and their dark moons in a search for future worlds and far away beings.

s_Tag: Art, Education, Geometry, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Introduction to Scripting in Blender3D: Computational Geometry Algorithms
Contributors: MICHAEL SHAH
Abstract: Blender3D is a powerful tool and enhanced further with scripting! In this interactive course, I show how to get started scripting in the Blender3D ecosystem using Python. The course is targeted towards artists and programmers with basic programming experience. Participants will leave understanding how to create scripts solving geometry problems!

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: The Real-Time Frontier: Stylized Feature Quality Storytelling in Unreal Engine
Contributors: David Alve, Josh Carroll
Abstract: SPICE FRONTIER represents Steamroller Animation’s foray into Stylized Feature Quality Storytelling utilizing Real-Time Technology. We’ll detail our efforts to create a memorable Stylized 2D Look as well as our technical developments pioneering new workflows to produce long-form content in real-time using Unreal. Join us to discuss our latest adventure!

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: FlowZen: Using Hybrid-haptic and Particle for Enhancing Immersive Experience via Continuous Illusion of Wind
Contributors: Yang-Sheng Chen, Grace Theodore, Jing-Yuan Huang, Chiao-En Hsieh, Ping-Hsuan Han, Yi-Ping Hung
Abstract: FlowZen is a hybrid-haptic system with particle effect, integrating handheld haptic devices with a stationary fan, designed to enhance wind and thermal haptic feedback through tactile illusion.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Case Study: Creating the Infrastructure for Ethical AI Use at Savannah College of Art and Design
Contributors: Dan Bartlett
Abstract: The case study explores and reflects upon the implementation of artificial intelligence tools and infrastructure at Savannah College of Art and Design. From planning to execution, this study will reflect upon the impact of AI tools within a digital arts curriculum.

s_Tag: Scientific Visualization, Arts & Design, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Demystifying Color in Your Digital Media and Data Visualizations
Contributors: Theresa-Marie Rhyne
Abstract: This course examines the basics of color theory and explores discoveries like Magenta is not a spectral color. New to 2024, we demonstrate using Generative AI to expand your data color scheme choices. The course is intended for a broad audience interested in understanding, applying, and building digital color schemes.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Performance Driven Character Effects in 'The Garfield Movie'
Contributors: Kristin Farrensteiner, Freddy Chaleur, Christopher Kilshaw, Gunjan Kathale, Francesca Galluzzi, Francesco Del Fuoco
Abstract: The stylized animation in The Garfield Movie posed technical challenges, including detachable limbs and animated stripes. Our automated PFX workflow addressed these challenges, ensuring reliable character grooms for extreme poses and facial expressions, providing a scalable solution for performance-driven shot productions.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: An Artist-friendly Method for Procedural Skin Generation and Visualisation in Houdini
Contributors: Josefine Klintberg, Rasmus Haapaoja
Abstract: In this talk, we present a procedural approach to generate and visualize skin textures in Houdini. We focus on an artist-friendly method where the user has multiple settings to tweak and adapt to create different skin appearances, while being able to utilize the Houdini viewport to quickly inspect the result.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: An OpenUSD Production Pipeline With Very Little Coding
Contributors: Francois Lord
Abstract: We designed a production pipeline fully relying on the OpenUSD standard for producing animated short films in parallel workflow. The work required very little coding, relying instead on the procedural nature of Houdini. This pipeline was used in a university but could be used in a small studio as well.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Simulation and Representation of Topology-changing Rolling Waves for Massive Open Ocean Games
Contributors: Vladimir Lopatin
Abstract: We are proposing a novel method of capturing a physical wave simulation data with a set of approximation curves that can deal with overhangs, changing topology, and strict budget requirements in a massive open-world game where variability, artistic control, and performance are of primary concern.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Windmill
Contributors: Tianran Xia
Abstract: Windmill is a VR storytelling experience about how a little boy tells an old painter named Daniel to embrace life by using color. The environment is a monochromatic wheatfield that looks like a painted world.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Acoustic Garden: Exploring Accessibility and Interactive Music With Distance-related Audio Effect Modulation in XR
Contributors: Yufan Xie, Lisa Little
Abstract: In a garden, pheromones carried in the air guides creatures, gliding through the garden and alighting gracefully on each blooming flower. This process symbolizes a deeper perception and symbiosis, resonating with our augmented sense, enabling alternative non-visual means to navigate the world and create our own experience.

s_Tag: AI, Games, Hardware, Machine Learning, Mobile, Real-Time, Rendering, Gaming & Interactive, New Technologies, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Moving Mobile Graphics
Contributors: Jesse Barker, Ralph Potter, Liam O'Neil, Timo Heinäpurola, Sebastien Aaltonen, Shun Cao
Abstract: We present a technical introduction to mobile graphics spanning the spectrum of hardware, software, and developer experience, exploring the state of the art. We look at how physically based shading, global illumination, and neural graphics techniques can be brought to mobile, and developer experiences of pushing mobile graphics.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Metapunch X: Combing Multidisplay and Exertion Interaction for Watching and Playing E-sports in Multiverse
Contributors: Kuan-Ning Chang, Chia-Hui Lin, Yu-Hsiang Weng, Yu-Hin Chan, Po-Hsun Chen, Pei-Cih Zeng, Chien-Hsing Chou, Wen-Hsin Chiu, Ping-Hsuan Han
Abstract: Metapunch X is an encountered-type haptic feedback esports game that integrates exertion interaction in XR with multidisplay spectating. The game is designed as an asymmetric competition, utilizing an XR head-mounted display and a substitutional reality robot to create an immersive experience to the players and audiences.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Gender Diversity of Graphics Conference Leadership
Contributors: Alec Jacobson
Abstract: Non-male researchers, like women and non-binary individuals, are underrepresented in computer graphics conference leadership roles. Analysis of historical data reveals disparities, positive trends, and concerning constants. This talk aims to guide future decisions, acknowledging past successes to inspire improvement. Recent failures in addressing community sexual harassment underscore this topic's urgency.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: WaterForm: Altering the Liquid to Generate Multisensory Feedback for Enhancing Immersive Environment
Contributors: I-Chin Chen, Hsin-Chia Chang, Chia-Yi Hung, Chi-Yu Lin, Kuan-Ning Chang, Ping-Hsuan Han
Abstract: WaterForm is a liquid-transformation system that utilizes liquid to generate multisensory feedback, including water splash, water flow, gravity, wind, resistance, buoyant force, mechanical energy, and mist, to enhance the immersive environment. In our demonstration, we developed a relaxation application with a virtual East landscape for exploring self-awareness via immersive storytelling.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Emerging Approaches in CG Education Aimed at Enhancing Visual Communication Skills Through Reverse Engineering
Contributors: Harutaka Matsunaga, Kazunori Miyata
Abstract: Japanese vocational schools apply reverse engineering in CG production education, developing tools to analyze the interplay between words, visuals, and artistic elements. This method is educational and enjoyable, using AI technologies like ChatGPT to enhance CG education with skills in communication and creativity.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Extensions of HyperPose: Echo, Savant, Loop
Contributors: Alex Bereznyak, Mehdi Farrokhtala
Abstract: Building on the HyperPose concept, we offer early glimpses into applications beyond the realm of the animation system. Echo is an approach to motion stylization; Savant addresses secondary motion (cloth, muscles, hair, and props); and Loop presents a mathematically driven model to enhance the efficiency and quality of motion capture.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Shadow of HyperPose: New Animation System
Contributors: Alex Bereznyak
Abstract: This presentation details HyperPose, an innovative animation system that represents motion through strategically chosen samples (principal dynamic poses) integrated into a procedural state machine. State navigation is achieved via a cost function, optimizing the system's efficiency and realism in animation. Data is represented as a four-dimensional hyperpose.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Audio2Rig: Artist-oriented Deep Learning Tool for Facial and Lip Sync Animation
Contributors: Bastien Arcelin, Nicolas Chaverou
Abstract: Audio2Rig is a new deep learning-based tool leveraging previously animated sequences of a show to generate facial and lip sync rig animation from an audio file. Based in Maya, it is able to learn from any production rig without any adjustment and generates high-quality and stylized animations.

s_Tag: Education, Pipeline, Production, Rendering, Production & Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Shader Writing in Open Shading Language
Contributors: Mitch Prater
Abstract: This introductory course on writing Open Shading Language shaders provides an overview of how to access data sources used for all shader pattern generation, examples of all types of conversion and pattern generation functionality, and covers parameter UI creation, a simple build system for shader deployment, and shader debugging techniques.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Props and Rocks: Passive Haptic Mixed Reality for Navigating Far-off Worlds
Contributors: Michael Vincenty, Joshua Grebler, Cindy Piza, Ozara Dalgo, Taro Narahara
Abstract: Our project immerses participants in a world blending virtual and physical realities. Users navigate a divided society, solving spatial puzzles and interacting with props via haptic feedback. Employing innovative techniques, including stencil buffer and redirected walking, our project seamlessly transitions between virtual worlds, advancing VR integration and offering educational opportunities.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Neutral Tone Mapping for PBR Color Accuracy
Contributors: Emmett Lalish
