Abstract: We present a new tone mapping function, designed specifically for the needs of 3D e-commerce: faithful reproduction of material base color in the output of physically based rendering under neutral lighting, without blown-out highlights or other visual artifacts. It eases asset validation and fixes saturation loss and hue skews.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Art Directable Underwater Explosion Simulation
Contributors: Sean Flynn, Alexey Stomakhin, Joel Wretborn, Daniel White
Abstract: We present a technique for simulating underwater explosions using an animated volume control method that allows us to visually approximate the expansion and contraction of underwater explosions measured in existing literature.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Mirror-Transcending Aerial Imaging System for Multiple Users
Contributors: Motohiro Makiguchi, Ayami Hoshi, Ayaka Sano, Takahiro Kusabuka, Hiroshi Chigira, Takayoshi Mochizuki
Abstract: We present a system that enables multiple users to share the viewing experience of mirror-transcending aerial imaging, in which virtual objects continuously move between mirrored and physical spaces. The prototype looks like a three-sided mirror, allowing four to five users to participate in the viewing experience and share their impressions.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Integrating Independent Contributions in a Game Programming Assignment
Contributors: Chao Peng, Lizhou Cao, David Schwartz, Huadong Zhang
Abstract: For game development majors, mastering data structures and algorithms (DSA) is essential. However, in traditional DSA and programming courses, assignments prioritize individual efforts, which diverge from the collaborative nature of game development. Our approach promotes distributed collaboration in individual assignments, simulating aspects of team dynamics without a formal team structure.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: GaussMR: Interactive Gaussian Splatting Sandbox With GPU Particles and Signed Distance Fields
Contributors: Daiki Taniguchi
Abstract: Our system enhances XR applications by employing 3D Gaussian Splatting as GPU particles for real-time interactions. Capable of processing millions of Gaussians, it integrates advanced physics simulations and achieves high-quality rendering, offering a new level of immersion in virtual environments.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: The Life and Legacy of Bui Tuong Phong
Contributors: Theodore Kim, Yoehan Oh, Jacinda Tran
Abstract: We examine the life and legacy of Bui Tuong Phong, whose shading and lighting models turned 50 last year. We trace his life through Vietnam, France, and the United States, its intersections with global conflicts, and present evidence that his name has been cited incorrectly over the last five decades.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Project Starline: A High-fidelity Telepresence System
Contributors: Jason Lawrence, Ryan Overbeck, Todd Prives, Tommy Fortes, Nikki Roth, Brett Newman
Abstract: Experience Project Starline, the first photorealistic telepresence system that achieves a sense of co-presence between remote participants that demonstrably outperforms today's 2D videoconferencing systems as measured by participant ratings, meeting recall, and nonverbal behaviors.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Crowdabunga! The Crowd Challenges of TMNT: Mutant Mayhem
Contributors: Benjamin Dupin, Gaëtan Luzy, Nicolas Chaverou
Abstract: To deliver believable and directable crowds for Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem, the teams at Mikros Animation had to think of new approaches for the crowd department to populate dozens of shots while matching the animation and visual style of the show.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Fate of the Minotaur
Contributors: Andreas Dahn, Leszek Plichta, Eduard Schäfer, Simon Spielmann, Justus Blönnigen, Andreas Mühlschlegel, Marc Fragstein, Lisa Forelli, Alexander Kreische, Volker Helzle
Abstract: Descend into the Labyrinth of the Minotaur and confront him to get free — a free roaming VR experience for up to four players.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: There Can Be (at least) Two Introductory Graphics Courses: Teaching Introduction to Non-interactive Computer Graphics
Contributors: Michael Shah
Abstract: In this talk, we discuss a second alternative and complementary introductory graphics course focused on non-interactive computer graphics that may be taken at nearly any point in the curriculum after a first programming course. This course may better foster a diverse pool of students to garner interest in computer graphics.

s_Tag: Diversity & Inclusion, Dynamics/Simulation, Education, Geometry, Modeling, Production, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: More Than Killmonger Locs: A Style Guide for Black Hair (in Computer Graphics)
Contributors: Theodore Kim, A.M. Darke
Abstract: We will cover recent advances in the depiction of Black hair, otherwise known as kinky, or Afro-textured hair. This includes the open-source Code My Crown guide, the Open Source Afro Hair Library, and the Lifted Curls simulation technique. Models, source code, and step-by-step instructions are provided.

s_Tag: Education, Research, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: An Introduction to Quantum Computing
Contributors: Andrew Glassner
Abstract: Quantum computing is a radically new approach to creating algorithms and programs. By exploiting the unusual behavior of quantum objects, this new technology invites us to re-imagine the computer graphics methods we know and love in revolutionary new ways. This course is math-free and requires no technical background.

s_Tag: Animation, Modeling, Production, Rendering, VR/AR/MR, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: An Introduction to the Fourier Transform
Contributors: Andrew Glassner
Abstract: The Fourier Transform is fundamental to computer graphics, explaining ideas from aliasing and sampling to image compression and filtering. This friendly course explains the principles in words, pictures, and a little bit of high-school math. The concepts are the important thing. We show that they are comprehensible, useful, and beautiful.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: A Procedural Production System for Autonomous Vehicle Simulation
Contributors: Vincent Serritella, Viktor Lundqvist, Matt Webb, Taylor Shaw, Riley Niu, Zach Repasky, Robert Graf, Magnus Wrenninge
Abstract: In this work, we discuss the procedurally based simulation production system developed at Aurora, which forms a key part of the company’s approach to testing and validation.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Labs Hands-On Class: NIMEW - New Interface for Musical Expression on a piece of Wood
Contributors: Michael Shiloh, Michael Shiloh
Abstract: In this lab you will build an electronic circuit on a piece of wood that turns into a musical instrument. Creativity and non-conformity are encouraged. You will keep your creation with which you can entertain or annoy your family, friends, and colleagues. No prior skills are required; all materials provided.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Labs Hands-On Class: Build Your Own IoT Love Messengers
Contributors: Yi Qing Ng, Julia Daser
Abstract: In this course, participants build their very own Love Messengers — connected to each other via a real-time database. When one Love Messenger is pressed, the other will light up, no matter how far apart they are. This playfully introduces IoT, basic C++ code, electronics, and fabrication techniques.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: CG Animation, Neurodiversity, and Autistic College Students
Contributors: Judy Kriger, Jane Thierfeld Brown, Amy Rutherford
Abstract: With 40% of our Animation + VFX students registered with the Office of Disability and Accessibility Services, it is often challenging for students to meet the course requirements in the 3D animation courses. How can we as CG artists and educators do a better job of supporting this large population?

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: The Future of Teaching Computer Graphics
Contributors: Edward Angel, Dave Shreiner
Abstract: Advances in computer graphics have dramatically increased the complexity of teaching a basic course in computer graphics. We address: Is it time for a new way to teach computer graphics? We present a proposal for answering it, along with some of our explorations into teaching in this new environment.

s_Tag: AI, Computer Vision, Dynamics/Simulation, Machine Learning, Research, Robotics, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Warp: Differentiable Spatial Computing for Python
Contributors: Miles Macklin, Nicolas Capens, Zeshun Zong, Pingchuan Ma, Peter Yichen Chen, Gergely Klar
Abstract: This course offers an in-depth exploration of NVIDIA Warp, a cutting-edge Python framework designed for GPU-accelerated data generation and spatial computing. Attendees will dive into Warp's fundamentals to understand its design principles, and master its application across simulation, AI, robotics, and machine learning with hands-on projects from NVIDIA and MIT.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Large Scale Sand Simulations on Under The Boardwalk
Contributors: Jonathan Davies, Cheten Sharma, Nicholas New
Abstract: The feature animation Under the Boardwalk contained hundreds of sand shots of varying complexity and needed an automated workflow to assist the FX team to prepare and run simulations. A seamless look to the sand was achieved, from super close-up macro shots to wide beach vistas.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Wig Refitting in Pixar’s Inside Out 2
Contributors: Ben Porter, Jacob Speirs, Fernando de Goes
Abstract: We present a custom refit rig for assisting the sharing and reuse of hair grooms between models of different shapes and mesh connectivities. Our technique was used in Pixar's feature film Inside Out 2, transferring various styles of wigs from human characters to their respective emotion characters.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Ellic's Exercise Camp: Engaging Children in Physical Activity Through Virtual Reality Gaming
Contributors: Lizhou Cao, Cielo Serna, Huadong Zhang, Chao Peng
Abstract: Integrating VR into children's exercise routines transforms physical activity into thrilling adventures with our game's vibrant cartoon virtual exercise camp. Featuring easy-to-learn mini-games based on sports, guided by cute characters, it promotes fun, engaging exercise, encouraging kids to joyfully incorporate fitness into their daily lives.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Level-Up Logics: Leveraging Three Game Design Platforms to Teach Coding
Contributors: Topher Maraffi
Abstract: Coding has become an integral tool for designers, but the logical structures of programming can be intimidating for many students in the arts. We progressed students through three game design platforms to teach interaction logics, and students chose scripting over visual programming to complete their final projects.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Sony Imageworks Animation Layout Workflow With Unreal Engine and OpenUSD
Contributors: Jonghwan Hwang, Tzung-da Tsai, Dan Ziegler
Abstract: The new pipeline at Imageworks uses Unreal Engine as the tool for Rough Layout, and we use the USD filetype to get data from the Windows environment of Unreal Engine into the Linux-based production pipeline. We cover issues we faced and the pipeline we built in order to use Unreal.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Efficient Visibility Reuse for Real-time ReSTIR
Contributors: Yusuke Tokuyoshi
Abstract: Spatiotemporal reservoir resampling (ReSTIR) is a powerful importance sampling technique, but it can still produce significant noise on shadow edges and contact shadows. To reduce the shadow noise, we introduce a simple and efficient visibility estimation that reuses the visibilities of spatiotemporal neighbor samples.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: RobotSketch: An Interactive Showcase of Superfast Design of Legged Robots
Contributors: Joon Hyub Lee, Hyunsik Oh, Taegyu Jin, Seung-Jun Lee, Junwoo Yoon, Jemin Hwangbo, Seok-Hyung Bae
Abstract: We showcase an interactive system that lets robot designers to directly 3D sketch and experience robots in real scale from an immersive VR workspace. The concept robots learn to walk through reinforcement learning in a physics simulation, allowing the designer to control them in real time using VR controllers.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Dynamic Screen Space Textures for Coherent Stylization
Contributors: Brent Burley, Brian Green, Daniel Teece
Abstract: Disney Animation’s Wish called for a watercolor style, requiring novel dynamic screen space textures to achieve a unique illustrative look. Our textures are able to track animation and camera movement while maintaining screen space qualities, avoiding issues encountered with traditional screen space textures.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: A Diffusion-Based Texturing Pipeline for Production-Grade Assets
Contributors: Winnie Lin, Dmitriy Smirnov, Richard Smith
Abstract: We introduce a pipeline for producing diverse high-quality textures for UV-unwrapped 3D assets via a Stable Diffusion Model. Our method is fast, controllable, and modular, allowing artists to work on production-grade assets and iterate quickly without making sacrifices to their standard workflows and tools.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Demonstrating Real-time Slow-motion Experience Through Parallel Video Presentation
Contributors: Goki Muramoto, Hiroto Saito, Sohei Wakisaka, Masahiko Inami, Goki Mur
Abstract: Real-time and slow-motion are incompatible in the technologies of recording and playback. We propose the method to partially coexist both using parallel video presentation based on the integrative capacity and the temporal nature of cognition. Users can experience the surroundings in slow-motion mode in real-time.

s_Tag: Education, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: A Whirlwind Introduction to Computer Graphics for Complete Beginners
Contributors: Mike Bailey
Abstract: For a beginner, walking into a SIGGRAPH is an intimidating experience. There is so much to see and do. Everyone else there seems to be speaking an unfamiliar language and are ooh’ing and ahh’ing over things that they appreciate but you don’t know how to. This course is for you!

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Lip-Sync ML: Machine Learning-based Framework to Generate Lip-sync Animations in FINAL FANTASY VII REBIRTH
Contributors: Masato Nakada, Leandro Graciá Gil, Akira Iwasawa, Ryo Hara
Abstract: We present a machine learning-based framework called Lip-Sync ML to generate lip-sync animations from audio input. In Final Fantasy VII Rebirth, we used audio clips and animations from our previous game title as training data and created high quality lip-sync animations efficiently with Lip-Sync ML.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: A Position Based Material Point Method
Contributors: Christopher Lewin
Abstract: We introduce a novel compliant constraint formulation of the Material Point Method that is stable at any time-step while remaining as easy to implement as an explicit integrator. We call this method Position Based MPM (PB-MPM).

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Unveiling the Invisible: Interactive Spatial Sensing Transforms Air Flow Measurement
Contributors: Julian Humml, Thomas Rösgen, Morteza Gharib
Abstract: Mapping and understanding air flows has traditionally been a complex challenge. By combining AI-powered guidance with the clear visualizations provided by augmented reality headsets, both specialists and beginners are empowered to explore and visualize air currents in ways that were previously unimaginable.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: ENVIZ: DreamWorks GPU-accelerated Interactive Environment Deformation and Visualization Toolset
Contributors: Arunachalam Somasundaram, Chris Michael
Abstract: ENVIZ is a toolset at DreamWorks Animation that uses the power of the GPU for both interactive hi-fidelity deformation and beauty visualization of environments in the 3D viewport. Artists can work iteratively in real-time with millions of points and evaluate motion in the 3D viewport, thus saving time and resources.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Voxelizing Google Earth: A Pipeline for New Virtual Worlds
Contributors: Ryan Hardesty Lewis
Abstract: Automating the conversion of Google Earth's 3D Tiles into voxels, our project introduces a scalable pipeline for generating interactive, voxel-based worlds in Minecraft and VR. This advancement offers novel ways to explore, educate, and engage with digital representations of Earth, enhancing the SIGGRAPH community's access to geospatial visualization.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Inclusive Community: Accessibility and Neurodiversity in Classroom, Industry, and Academia
Contributors: Mayet Andreassen, Cheryl Briggs, Shoko Kimura, Glenn Goldman, Judy Kriger, Miho Aoki, Nandhini Giri
Abstract: Neurodiversity, accessibility, and inclusive classrooms and workplaces are essential for the success of the individuals affected by various challenges and the entire SIGGRAPH community. This panel will discuss the current state of the issue, different types of accommodations, and helpful ideas to make the learning and working environment more inclusive.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Bridging the Gap Between Education and Practice in Japan's CG Industry: A Focus on Diversity and Evolving Perceptions
Contributors: Harutaka Matsunaga, Kazunori Miyata
Abstract: This study focuses on the competency gap between computer graphics (CG) educational institutions and CG companies in Japan, with an emphasis on the competencies required in the entertainment industry. The goal is to seek and examine viable solutions for establishing a sustainable CG education framework.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Designing Mobile Rendering Engines With 'Bindless' Vulkan
Contributors: Sergey Kosarevsky, Alexey Medvedev
Abstract: Bindless rendering opens up possibilities for GPU-driven rendering and raytracing. Challenges arise in transitioning existing engines from older APIs, requiring developers to rethink many previous approaches in 3D engine design. We share our insights into designing mobile bindless rendering engines for Vulkan 1.3 on Quest 3 devices.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Dynamic Acousto-Caustics in Dual-optimized Holographic Fields
Contributors: Koki Nagakura, Tatsuki Fushimi, Ayaka Tsutsui, Yoichi Ochiai
Abstract: We introduce Dynamic Acousto-Caustics a method that merges acoustofluidics with optics to dynamically manipulate light caustics by controlling the shape of liquid surfaces. Using computer-controlled acoustic fields to deform the surface of a liquid medium, we generate dynamic light behaviors in fluid patterns unachievable with static refractive surfaces.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Skin Wrinkle
Contributors: Arunachalam Somasundaram, Chris De St. Jeor
Abstract: Skin Wrinkle is a time-independent custom deformer tool at DreamWorks that produces wrinkles in the animated skin mesh geometry solely based on the incoming animated and rest skin meshes and artist-specified parameters. The deformer minimizes volume loss, performs continuous self-collision detection and resolution, and enriches the character's look.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Metahuman Theatre: Teaching Photogrammetry and Mocap as a Performing Arts Process
Contributors: Topher Maraffi
Abstract: We are developing a real-time animation pipeline that emphasizes motion capture as a performing arts process to create dramatic scenes with digital doubles. Framing the double as a performing object and adapting animation principles to performance capture, students learned a technical process in the context of a performing arts approach.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: XRweld: An In-situ Extended Reality Platform for Welding Education
Contributors: Tate Johnson, Ann Li, Andrew Knowles, Zhenfang Chen, Semina Yi, Yumeng Zhuang, Man To Tang, Daragh Byrne, Dina El-Zanfaly
Abstract: XRweld leverages extended reality to augment welding training. Due to the specific embodied knowledge of metal welding, it can be difficult to learn and master the subtleties without extensive, hands-on mentorship. XRweld enables performance analysis and real-time, in-helmet visual feedback to scaffold novice welders through their educational journey.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Teaching Design With Consumer-ready Artificial Intelligence and Virtual Reality: A Case Study
Contributors: Hoa Vo
Abstract: Consumer-ready technologies like AI and VR can benefit ideation and spatial perception. This study illustrates an educational approach of having interior design students employ AI and VR in a structured nine-week lighting design project. Results indicate significant improvements in creativity, showcasing the potential of advanced technologies in design education.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: ReVerie
Contributors: Pinyao Liu, Keon Ju Lee
Abstract: ReVerie is an immersive AI installation that visualizes textual dream data from the artist and the audience and creates a collective dream-reliving experience. Through a 3D generative diffusion model, the ReVerie system translates the whispering of dream objects into 3D visualization in real time to facilitate dream re-experiencing.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Real-time Refraction Shader for Animation
Contributors: Antoine Domon, Ankit Sinha, Zhicheng Ye, Valerie Bernard
Abstract: We present Animal Logic’s solution to simulate light refraction in deformable characters’ eye corneas in Autodesk® Maya®’s viewport. We show how we've integrated this feature into our USD pipeline and in Maya and how we produce results similar to an offline render without impacting interactivity for animators.

s_Tag: Education, Games, Geometry, Real-Time, Rendering, Gaming & Interactive, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: An Introduction to Creating Real-time Interactive Computer Graphics Applications
Contributors: Dave Shreiner, Edward Angel
Abstract: Interactive graphics are everywhere — from mobile device to gaming consoles to VR headsets — and creating those applications requires specific skills that this course introduces from first principles using an accessible programming approach.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Labs Hands-On Class: Experimenting With Artificial Intelligence: Programming Pathfinding Algorithms in C++ With Unreal Engine 5
Contributors: Deborah Yuen, Deborah Yuen, Josef Spjut
Abstract: Let’s make something to take back home as a souvenir! Join us in a beginner-friendly lab session on pathfinding algorithms for AI gameplay mechanics. Together, we will visually compare pathfinding algorithms and see them in action as an open-world game.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Premo: Integrated Versioning
Contributors: Stuart Bryson, Matthew C. Gong, Ben Kwa
Abstract: Premo is a SciTech Award winning animation application developed by DreamWorks. Recently, rigging was incorporated into the application. As introduced in SIGGRAPH 2023 [Bryson et al. 2023], Premo supports integrated versioning. This talk takes a deeper dive into the motivations of integrated versioning and how it was implemented in Premo.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: demoConstruct: Democratizing Scene Construction for Digital Twins Through Progressive Reconstruction
Contributors: Leon Foo, Chek Tien Tan, Liuziyi Liu, Nirmal S. Nair, Songjia Shen, Jeannie Lee
Abstract: demoConstruct aims to provide user-friendly and accessible collaborative 3D scene acquisition and editing methods for creating digital twins, through the use of progressive 3D reconstruction methods. Participants will collaboratively view and author immersive environments during the lab in near-real-time, using different devices such as mobile, VR HMD, and laptops.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: The Malleable-Self Experience: Transforming Body Image by Integrating Visual and Whole-body Haptic Stimuli
Contributors: Tanner Person, Nobuhisa Hanamitsu, Danny Hynds, Sohei Wakisaka, Kota Isobe, Leonard Mochizuki, Tetsuya Mizuguchi, Kouta Minamizawa
Abstract: The Malleable-Self Experience seamlessly integrates VR visuals and Synesthesia X1 whole-body haptic sensations to induce a malleable perception of one's body image. We use integrated visuo-haptic compositions in a particular sequence of steps to establish and maintain body ownership of a virtual body as it dramatically changes shape and form.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Empowering Creativity With Generative AI in Digital Art Education
Contributors: Caleb Kicklighter, Jinsil Hwaryoung Seo, Mayet Andreassen, Emily Bujnoch
Abstract: Given the significant impact of artificial intelligence on creative processes across various art disciplines, we are dedicated to exploring AI as a creative tool within educational environments. Beyond mere experimentation, our objective is to delve into the outcomes of this integration and its implications for both education and creativity.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Empowering Non-technical Users: Building Paper Circuit Boards With Zone-based Circuit Stickers
Contributors: Ruhan Yang, Ellen Do
Abstract: Zone-based circuit stickers support a wide range of components, suitable for small-scale paper circuit board fabrication. People with no technical background can make circuit boards at home with such stickers. This work promotes the integration of art, design, and interactive techniques, enabling a wider audience to participate in interactive design.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Chin Interfaces for Peripheral Interaction
Contributors: Brandon Ables
Abstract: The chin interface is a one, two, or three button wearable device that allows for peripheral interaction during everyday activities. Simple sensors and software take predictable and unpredictable movement data generated from activities like eating, exercising, practicing guitar, or using the computer to activate peripheral screens directed through the chin.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Alba: A Multimodal Rendering System for Autonomous Vehicle Simulation
Contributors: Ryusuke Villemin, Magnus Wrenninge, Steve Capell, Anton Gribovskiy, I-Chen Jwo, Steve Bako
Abstract: Modern rendering systems implement layers of specializations that target the use case of images for human consumption. In this paper, we discuss Alba, a multimodal rendering framework for camera, lidar, and radar, which targets the use case of autonomous vehicle simulation.

s_Tag: Machine Learning, Research, New Technologies, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Diffusion Models for Visual Content Generation
Contributors: Niloy Mitra, Daniel Cohen-Or, Duygu Ceylan, Minhyuk Sung, Paul Guerrero, Chun-Hao Huang, Or Patashnik
Abstract: This course aims to demystify the theory and practice behind training diffusion models for visual computing applications. We will provide a combination of easy-to-grasp theory and practical code examples to help develop an understanding of this new generative model, with a specific focus on those with a computer graphics background.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Self Examination: Pixar's Adventures in Stop Motion
Contributors: Nathan Fariss
Abstract: Pixar’s SparkShort, 'Self', represented a number of firsts for Pixar: The first use of stop-motion animation, the first collaboration with another studio, and the first use of a live-action visual effects workflow in Pixar’s pipeline. Here I explore our process while collaborating with Tippett Studio in the making of Self.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Seiler’s Interpolation for Evaluating Polynomial Curves
Contributors: Cem Yuksel
Abstract: Seiler’s interpolation allows evaluating polynomial curves, such as Bézier curves, with a small number of linear interpolations. It is particularly effective with hardware linear interpolation used in GPU texture filtering. We compare it to the popular alternatives, such as de Casteljau's algorithm, and present how it extends to higher-degree polynomials.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: A Modernization of the DreamWorks Feather System
Contributors: William Sokoloski, Cory Sivek, Arunachalam Somasundaram, Lakshika Udakandage, Kurt Phillips, Alexa Mahajan, Michael Juarez, Charles Edward Billingsley
Abstract: The DreamWorks Feather System is a modernized toolset that enables artists to manage all aspects of feathers from card layout through shot work by using intuitive tools and automated pipeline processes. These new artist-friendly developments have enabled dozens of artists to quickly groom characters and run their feathers in shots.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: The Tent
Contributors: Rory Mitchell, Sébastien Hameline, Miller Klitsner, Logan Davis
Abstract: When a woman discovers a mysterious tent has appeared in her front yard, she begins to question the meaning of activism and our shared humanity. The Tent is an Augmented Reality cinematic tabletop narrative and a glimpse of the future of spatial entertainment.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Cinematography of Pixar's Win or Lose
Contributors: Patrick Lin, Brian Boyd
Abstract: The story of Pixar first original long-form series Win or Lose is told between the real objective world and our characters’ subjective world. This presentation will take the audience through the series’ cinematic thought process and how different camera and lighting styles are used to represent the different worlds.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Labs Hands-On Class: Exploring Embodied Interactive Techniques: with Touchdesigner and Mediapipe
Contributors: Michael Bruner, Michael Bruner
Abstract: Creating embodied interactive experiences has historically required a host of custom hardware and sensors. With developments in computer vision and accessible software solutions it is now possible to create experiences using only a webcam and laptop. In this course we will demonstrate these tools and show potential applications.

s_Tag: AI, Machine Learning, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Generative Models for Visual Content Editing and Creation
Contributors: Anyi Rao, Yuanbo Xiangli, Yuwei Guo, Mia Tang, Chenlin Meng, Maneesh Agrawala
Abstract: This course covers the advances in generative models tailored for the computer graphics community. We will first cover the fundamental knowledge of generative models. Next, we will present state-of-the-art techniques for the application of generative models to image synthesis, image editing, compositional representation learning, and 3D asset generation.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Pixar’s Win or Lose — Stylized FX in an Animated Series
Contributors: Edwin Chang, Eric Lacroix, Aimei Kutt
Abstract: We discuss the stylized effects in Pixar's upcoming animated streaming series, Win or Lose.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Co-Presence, Connection, and Co-Creation: Building Real-time Cross-person Neurofeedback Interactions
Contributors: Tiange Wang, Xin Feng
Abstract: How can we transcend conventional human connection through immersive brainwave interactions? This talk presents the design and development of real-time, EEG-based interpersonal VR environments by discussing data pipelines, creative approaches to visualizing and animating brainwave data representations in cross-person settings, and design considerations and prosocial applications of collaborative neurofeedback experiences.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Labs Hands-On Class: Data Materialized: An Introduction to a Creative Workflow Translating Data Into Form
Contributors: Courtney Starrett, Susan Reiser
Abstract: We will guide participants through a workflow we call data materialization; a sub-genre of data art combining concept and data to generate 3D forms to be fabricated in a meaningful material. The universal feeling of worry will be the theme of this session; participants will design data worry beads.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Labs Hands-On Class: The Real Breadboard: Creating an Electronic Sandwich
Contributors: Jeremiah Teipen, Jeremiah Teipen
Abstract: Participants use electronic circuit prototyping techniques to create a satirical object that uses bread as a prototyping breadboard exposing the absurdity that accompanies certain technological advancements and our media-rich diets that creeps into everything, including your sandwich. Participants will take away their creations and increase their appetite for conceptual/technical experimentation.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Optimizing Assets for Authoring and Consumption in USD
Contributors: Harmony M. Li, George Rieckenberg, Neelima Karanam, Emily Vo, Kelsey Hurley
Abstract: In this talk, we introduce a new asset structure that helps to (1) streamline and decouple asset authorship and shot consumption, (2) enable new authoring workflows that better take advantage of USD’s multi-stage model, and (3) open the door for shot-focused, asset-based optimizations.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: A Pipeline for Effective and Extensible Stylization
Contributors: Harmony M. Li, Angela McBride, Sari Rodrig, Gregory Culp
Abstract: We present a stylization pipeline that provided all upstream departments automatically stylized renders representative of the final look of the film, the ability to iterate closely with lighting to when stylization changes were needed, and a centralized area for lighting to manage sweeping stylization changes across the show.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Creating the Wishes of Rosas
Contributors: Neelima Karanam, Joel Einhorn, Emily Vo, Harmony M. Li
Abstract: The wishes of Rosas are a central story device in Disney’s Wish. The art direction and narrative required that wishes react to external story events, interact with characters, and be artistically choreographed en masse. The breadth of these requirements drove the development of our unified wish asset and shot pipeline.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Art-directing Asha's Braids in Disney's Wish
Contributors: Avneet Kaur, Jennifer Stratton, David Hutchins, Nikki Mull
Abstract: For Disney’s Wish, in addition to the challenges of a stylized look, Asha's hairstyle comprises a full head of tightly braided locks which was far more complex than previous braid grooms. To art-direct Asha's stylized braids' performance, advancements were made in tools and workflows for grooming, simulation, and stylization techniques.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Holographic Parallax: 3D Holographic Near-eye Displays with Parallax Cues
Contributors: Seung-Woo Nam, Dongyeon Kim, Suyeon Choi, Juhyun Lee, Siwoo Lee, Manu Gopakumar, Brian Chao, Gordon Wetzstein, Yoonchan Jeong
Abstract: Recent advancements in holographic displays enable the creation of 4D light field holograms featuring view-dependent visual effects. Our holographic display prototype delivers an experience of state-of-the-art 4D light field holograms and highlights the significance of parallax cues in enhancing perceptual realism of 3D scenes.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: 360° Animation Projects by Students With a Background in Traditional Stop-motion Techniques
Contributors: Nahomi Maki
Abstract: This study introduces a unique challenge of stop-motion animation in 360° as a first step toward VR for students who have learned traditional handcrafted object modeling and stop-motion animation.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Volumetric Display With Dual-path Holographic Laser Rendering
Contributors: Kota Kumagai, Hisashi Oka, Kazuki Horikiri, Tetsuji Suzuki, Yoshio Hayasaki
Abstract: We developed a volumetric display that achieves to render palm-sized volumetric contents in real space. A single volume was formed by the cooperative dual-path laser rendering based on the optimal design of the optical system and scanning path. Graphics and animations with well-filled voxels were demonstrated in a centimeter-sized volume.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Creating Infinite Characters From a Single Template: How Automation May Give Super Powers to 3D Artists
Contributors: Mariana Dias, Pedro Coelho, Rui Figueiredo, Rita Carvalho, Veronica Orvalho, Alexis Roche
Abstract: To help populate games with 3D characters sharing a consistent art style, we propose an automated character generation pipeline that can produce a complete animatable character in less than a minute from an initial template character, based on 2D pictures and/or facial text descriptors.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Controlling the Color Appearance of Objects by Optimizing the Illumination Spectrum
Contributors: Mariko Yamaguchi, Masaru Tsuchida, Takahiro Matsumoto, Tetsuro Tokunaga, Takayoshi Mochiduki
Abstract: We have developed an innovative lighting system that changes specific target colors while maintaining a natural white appearance, by using implementing precisely spectral controlling of the spectral power distribution of illumination and metamerism. It was successfully showcased at the Paris Fashion Week 2024 Spring/Summer.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Breaking the Low Sample Rate Equals Low Power Paradigm Using an Event Based Vision Approach for Hand Tracking in AR
Contributors: Ryan Page, Paolo Baesso, Rory Clark, Greg Baker
Abstract: This demo from Ultraleap presents the first hand tracking pipeline using event cameras on an AR headset. Motivated by event cameras' ability to break the frame imaging paradigm of low power equates to low sample rate moves us closer to low power spatial computing in the glasses form factor.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Project Grand Path: An Inclusive, Interdisciplinary, Collaborative, Project Based Learning Model
Contributors: Julie Goldstein
Abstract: Project Grand Path (PGP) is leading the way to re-envision higher education in the 21st century by ‘mobilizing learners to be the architects of their education’. This interdisciplinary, collaborative, student centered. innovation hub is infused with a series of high impact learning experiences. Utilizing design thinking, cutting edge computer graphics and a mentorship program, PGP fosters an environment of inclusion and equity providing the opportunity for the next generation to dream up a new paradigm for the college experience.

s_Tag: Games, Real-Time, Rendering, Research, VR/AR/MR, New Technologies, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: High Performance Graphics 2024 Conference
Contributors: Esteban Clua, John Burgess, Karen Ghavam, Christiaan Gribble, Peter Shirley, Won-Jong Lee
Abstract: This panel will bring a short overview of the content related to the ACM High Performance Graphics 2024, the leading international forum for performance-oriented graphics and imaging systems research.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Intractable Live Free-viewpoint Video With Haptic Feedback
Contributors: Shaohui Jiao, Dehao Zhao, Yuzhong Chen, Shengdong Wang, Cong Xie, Bo Zhu, Ali Israr, Li Zhang
Abstract: An novel interactable FVV framework is presented to generate photorealistic and editable volumetric content with high degree of freedom. Firstly, an enhanced VH-NeRF is proposed to allow real-time interactions. Secondly, 2D video is transferred to FVV with a coarse dynamic mesh. Lastly, multiple interactions with haptic feedback can be experienced.

s_Tag: Capture/Scanning, Dynamics/Simulation, Medical, Modeling, Perception, Research, VR/AR/MR, New Technologies, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Beyond Life and Death: Exploring Digital Legacy With Spatial Media, Emerging Technologies, and Evolving Ethics
Contributors: Jacquelyn Ford Morie, Keram Malicki-Sánchez, Gregory Peter Panos
Abstract: This course examines digital legacy through history, practice, and discussion. Topics include volumetric capture, 3D scanning, AI, voice cloning, and how we capture our essence for posterity. It delves into history, current practices, and future implications for digital immortality and offers ethical discussions around posthumous rights and digital identity management.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Making Magic With 3D Volume Style Transfer
Contributors: Marie Tollec, Mike Navarro
Abstract: Disney’s Wish utilized advancements in Volumetric Neural Style Transfer in order to uniquely stylize 3D volume simulations with hand-drawn 2D textures and shapes. This technology helped inform and accelerate the visual development process, increase the reuse and efficiency of assets, and achieve styles with previously unachievable details.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Virtual Reality for Inward Contemplation
Contributors: Loup Vuarnesson, Bruno Herbelin, Olaf Blanke
Abstract: We propose a new approach of a neuro-engineered meditation, bringing technologies such as virtual reality (VR) and biofeedback to give practitioners new perspectives over their practice by targeting their own body and internal sensations.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Pixar's Inside Out 2: Character Rig Challenges and Techniques
Contributors: Jacob Speirs, Christian Hoffman, Michael Nieves, Brenda Lin Zhang
Abstract: The characters team on Pixar's Inside Out 2 shares some of the technical and design challenges on our character rigs and presents the rigging techniques used to solve them.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Look, Ma, No Matrices!
Contributors: Steven De Keninck
Abstract: In this talk, we'll show how one can use PGA (Plane-based geometric algebra) for industry standard tangent space normal-mapping, with 25% less vertex storage, for a comparable computational cost.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Character Stylization in Disney's Wish
Contributors: Avneet Kaur, Jennifer Stratton
Abstract: The look of characters in Wish is inspired by the storybook style of earlier Disney classics. Details in appearance, shading, and streamlined geometric shapes of models and grooms provide the foundation for the stylization and art-directed performance. A final compositing treatment produces the painterly watercolor look with hand-drawn influenced linework.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Familiar Feelings: Emotion Look Development on Pixar's Inside Out 2
Contributors: Ana Lacaze, Ben Porter, Jacob Kuenzel, Te Hu, Masha Ellsworth, Athena Xenakis, Markus Kranzler, Alexis Angelidis
Abstract: On Pixar’s Inside Out 2 (2024), we had the challenging task of resurrecting five well-known, technically complex emotion characters, as well as creating five additional emotion characters. We will discuss the elements of the character design and how their implementation has evolved from the original film to the sequel.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Elemental — Fireplace Flooding FX
Contributors: Amit Baadkar
Abstract: The talk will focus on planning, development, and execution of water effects in the fireshop flooding sequence in Disney and Pixar's Elemental.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Practical Use of Machine Learning in Visual FX and Animation: A Case Study From 'Superman and Louis' TV Series
Contributors: Andres Reyes Botello, Freddy Chávez Olmos, Juan Carlos Galindo, Weverton Alves
Abstract: In the VFX industry, AI's rise prompts discussion on job security and ethics. Boxel Studio optimizes AI to boost efficiency and quality, not replace creativity. Our talk, Practical Use of Machine Learning for VFX and Animation, showcases AI's role, emphasizing motion capture, generative AI, and copycat algorithms for enhanced productivity.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: End-to-end Automatic Body and Face Setup for Generative or User Created 3D Avatar
Contributors: Weiqi Shi, Maurice Chu, Dario Kneubuhler, Ervin Teng, Adam Burr, Tallon Hodge, Ian Sachs, Andrew Kunz
Abstract: We propose and implement a production level end-to-end pipeline to automatically bridge the gap between 3D humanoid models and body and facial animation ready avatars that are highly customizable with different clothing and accessories. Our pipeline can support a large variety of input, from realistic humans, robots, aliens to monsters.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: On Smoothly Varying Frame Timing in First-person Gaming
Contributors: Devi Klein, Josef Spjut, Ben Boudaoud, Joohwan Kim
Abstract: We present a user study using smoothly varying frame timing and variable refresh rate to measure user performance in FPS games. Through two experiments, we find that varying frame time affects the perception of smoothness, though we measure no additional impact on FPS aiming performance.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Making of Chameleon Transformation FX in KFP4
Contributors: Zachary Glynn, Jinguang Huang, Landon Gray, Hamid Shahsavari, Zhao Wang
Abstract: This talk introduces the FX work flows for the making of the Chameleon transformation in Kung Fu Panda 4.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Reframe: Recording and Editing Character Motion in Virtual Reality
Contributors: Qian Zhou, Aniruddha Prithul, Hans Kellner, Brian Pene, David Ledo, Sebastian Herrera Urrutia, Hilmar Koch, George Fitzmaurice, Fraser Anderson
Abstract: Join us for a live demo of creating life-like 3D character animations in VR! Attendees will use a novel VR animation authoring interface to record and edit motion. The system utilizes advanced VR tracking to capture full-body motion, facial expressions, and hand gestures, coupled with an approachable intuitive editing interface.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Spatial Storytelling in the Newsroom: Reconstructing News Events in 3D
Contributors: Malika Khurana, Karthik Patanjali, Nick Bartzokas
Abstract: When we create stories in 3D, we can go beyond words to help the reader feel they were there to experience and understand it. This talk shows how three visual stories in The New York Times create a sense of presence, using computer vision techniques, spatial audio, and 3D tiles.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Student / Futures: Creative Careers in Animation, Computer Graphics, and Interactive Techniques
Contributors: Johannes DeYoung, Claudia Davis, Clinton Fanelli, Mike Stroud
Abstract: Industry panelists share perspectives and insights for students, educators, and creative professionals who are considering careers in animation, computer graphics, creative technologies, and interactive techniques. Represented industry segments include animation and VFX, computer graphics and information systems, themed entertainment, and interactive educational technologies.

s_Tag: Games, Real-Time, Rendering, Gaming & Interactive, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Introduction to Real-Time Ray Tracing
Contributors: Chris Cascioli, Laura Reznikov
Abstract: We present an introduction to real-time ray tracing using DirectX Raytracing (DXR) API. Concepts demonstrated in DXR can be applied to other APIs or bridge the gap for those with offline ray-tracing knowledge. By the end of the course, participants will be able to render a triangle mesh in DXR.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Adjacencies
Contributors: Johannes DeYoung, Mike Rader
Abstract: Adjacencies (2022—ongoing) is an exploration in distance collaboration and creative exchange between artists and animation classes at Carnegie Mellon University and Yale School of Art. Modeled upon cadavre exquis, thematic prompts and material constraints guide the collective assembly of animated sequences through intervals of peer exchange and arrangement.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Polymorph, A Minimal Input Procedural Modeling Tool for Rapid Prototyping of Stop Motion Puppets at LAIKA
Contributors: Tyler Fermelis, Kingman Gallagher
Abstract: Polymorph is a minimal input voxel-poly toolset for interactive creation of stop motion puppet head and neck assemblies. It’s a Houdini-based toolset which generates complex procedural 3D print-ready geometry for replacement facial animation. Spatial constraints are dynamically solved, and geometry produced supports silicone molding and casting, vacuum forming, and more!

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Demonstrating Magnus: A Magnetic Hand Exoskeleton for Fast and Dexterous Finger Actuation
Contributors: Jun Nishida, Daisuke Tajima, Yasuko Namikawa, Shunichi Kasahara
Abstract: This submission presents Magnus, a novel hand exoskeleton powered by electromagnets that can provide high-speed, dexterous, and yet flexible finger actuation. Our demos feature assisted finger drumming that beyond original body capabilities and a first-person shooting gaming scenario where two players' hand gestures are combined, thus achieving higher gaming performance.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Studying Esports Competition: Piloting Methodology for User Studies During Tournaments
Contributors: Arjun Madhusudan, Josef Spjut, Ben Boudaoud, Joohwan Kim, Benjamin Watson
Abstract: In this talk, we discuss an alternate experiment methodology for esports studies that involves an actual tournament structure. Any research around esports can vastly benefit from including competitive and PvP motivations in player studies. We also discuss one such tournament-experiment that we conducted in the SIGGRAPH 2023 Labs.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Evolving a Testsuite for Shading and Rendering
Contributors: Daniel Greenstein, Lee Kerley
Abstract: This presentation will explore some of the software testing methodologies used at Sony Pictures Imageworks. Specifically, we will focus on our system for image-based testing and how it aids us in the production of both VFX and fully animated CG films.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: KineSway: Simulating Terrain Shaking Sensation by Alternating Tendon Vibration to Ankles
Contributors: Eifu Narita, Keigo Ushiyama, Izumi Mizoguchi, Hiroyuki Kajimoto
Abstract: We propose a cost-effective method to simulate ground sway and tilt in virtual environments using kinesthetic illusions. By applying vibratory stimuli to ankle tendons, our technique creates a perceptual sensation of movement without physical space requirements or actual motion, offering a safe and easy-to-install alternative to traditional motion platforms.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: SkillPicker: Tweezers for Recording and Training Dexterous Operations
Contributors: Noriyasu Obushi, Shohei Oshiro, Yusei Imai, Chikayoshi Matsudaira, Saku Kijima, Takehiko Kanazawa, Hirokazu Tsukaya, Masahiko Inami
Abstract: We propose a tweezers-like device named SkillPicker to facilitate unskilled experimenters to learn precise control of tweezers through presenting visualized pinch force and magnified image of the tip of tweezers.

s_Tag: Animation, Computational Photography, Computer Vision, Dynamics/Simulation, Geometry, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Rendering, Research, Gaming & Interactive, Production & Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Mathematical Optimization in Computer Graphics
Contributors: Adam Bargteil, Marc Olano
Abstract: Like a semester-long graduate seminar on Optimization in Computer Graphics and Interactive Techniques, this course looks at Optimization through the lens of a baker's dozen of Technical Papers selected by the lecturers. The lecturers will highlight similarities, differences, and historical threads through the papers.

s_Tag: Design, Education, Fabrication, Geometry, Maker, Modeling, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Troubleshooting and Cleanup Techniques for 3D Printing
Contributors: LANCE Winkel
Abstract: Learn hands-on techniques for identifying and cleaning up problematic geometry and staging 3D prints for improved results. Explore the most encountered problems creators and print vendors face. Discover how these problems are created, how to fix them, and develop a fluent understanding of the best practices to avoid them.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: A Resampled Tree for Many Lights Rendering
Contributors: Alejandro Conty, Pascal Lecocq, Chris Hellmuth
Abstract: We present a hybrid tree and importance resampling approach for many lights rendering in production scenes.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: The 'How-To' as a Post-AI Assessment Tool
Contributors: Roman Mitch
Abstract: This paper introduces the How-To as an assignment tool, merging reflective practice with interdisciplinary technical skills development. This simplifies the relationship between assessment and AI tools. The technique stems from the Māori concept of ako and offers valuable insights for creative and technical education.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Miruoto: Sports Event Atmosphere Visual Rendering Through Real-time Image and Sound Processing System
Contributors: Guillaume Gourmelen, Shutaro Toriya, Eiko Miya, Naohisa Shioura, Hiroyasu Iwata
Abstract: Did you already imagine how it would be to watch a sporting match without sounds? We developed a system that displays in real-time onomatopoeia, representing sounds during a sports event for hearing impaired and hearing public. In this way, they can enjoy manga-like onomatopoeia overlay on the match video stream.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: The Human-like Non-human Series: Data_Revoc (The Precursor to the Electrotactile Asura Series)
Contributors: Lai Jiun Ting
Abstract: The Human-like Non-human Series: Data_Revoc integrates electrotactile and mixed reality (MR) technologies to enhance the audience's cognitive abilities. We aim to provide a fantastical experience where participants undergo cognitive enhancement through audio visual + Electrotactile data visualization.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: HaptoRoom: Using Vibrotactile Floor Interfaces to Enable Reconfigurable Haptic Interaction Onto Any Furniture Surfaces
Contributors: Kiryu Tsujita, Takatoshi Yoshida, Kohei Kobayashi, Arata Horie, Nobuhisa Hanamitsu, Kouta Minamizawa
Abstract: HaptoRoom explores an innovative approach to reconfigurable haptic interaction through the use of array of vibrotactile floor interfaces. This technology allows for the reconfiguration of haptic feedback to be applied onto any furniture surfaces, enhancing user interaction and experience in physical environments.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: How to Control Mayhem: The Painted Look of Hair on TMNT
Contributors: Brian Gossart, Olivier Pierre, Anne-Claire Leroux, Gregory Coelho
Abstract: TMNT Mutant Mayhem (2023) aimed for a hand-crafted 2D look that was especially challenging for the look and feel of the groom. We developed a layered system that combined modeled geometry, curves, a stylized surfacing, rendering, and lighting approach to seamlessly integrate the groom in the rendering scenes.

s_Tag: Design, Interaction, Narrative, Scientific Visualization, Production & Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Visualization and the Science/Art of Making the Complex Simple
Contributors: Lars Riedemann, Karthik Patanjali, Kalina Borkiewicz, Kel Elkins
Abstract: Visualization, whether 2D or 3D, often involves dealing with complexity in the form of data, design, or concept in general. This panel will explore the challenges and solutions for effectively conveying ideas, drawing from the experiences of panelists from NASA, NCSA, and The New York Times.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: MOFA: Multiplayer Omnipresent Fighting Arena
Contributors: Botao Amber Hu, Yuchen Zhang, Sizheng Hao, Yilan Tao
Abstract: MOFA, a game framework that uses HoloKit X headsets, explores the design space of synchronous asymmetric bodily interplay in spontaneous collocated mixed reality. MOFA game prototypes like The Ghost, The Dragon, and The Duel, inspired by fantastic fiction scenarios, demonstrate that the strategic involvement of non-headset-wearers significantly enhances social engagement.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: FEELTECH Wear: Enhancing Mixed Reality Experience With Wrist to Finger Haptic Attribution
Contributors: Rodan Umehara, Harunobu Taguchi, Arata Horie, Yusuke Kamiyama, Shin Sakamoto, Hironori Ishikawa, Kouta Minamizawa
Abstract: FEELTECH Wear is a system that supports hand interactions with both virtual and real objects, allowing for seamless execution of each interaction. The hand-mounted device is equipped with four channels of rotational skin-stretch tactors at the wrist and vibration tactors at the thumb and index finger on each hand.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: FIRE: Mid-air Thermo-tactile Display
Contributors: Yatharth Singhal, Haokun Wang, Jin Ryong Kim
Abstract: This demonstration uses an ultrasound haptic display-based mid-air thermo-tactile feedback system. Our method involves directing heated airflow toward the focused pressure point produced by the ultrasound display to concurrently provide thermal and tactile cues in mid-air. We present this system with three different virtual environments.

s_Tag: Education, Mathematics, Perception, Research, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Bayesian Statistics: A Practical Introduction for Computer Graphics
Contributors: Mirinda Whitaker, Sarah Creem-Regehr, Bobby Bodenheimer
Abstract: This course offers a concise introduction to Bayesian statistics in computer graphics, addressing the limitations of frequentist methods and providing insights into interpreting non-significant results, particularly in studies with null effects or limited sample sizes.

s_Tag: Animation, Pipeline, Production, New Technologies, Production & Animation, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: USD in Production
Contributors: Reuben Bloom, Chris Rydalch, Pallav Sharma, Harmony Li, Nick Porcino, Sebastian H. Schmidt, Emily Vo
Abstract: Based on real production examples, this Universal Scene Description (USD) course will expand upon previously presented best practices for pipeline infrastructure and integration. Presenters will walk through how they are more powerfully leveraging USD, building flexible, context-driven workflows, while balancing optimizations for consumer and author performance.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Bringing Adventure Gaming to Life Using Real-time Generative AI on Your PC
Contributors: Garth Long, Arisha Kumar, Ria Cheruvu, Paula Ramos, Dmitriy Pastushenkov, Zhuo Wu, Raymond Chun Hing Lo
Abstract: This talk demonstrates real-time, high-quality gaming scenery generation, with Generative AI, running on-device, on a PC. We will walk attendees through the SW and HW optimization process of multiple Generative AI modalities, chaining audio transcription and diffusion models, and cover exciting new developments with temporal-consistent and depth estimation approaches.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Measuring How Project Starline Improves Remote Communication With Behavioral Science
Contributors: Eric Gomez, Greg Blascovich
Abstract: Project Starline creates a remote communication experience that feels like you’re together, even when you’re thousands of miles apart. In this talk, we share our framework for evaluating how Project Starline provides meaningful value to users beyond existing video conferencing technology using behavioral science and provide an overview of findings.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Drosera Obscura
Contributors: Thomas Tucker, Tohm Judson
Abstract: Drosera Obscura is an interactive installation that explores the evolution of a carnivorous plant thriving after humanity’s departure. We imagine the remnants of human existence — plastics, metals, and machinery — become elements in the life and ecosystem of this organism. This work incorporates VR with an interactive animatronic to create an immersive experience.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Bridging the Gap: Immersive Environments for Resettlement
Contributors: Milad Hosseini-Mozari, Krysti Nellermoe
Abstract: What does public space mean for newcomers in a country? What is the role of emerging technology in navigating those spaces? In this presentation, two project collaborators present the approach, method, and heart of the ongoing project between the University of Utah and the International Rescue Committee.

s_Tag: AI, Art, Computer Vision, Education, Rendering, Research, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Introduction to Generative Machine Learning
Contributors: Rajesh Sharma, Mia Tang
Abstract: This is an intermediate level course for attendees to gain a strong understanding of the basic principles of generative AI. The course will help build intuition around several topics with easy-to-understand explanations and examples from some of the prevalent algorithms and models including Autoencoders, CNN, Diffusion Models, Transformers, and NeRFs.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Labs Hands-On Class: Recipes for Creating Digital Game Prototypes
Contributors: Justin Johnson
Abstract: This course introduces participants to basic concepts that can be used to create game play mechanics for digital game prototypes in Unreal and Unity. The concepts provide a general foundation and how to combine and modify them as needed. Participants will have access to project files following the course.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Development of Real-time QA/QC Tools for AEC in Unity
Contributors: Philip Luhn, Adam Liss, Dave Willard
Abstract: While the AEC industry has utilized 3D CAD design software for years, the review process still typically involves commenting on 2D drawings or PDFs. We have developed a QA/QC tool using Unity that allows our engineers and project managers to review designs in real-time 3D.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: A Live Demo of Single-photon Imaging and Applications
Contributors: Sacha Jungerman, Varun Sundar, Mohit Gupta
Abstract: Single-photon sensors are a rapidly evolving imaging technology featuring the unique ability of sensing light at its finest possible granularity, viz., at the photon level. Our demo will exhibit several exciting capabilities of single-photon sensors, which is made possible by an interplay of novel algorithms and recently developed, large-format sensor arrays.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Exploring the Dichotomy of Nature and Tech Through an Interactive Media Assignment
Contributors: Justin Johnson
Abstract: This is a presentation of a mixed media assignment that challenges the dichotomy of nature and technology through the use of animation, 3D modeling, and physical making. The processes and outcomes of exemplar projects will be discussed as well as how they addressed the overall goal.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Prompt to Anything?: Exploring Generative AI's Iterative Potential in Mapping Show Production
Contributors: Guillaume Borgomano
Abstract: Prompt to Anything? highlights Moment Factory's exploration with Generative AI (Gen-AI) in enhancing location-based experiences and 3D mapping shows. This talk will outline our innovation journey from concept to execution, demonstrating Gen-AI's integration possibilities into large-scale projects, and sharing key insights and achievements, encouraging further creative investigations with Gen-AI.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Making STEAM: Build Your Custom Electric Guitar
Contributors: Sara Sanders
Abstract: The electric guitar-building curriculum developed for middle school, high school, and undergraduate students utilizes the academic maker space to explore the Science, Technology, Engineering, Art, and Math embedded in the guitar — a tool for self-expression and understanding one's identity.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Tangible Data: Immersive Data Exploration With Touch
Contributors: Ayush Bhardwaj, Jin Ryong Kim
Abstract: We demonstrate an interactive 3D data visualization tool called TangibleData. TangibleData adapts hand gestures and mid-air haptics to provide 3D data exploration using hand gestures and ultrasound mid-air haptic feedback. We showcase different types of 3D visualization with different data encoding methods for data interaction.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Real-time 3D Graphics for Health Impact: Interactive 3D IUD Insertion
Contributors: Natalie Doolittle, Krystle Quinn, Brian Chirls
Abstract: BioDigital presents an interactive web-based solution to visualize an IUD insertion with real-time graphics to expand access to reproductive healthcare within the strict technical constraints of a global audience.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: New Media for a New Generation of Deep Ocean Explorers — Real-time Underwater Modeling and Immersion
Contributors: Jonathan Fiely, Jason Fahy, Kristopher Krasnosky, Daniel Wagner, Allison Fundis, Rachel Simon, Dan Cormany, Jeremy Childress, Nathan Lannon, Will English
Abstract: Ocean Exploration Trust are pioneers of participatory deep-ocean exploration, transporting global audiences to the seafloor through live, interactive video. This session shares a pilot project that integrates advanced camera systems, sensors, and edge-based processing to enable 3D exploration of our dives, broadening engagement with deep ocean data and discovery.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Ink Harmony: An AI- and VR-enhanced System for Calligraphy Education
Contributors: Yuchao Zhuo, Bingyuan Wang, Zeyu Wang, Yuchao Zhuo
Abstract: Ink Harmony brings an innovative system integrating AI, VR, and robotics to revolutionize calligraphy education. Users input text, which is analyzed and transformed into a thematic VR environment. A robotic arm guides users in replicating strokes, creating an immersive, interactive experience that bridges traditional art and modern technology.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: A New Kingdom: Wētā FX Returns to The Planet of The Apes
Contributors: Phil Leonhardt, Erik Winquist, Paul Story, Alex Nowotny, Erik Winquist, Paul Story, Phil Leonhardt, Danielle Immerman
Abstract: In this talk, VFX Supervisor Erik Winquist will be joined by Animation Supervisor Paul Story, Sequence Supervisor Phil Leonhardt, and Effects Supervisor Alex Nowotny to discuss the capture techniques, environment builds, and dynamic elements that helped bring 'Kingdom of The Planet of The Apes' to life.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: EA SPORTS College Football is Huge: Delivering a Triple-A Sports Game at Scale
Contributors: Ishaan Singh, Jay Goodman, Richard Burgess-Dawson, Ishaan Singh, Jay Goodman, Richard Burgess-Dawson
Abstract: Following an 11-year hiatus, EA SPORTS College Football returns, featuring 11,000 unique characters from 134 schools. The game's scale necessitated a complete re-imagining of content creation and rendering methods. We discuss the strategies in creating and rendering each element, and a new adaptation of global illumination based on surfels.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Back in the Eye of the Storm, The Visual Effects of 'Twisters'
Contributors: Ben Snow, Florian Witzel, Charles Lai, Ben Snow, Charles Lai, Florian Witzel
Abstract: 28 years after Twister took the world by storm, the next generation of storm chasers takes center stage in Twisters. Industrial Light & Magic takes you behind the scenes and shares the recipe used to create some of the most complex and realistic tornadoes and weather simulations ever committed to film.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Tonii: Customizable Amulets that Activate Augmented Reality Suits
Contributors: Yingxi Adelle Lin, Matthew Pinner
Abstract: Tonii merges art, technology, and social activism through wearable AR, inviting users to create amulets from different symbols. Utilizing machine learning, these symbols unlock AR suits, offering wearers a tangible connection between virtual and real-world identities. Tonii fosters technological equity and community engagement, through a more inclusive spatial web ecosystem.

s_Tag: AI, Audio/Music, Dynamics/Simulation, Games, Geometry, Hardware, Interaction, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Perception, Real-Time, Rendering, Research, Streaming, VR/AR/MR, New Technologies, Production & Animation, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Advances in Real Time Audio Rendering — Part 1
Contributors: Aaron McLeran, David Zicarelli, Simon N Goodwin
Abstract: This two part course provides a deep technical understanding of real-time audio rendering while exploring relationships with other rendering disciplines. In part one we begin with the core concepts and challenges of real-time audio rendering. We then investigate approaches for meaningful interaction to audio render graphs.

s_Tag: AI, Animation, Art, Design, Education, Interaction, Machine Learning, Narrative, Pipeline, Production, Real-Time, Rendering, Robotics, VR/AR/MR, Arts & Design, Gaming & Interactive, New Technologies, Production & Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Virtual Human Design: Exploring the Opportunities and Challenges of GenAI - Part 1
Contributors: Elin Carstensdottir, Laura Scholl, Purnendu Mukherjee
Abstract: Virtual Human Design: Exploring the Opportunities and Challenges of GenAI will focus on the concepts of using generative AI to design virtual humans, how to integrate it into the creative process and currently available tools. The participants will walk through an example of creating a virtual human agent including the workflow, facial animation, and non-verbal behavior. What are the current challenges, future challenges and opportunities?
