s_Tag: AI, Audio/Music, Dynamics/Simulation, Games, Geometry, Hardware, Interaction, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Perception, Real-Time, Rendering, Research, Streaming, VR/AR/MR, Gaming & Interactive, New Technologies, Production & Animation, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Advances in Real Time Audio Rendering — Part 2
Contributors: Aaron McLeran, Phillip Popp, Nikunj Raghuvanshi, David Zicarelli, Simon N. Goodwin
Abstract: This two part course provides a deep technical understanding of real-time audio rendering while exploring relationships with other rendering disciplines. In part two we explore advanced techniques for sound propagation and spatialization, extracting meaning from audio signals, and discuss the future of real-time audio.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: EmBelt: A Haptic Device for Extended Reality Experience to Better Understand Body Image Concerns-Related Eating Disorders
Contributors: Hsuan-Hui Yi, Yi-Chun Ko
Abstract: EmBelt is a haptic device integrated with VR storytelling that creates an XR experience designed to enhance the understanding of eating disorders related to body image concerns among individuals without such anxieties. The compression levels respond to user interactions, providing a portrayal linked to the thin ideal and related topics. This submission was selected as Best in Show at LAVAL for 2024.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: Nukabot: Design of Human-Microbe-Computer Entanglement
Contributors: Dominique Chen
Abstract: Nukabot, a human-computer interaction system, connects fermented food microbiomes with their human carers through voice communication. The porcelain nukadoko uses chemical sensors, voice recognition, and vocal synthesis to monitor fermentation and allow humans to interact and ask questions about the ferment. Selected as Best in Show at DCExpo for 2024.

s_Tag: Education, Scientific Visualization, Production & Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter
sub_Title: Visualizing the Invisible Universe with the James Webb Space Telescope
Contributors: Joseph DePasquale, Alyssa Pagan
Abstract: Learn how the iconic images from the James Webb Space Telescope are produced. This course will provide some background on the Space Telescope Science Institute and NASA's newest flagship observatory, the James Webb Space Telescope. You'll learn some basic principles of image processing for astronomy and we'll provide detailed information on obtaining and working with publicly available data from the observatory so that you can create your own versions of these iconic images.

s_Tag: AI, Games, Geometry, Machine Learning, Real-Time, Rendering, Gaming & Interactive, New Technologies, Production & Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Advances in Real-Time Rendering in Games, Part I
Contributors: Natalya Tatarchuk
Abstract: Modern video games employ a variety of sophisticated algorithms to produce groundbreaking 3D rendering pushing the visual boundaries and interactive experience of rich environments. This course brings state-of-the-art and production-proven rendering techniques for fast, interactive rendering of complex and engaging virtual worlds of video games. This is the course to attend if you are in the game development industry or want to learn the latest and greatest techniques in the real-time rendering domain!

s_Tag: AI, Games, Geometry, Machine Learning, Real-Time, Rendering, Gaming & Interactive, New Technologies, Production & Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Advances in Real-Time Rendering in Games, Part II
Contributors: Natalya Tatarchuk
Abstract: Modern video games employ a variety of sophisticated algorithms to produce groundbreaking 3D rendering pushing the visual boundaries and interactive experience of rich environments. This course brings state-of-the-art and production-proven rendering techniques for fast, interactive rendering of complex and engaging virtual worlds of video games. This year the course includes speakers from the makers of several innovative games and game engines. This is the course to attend if you are in the game development industry or want to learn the latest and greatest techniques in the real-time rendering domain!

s_Tag: Animation, Capture/Scanning, Computer Vision, Hardware, Real-Time, Rendering, New Technologies, Production & Animation, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Advanced Practices in Optimizing Motion Capture Pipelines for Games and VFX
Contributors: David Ed Edwards, Garry Gray
Abstract: Covering the critical stages of subject labeling, data capture, post-processing and final retargeting onto custom character models, this course provides best practices and advanced techniques for streamlining motion capture pipeline. Vicon presents the latest capabilities culminating from 30+ years of development, including evolving use cases such as markerless and multi-participant.

s_Tag: Art, Audio/Music, Design, Dynamics/Simulation, Fabrication, Interaction, Maker, Museum, Perception, Production, Real-Time, Themed Entertainment, UI/Tools, VR/AR/MR, Arts & Design, Gaming & Interactive, New Technologies, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Fractal World Building: Infinitely Engaging Experience Design at Meow Wolf
Contributors: Derek Pendergrass, Tasia Miles, Erin Barnes, Eric Heep
Abstract: This session explores immersive innovations and next-generation storytelling that is unique to Meow Wolf’s blend of art, technology, and world-building. Gain insights into the cutting-edge use of lighting, audio, and other creative technologies that animate large-scale worlds, creating singular, unparalleled experiences for nearly 10 million guests across multiple locations.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: SIGGRAPH 2024 Opening Session & Keynote Speaker: Mark Sagar, Beyond the Illusion of Life
Contributors: Mark Sagar
Abstract: SIGGRAPH 2024 officially starts with opening remarks from Conference Chair Andres Burbano, ACM SIGGRAPH leadership, and the ACM President. Remarks to be followed by the Keynote Speaker Dr. Mark Sagar. The essence of animation is creating the illusion of life, convincing the audience that a character is alive and has its own feelings and thoughts. Is it possible to bring an interactive digital character to life who can think, feel, have experiences, and act with volition? What is it, exactly, to think, to feel, to experience? In this keynote, Dr. Mark Sagar will discuss his team’s biologically based approach, where they are developing a virtual nervous system analogous to our own, combining computational models of sensory, cognitive and emotional processes, language, behavior, and motor systems. These systems activate virtual muscles to animate a virtual face and body, sensing, learning, acting, and reacting in real time. The interoperation of these systems in face-to-face and shared interactions is exemplified in projects like BabyX, a simulated toddler which aims to enhance our comprehension of social learning and behavior — but it can also serve as groundwork for achieving human-like cooperation with future artificial intelligence. Dr. Sagar will elaborate how creating the inner life of a character is strongly linked with the body, one of the central thematic focuses of the conference. Double-Academy Award winner Dr. Mark Sagar is the co-founder and Chief Scientific Officer of Soul Machines and Director of the Laboratory for Animate Technologies at the Auckland Bioengineering Institute. Mark and his team are bringing technology to life, pioneering the creation of autonomously animated virtual humans with virtual brains and nervous systems — capable of highly expressive face-to-face interaction and real-time learning and emotional response — to create the next generation of human interaction with biologically inspired artificial intelligence. Mark has a Ph.D. in engineering from the University of Auckland and was a postdoctoral fellow at MIT. He previously worked as the special projects supervisor at Weta Digital and Sony Pictures Imageworks and developed technology for the digital characters in blockbusters such Avatar, King Kong, and Spiderman 2. His pioneering work in computer-generated faces was recognized with two consecutive Scientific and Engineering Oscars in 2010 and 2011. Mark was elected as a fellow of the Royal Society of New Zealand in 2019 and was named New Zealand Innovator of the Year in 2022.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: SIGGRAPH 2024 Keynote Speaker: Dava Newman, Humanity Becoming Interplanetary: Exploring Space for Earth and ACM SIGGRAPH Award Presentations
Contributors: Dava Newman
Abstract: Dava Newman is the director of the MIT Media Lab. She holds the Apollo Program Professor of Astronautics chair at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) and is a Harvard–MIT Health, Sciences, and Technology faculty member in Cambridge, Massachusetts. She has been a faculty leader in aeronautics and astronautics and MIT’s School of Engineering for 30 years. She holds a top-secret clearance. The Honorable Dr. Dava Newman served as NASA Deputy Administrator (2015–2017). Nominated by President Barack Obama and confirmed by the U.S. Senate unanimously in April 2015, Dr. Newman was the third woman and first female engineer and scientist to serve in this role. During her tenure, Dr. Newman made significant impact on NASA’s human exploration, specifically developing and articulating the Human Journey to Mars plan, highlighting scientific missions, advocating for transformative aeronautics capabilities, developing and implementing a strategic innovation framework, and advocating for diversity and inclusion for NASA and the nation’s STEM initiatives. Her research expertise is in aerospace biomedical engineering investigating human performance across the spectrum of gravity and AI/ML for the dual challenge of energy and climate. She is a leader in advanced space suit design, astronaut performance, climate modeling and visualization, leadership development, innovation, and space policy. Dr. Newman was the principal investigator on five spaceflight missions. She has received numerous awards and honors for her contributions to STEM and leadership. Newman earned her Ph.D. in aerospace biomedical engineering, Master of Science degrees in aerospace engineering and technology and policy all from MIT, and her Bachelor of Science degree in aerospace engineering from the University of Notre Dame. Her SIGGRAPH 2024 Keynote Presentation will cover the theme of Humanity Becoming Interplanetary: Exploring Space for Earth in the range of computer graphics advancement.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: SIGGRAPH 2024 Keynote Speaker: Manu Prakash, The Microscopic
Contributors: Manu Prakash
Abstract: Manu Prakash is an associate professor of bioengineering at Stanford University, a Senior Fellow at the Stanford Woods Institute for the Environment, a Pew Scholar, and the co-inventor of the Foldscope and co-founder of Foldscope Instruments. At Stanford, Manu runs a curiosity-driven science lab focused on using highly interdisciplinary approaches to understand how computation is embodied in biological matter. His lab is dedicated to inventing, building, and scaling up frugal science tools to democratize access to science, including the discovery of the Foldscope, a foldable microscope made mostly of paper. Manu has a Bachelor of Technology from the Indian Institute of Technology and a Master of Science and Ph.D. from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. In his SIGGRAPH 2024 Keynote Presentation, Manu will take you on a microscopic journey of the often unseen world — a delight of creatures most beautiful and marvelous with dazzling graphical feats. Come for the science, and stay for the community-enabled discoveries made around the world.

s_Tag: Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Experience, Exhibitor Full Conference, Exhibitor Experience
sub_Title: SIGGRAPH 2024 Keynote Speaker: Jensen Huang, NVIDIA CEO Fireside Chat: AI and Graphics for the New Computing Revolution
Contributors: Jensen Huang
Abstract: In this fireside chat, NVIDIA Founder and CEO Jensen Huang will discuss how generative AI and accelerated computing are transforming industries such as manufacturing and creating new opportunities for innovation and growth. The convergence of AI and advanced computing, from AI PCs to AI factories to digital twins, is driving this transformation. Jensen will speak about the impact of robotics and AI in industrial digitization, illustrating how industry sectors are adopting autonomous operations and building city-scale digital twins to increase efficiency and reduce costs. Jensen Huang founded NVIDIA in 1993 and has served since its inception as president, chief executive officer, and a member of the board of directors. Huang has been elected to the National Academy of Engineering and is a recipient of the Semiconductor Industry Association’s highest honor, the Robert N. Noyce Award; IEEE Founder’s Medal; the Dr. Morris Chang Exemplary Leadership Award; and honorary doctorate degrees from National Chiao Tung University, National Taiwan University, and Oregon State University. He has been named the world’s best CEO by The Economist and Harvard Business Review, as well as Fortune’s Businessperson of the Year and one of TIME magazine’s 100 most influential people. He holds a BSEE degree from Oregon State University and an MSEE degree from Stanford.

s_Tag: Real-Time, Gaming & Interactive, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Real-Time Round-Table: Up Close & Personal with Real-Time Live!
Contributors: Emily Hsu
Abstract: After watching the live on-stage demos at Real-Time Live! (RTL) on Tuesday night, take a deeper dive and engage in direct conversation with the RTL contributors the next morning. This Real-Time Round-Table is a combined format of presentation-panel with conversational gathering to discuss and celebrate the work shown as part of the Real-Time Live showcase! Hear from the 2024 RTL presenters in lightning talks that reveal some of the behind-the-scenes of their work. Then, break-out into stations and engage with them in more intimate discussions to learn even more with some opportunities for hands-on interaction. Celebrate the 15th Anniversary of Real-Time Live! in true SIGGRAPH style!

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: N-Dimensional Gaussians for Fitting of High Dimensional Functions
Contributors: Stavros Diolatzis, Tobias Zirr, Alexander Kuznetsov, Georgios Kopanas, Anton Kaplanyan
Abstract: We propose the use of N-Dimensional Gaussian mixtures to fit high dimensional functions, applicable to various applications such as neural global illumination and novel view synthesis for complex anisotropic effects. Our method offers quality similar to implicit methods with orders of magnitude faster training as we demonstrate in two applications.

s_Tag: Animation, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Modelling a Feather as a Strongly Anisotropic Elastic Shell
Contributors: Jean Jouve, Victor Romero, Rahul Narain, Laurence Boissieux, Theodore Kim, Florence Bertails-Descoubes
Abstract: We investigate the mechanical properties of bird feathers. Our lab experiments reveal a linear strain-stress relationship of the feather membrane in addition to an extreme anisotropy. From these findings we build a simple orthotropic model for the feather vane, whose numerical implementation avoids locking and ill-conditioning issues.

s_Tag: Animation, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Multi-material Mesh-based Surface Tracking With Implicit Topology Changes
Contributors: Peter Heiss-Synak, Aleksei Kalinov, Malina Strugaru, Arian Etemadi, Huidong Yang, Chris Wojtan
Abstract: We introduce a multi-material, non-manifold mesh-based surface tracking algorithm that converts self-intersections into topological changes. Our algorithm preserves surface features like mesh-based methods and robustly handles topological changes like level set methods. We demonstrate the effectiveness of the approach on complex soap film simulations with thousands of interacting bubbles.

s_Tag: AI, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: MaPa: Text-driven Photorealistic Material Painting for 3D Shapes
Contributors: Shangzhan Zhang, Sida Peng, Tao Xu, Yuanbo Yang, Tianrun Chen, Nan Xue, Yujun Shen, Hujun Bao, Ruizhen Hu, Xiaowei Zhou
Abstract: This paper aims to generate materials for 3D meshes from text descriptions. We propose to generate segment-wise procedural material graphs as the appearance representation, which supports high-quality rendering and provides substantial flexibility in editing. Extensive experiments demonstrate superior performance of our framework in photorealism, resolution, and editability over existing methods.

s_Tag: Animation, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Hand-Object Interaction Controller (HOIC): Deep Reinforcement Learning for Reconstructing Interactions With Physics
Contributors: Haoyu Hu, Xin-yu Yi, Zhe Cao, Jun-Hai Yong, Feng Xu
Abstract: This paper introduces a physics-based hand-object interaction reconstruction system by leveraging imitation learning. A novel object compensation control technique is proposed to upgrade the simple point contact model to a more physical-plausible surface contact model, which improves the training stability and reconstruction quality.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: EyeIR: Single Eye Image Inverse Rendering in the Wild
Contributors: Shijun Liang, Haofei Wang, Feng Lu
Abstract: We propose a method to decompose a single eye image into albedo, shading, specular, normal, and illumination component. We create a diverse synthetic eye dataset and design a synthetic-to-real adaptation framework for self-supervised learning on real images. We also design a method which specifically addresses ambiguities caused by corneal specularity.

s_Tag: Fabrication, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Deep Hybrid Camera Deblurring for Smartphone Cameras
Contributors: Jaesung Rim, Junyong Lee, Heemin Yang, Sunghyun Cho
Abstract: We introduce HCDeblur, a practical deblurring framework that utilizes smartphone cameras as a hybrid camera system. Our camera system simultaneously captures a long-exposure image and short-exposure burst images. HCDeblur exploits the burst images to effectively remove blur from the long-exposure image and achieves state-of-the-art performance on a real-world smartphone.

s_Tag: Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: A Fully-correlated Anisotropic Micrograin BSDF Model
Contributors: Simon Lucas, Mickaël Ribardière, Romain Pacanowski, Pascal Barla
Abstract: We introduce an improved micrograin model for the rendering of porous layers. From the microscopic surface properties, we derived the exact correlation between heights and normals. Our analytical Geometrical Attenuation Factor accounts for correlation between light and view directions, yielding to retro-reflection and height-slope color correlation effects.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: WalkTheDog: Cross-morphology Motion Alignment via Phase Manifolds
Contributors: Peizhuo Li, Sebastian Starke, Yuting Ye, Olga Sorkine-Hornung
Abstract: We present a morphology and skeletal structure-independent approach for understanding the periodicity structure and semantics of motion datasets. Driven by the common phase manifold with multiple closed curves learned with vector-quantized periodic autoencoders, a precise semantic and timing alignment can be used in applications including motion retrieval, transfer, and stylization.

s_Tag: Fabrication, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Split-Aperture 2-in-1 Computational Cameras
Contributors: Zheng Shi, Ilya Chugunov, Mario Bijelic, Geoffroi Côté, Jiwoon Yeom, Qiang Fu, Hadi Amata, Wolfgang Heidrich, Felix Heide
Abstract: We introduce a split-aperture 2-in-1 computational camera that combines application-specific optical modulation with conventional imaging into one system. This approach simplifies complex inverse problems faced by computational cameras, enhances reconstruction quality, and offers a real-time viewfinder experience, paving the way for the adoption of computational camera technology in consumer devices.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Versatile Vision Foundation Model for Image and Video Colorization
Contributors: Vukasin Bozic, Abdelaziz Djelouah, Yang Zhang, Radu Timofte, Markus Gross, Christopher Schroers
Abstract: In this work, we show how a latent diffusion model, pre-trained on text-to-image synthesis, can be repurposed for image colorization and provide a flexible high-quality solution for a wide variety of scenarios: direct colorization with diverse results, user guidance through colors hints or text prompts, and finally video colorization.

s_Tag: Fabrication, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Radar Fields: Frequency-space Neural Scene Representations for FMCW Radar
Contributors: David Borts, Erich Liang, Jipeng Sun, Tim Broedermann, David Brueggemann, Christos Sakaridis, Luc Van Gool, Andrea Ramazzina, Edoardo Palladin, Stefanie Walz, Mario Bijelic, Felix Heide
Abstract: We present Radar Fields: a frequency-space neural scene reconstruction method designed for active radar imagers. For the first time, we recover dense 3D scene geometry from a single trajectory of 2D radar measurements using an explicit mm-wave forward model and an implicit neural geometry and reflectance model.

s_Tag: Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Practical Error Estimation for Denoised Monte Carlo Image Synthesis
Contributors: Arthur Firmino, Ravi Ramamoorthi, Jeppe Revall Frisvad, Henrik Wann Jensen
Abstract: We present a practical error estimation technique for denoised Monte Carlo ray tracing, using aggregated estimates of bias and variance to determine the pixel’s squared error distribution. This leads to a novel stopping criterion for denoised Monte Carlo image synthesis, that efficiently terminates rendering once a specified error is achieved.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: fVDB : A Deep-learning Framework for Sparse, Large Scale, and High Performance Spatial Intelligence
Contributors: Francis Williams, Jiahui Huang, Jonathan Swartz, Gergely Klar, Vijay Thakkar, Matthew Cong, Xuanchi Ren, Ruilong Li, Clement Fuji-Tsang, Sanja Fidler, Eftychios Sifakis, Ken Museth
Abstract: We introduce fVDB, a GPU-optimized framework for deep learning on large-scale 3D data that efficiently accommodates spatial sparsity, based on a novel VDB index grid structure. Our framework is fully integrated with PyTorch and includes a comprehensive collection of operators for tasks such as convolution, pooling, attention, and raytracing.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Interactive Design of Stylized Walking Gaits for Robotic Characters
Contributors: Michael A. Hopkins, Georg Wiedebach, Kyle Cesare, Jared Bishop, Espen Knoop, Moritz Bächer
Abstract: We present a real-time procedural animation technique for the artist-directed authoring of stylized walking gaits for robotic characters. Our interactive authoring tool relies on a parameteric gait planner and model-based control stack to generate feasible walking motion from example walk cycles using a phase-space blending strategy.

s_Tag: Animation, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: HeadArtist: Text-conditioned 3D Head Generation With Self Score Distillation
Contributors: Hongyu Liu, Xuan Wang, Ziyu Wan, Yujun Shen, Yibing Song, Jing Liao, Qifeng Chen
Abstract: We present HeadArtist for 3D head generation and editing following human-language descriptions. With proposed self-score distillation (SSD), we comes up with an efficient pipeline that optimizes a parameterized 3D head model under the supervision of a landmark-guided ControlNet itself. Experimental results show that our approach produces high-quality 3D head sculptures.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Robust Containment Queries Over Collections of Rational Parametric Curves via Generalized Winding Numbers
Contributors: Jacob Spainhour, David Gunderman, Kenneth Weiss
Abstract: We extend the theory of generalized winding numbers to unstructured collections of rational parametric curves with a numerically stable algorithm, thereby allowing for robust and accurate containment classifications at arbitrary locations for non-watertight and self-intersecting shapes.

s_Tag: AI, Machine Learning, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Streetscapes: Large-scale Consistent Street View Generation Using Autoregressive Video Diffusion
Contributors: Boyang Deng, Richard Tucker, Zhengqi Li, Leonidas Guibas, Noah Snavely, Gordon Wetzstein
Abstract: Our method generates Streetscapes — long sequences of views through a synthesized city-scale scene. We build on video diffusion models, but in an autoregressive framework that easily scales to long camera trajectories. We train our system on the unique Google Street View data, allowing controlling generations by scene layouts and camera poses.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Lagrangian Covector Fluid With Free Surface
Contributors: Zhiqi Li, Barnabás Börcsök, Duowen Chen, Yutong Sun, Bo Zhu, Greg Turk
Abstract: We present a novel Lagrangian solver for incompressible flows, leveraging flow-maps to simulate vortical evolution with particles. Our approach focuses on using particle trajectories as flow maps, tailoring path integrals along trajectories for complex boundary conditions, and computing physical quantities on particles with a Voronoi-based Poisson solver to avoid interpolation.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: TEDi: Temporally-Entangled Diffusion for Long-term Motion Synthesis
Contributors: Zihan Zhang, Richard Liu, Rana Hanocka, Kfir Aberman
Abstract: TEDi introduces a novel approach to long-term motion synthesis by entangling the denoising diffusion time-axis with the temporal motion time-axis. This is achieved through temporally varying denoising, allowing TEDi to generate high-quality, diverse motions auto-regressively. This new mechanism paves the way towards a new framework for long-term motion synthesis.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: LightFormer: Light-oriented Global Neural Rendering in Dynamic Scene
Contributors: Haocheng Ren, Yuchi Huo, Yifan Peng, Hongtao Sheng, Weidong Xue, Hongxiang Huang, Jingzhen Lan, Rui Wang, Hujun Bao
Abstract: The generation of global illumination in real-time has been a long-standing challenge in the graphics community. This work presents a neural rendering approach inspired by many-lights methods and Transformer model, dubbed LightFormer, that can generate realistic global illumination for fully dynamic scenes, including dynamic lighting, materials, cameras, and animated objects.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Text-guided Synthesis of Crowd Animation
Contributors: Xuebo Ji, Zherong Pan, Xifeng Gao, Jia Pan
Abstract: This paper presents a novel approach to automatically generate crowd behaviors from high-level text descriptions. The group-wise, velocity-field-based representation of collective agent behaviors is used and seamlessly integrated with diffusion models and large language models. This work paves the way toward automatic crowd behavior generation for virtual environments.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: NICER: A New and Improved Consumed Endurance and Recovery Metric to Quantify Muscle Fatigue of Mid-air Interactions
Contributors: Yi Li, Benjamin Tag, Shaozhang Dai, Robert Crowther, Tim Dwyer, Pourang Irani, Barrett Ens
Abstract: Natural gestures are crucial for mid-air interactions, but predicting and managing muscle fatigue is challenging. We present a new computational model, NICER, which combines a correction term for 3D interaction and a recovery factor for a rest period to predict fatigue across a variety of gesture-based interactive applications.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Computational Illusion Knitting
Contributors: Amy Zhu, Yuxuan Mei, Benjamin Jones, Zachary Tatlock, Adriana Schulz
Abstract: Illusion-knit fabrics reveal hidden images across viewing angles. Artist-created knit illusions are tedious to design, limited to single-view, and slow to manufacture. We establish constraints over the design space, develop an interactive design system, and originate fabrication techniques for mixed colorwork and texture, successfully creating the first known double-view illusions.

s_Tag: Animation, Geometry, Machine Learning, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Physics-based Scene Layout Generation From Human Motion
Contributors: Jianan Li, Tao Huang, Qingxu Zhu, Tien-Tsin Wong
Abstract: We present a physics-based framework that generates scene layouts from captured human motions. By simultaneously optimizing the motion imitation character controller and the scene layout generator, our method generates physically plausible and semantically reasonable scenes for a range of motions.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: MotionCtrl: A Unified and Flexible Motion Controller for Video Generation
Contributors: Zhouxia Wang, Ziyang Yuan, Xintao Wang, Yaowei Li, Tianshui Chen, Menghan Xia, Ping Luo, Ying Shan
Abstract: MotionCtrl, through the delicate design of architecture, training strategy, and curated datasets, enables independent or combined control of camera and object motion within a unified video generation model. Its generalizability extends to existing video generation models like LVDM/VideoCrafter1 and AnimateDiff.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Theory of Human Tetrachromatic Color Experience and Printing
Contributors: Jessica Lee, Nicholas Jennings, Varun Srivastava, Ren Ng
Abstract: We apply d-dimensional color theory to compute the predicted hue sphere of human tetrachromatic color space for the first time and derive the ideal, CMY-equivalent, tetrachromatic printing primaries. Our prototype tetrachromatic printer utilizes four selected fountain pen inks to print color tests to identify and characterize tetrachromacy in the wild.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Matting by Generation
Contributors: Zhixiang Wang, Baiang Li, Jian Wang, Yu-Lun Liu, Jinwei Gu, Yung-Yu Chuang, Shin'ichi Satoh
Abstract: This paper redefines traditional regression-based matting as a generative modeling challenge and harnesses the capabilities of latent diffusion models enriched with extensive pre-trained knowledge to tackle this challenge. It not only produces mattes with superior resolution and detail but is also versatile and can perform both guidance-free and guidance-based matting.

s_Tag: AI, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: SketchDream: Sketch-based Text-to-3D Generation and Editing
Contributors: Feng-Lin liu, Hongbo Fu, Yu-Kun Lai, Lin Gao
Abstract: We present SketchDream, a novel method that supports text-based NeRF generation from given hand-drawn sketches and achieves free-view, sketch-based local editing. We introduce a sketch-based, multi-view image generation diffusion model to support 3D generation with a coarse-to-fine editing approach to support high-quality local modification.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: ST-4DGS: Spatial-Temporally Consistent 4D Gaussian Splatting for Efficient Dynamic Scene Rendering
Contributors: Deqi Li, Shi-Sheng Huang, Hua Huang, Zhiyuan Lu, Xinran Duan
Abstract: Our ST-4DGS introduces an effective solution to prevent the compactness degeneration of 4D Gaussians by using motion-aware shape regularization and spatial-temporal joint density control, which is the key factor for better dynamic rendering quality in a more efficient manner.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: X-SLAM: Scalable Dense SLAM for Task-aware Optimization Using CSFD
Contributors: Zhexi Peng, Yin Yang, Tianjia Shao, Chenfanfu Jiang, Kun Zhou
Abstract: X-SLAM is a real-time dense differentiable SLAM system. It exploits CSFD for an accurate and robust (high-order) numerical differentiation, which avoids the need for the computational graph and substantially reduces the memory footprint. X-SLAM is compatible with most SLAM algorithms. Evaluations via real-world applications show clear improvements over existing solutions.

s_Tag: Real-Time, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Real-time Hair Rendering With Hair Meshes
Contributors: Gaurav Bhokare, Eisen Montalvo, Elie Diaz, Cem Yuksel
Abstract: We present how the hair mesh structure can be used for efficiently rendering strand-based hair models on the GPU. We demonstrate an unprecedented level of performance for real-time hair rendering, allowing scenes involving hundreds of characters with full-resolution unique hair models at real-time frame rates and on-the-fly hairstyle adjustment.

s_Tag: Animation, Geometry, Modeling, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Universal Facial Encoding of Codec Avatars From VR Headsets
Contributors: Shaojie Bai, Te-Li Wang, Chenghui Li, Akshay Venkatesh, Tomas Simon, Chen Cao, Gabriel Schwartz, Jason Saragih, Yaser Sheikh, Shih-En Wei
Abstract: We present a self-supervised and robust encoding algorithm for achieving high-fidelity real-time 3D facial animation, via head-mounted cameras on a consumer VR headset. Our model generalizes to unseen users and variability in illuminations, under incomplete views of the face, enabling accessible authentic avatar-mediated telepresence in VR.

s_Tag: Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: From Microfacets to Participating Media: A Unified Theory of Light Transport With Stochastic Geometry
Contributors: Dario Seyb, Eugene d'Eon, Benedikt Bitterli, Wojciech Jarosz
Abstract: We derive a theory of light transport on stochastic implicit surfaces, a geometry model capable of expressing deterministic geometry, microfacet surfaces, participating media, and an exciting new continuum in between containing aggregate appearance, non-classical media, and more. Our model naturally supports spatial correlations, missing from most existing stochastic models.

s_Tag: Animation, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Audio Matters Too! Enhancing Markerless Motion Capture With Audio Signals for String Performance Capture
Contributors: Yitong Jin, Zhiping Qiu, Yi Shi, Shuangpeng Sun, Chongwu Wang, Donghao Pan, Jiachen Zhao, Zhenghao Liang, Yuan Wang, Xiaobing Li, Feng Yu, Tao Yu, Qionghai Dai
Abstract: Motion Capture of musical instrument performance is challenging even with markers. By extracting playing cues inherent in the audio for markerless video motion capture, our method recovers subtle finger-string contacts and intricate playing movements. We further contribute the first large-scale String Performance Dataset (SPD) with high-quality motion and contact annotations.

s_Tag: Animation, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Towards Unstructured Unlabeled Optical Mocap: A Video Helps!
Contributors: Nicholas Milef, John Keyser, Shu Kong
Abstract: We introduce the problem Unstructured Unlabeled Optical (UUO) mocap, where unlabeled optical mocap markers can be placed anywhere on the body. Using monocular video, we introduce a multi-stage optimization framework that leverages multiple hypothesis testing to automatically solve for human pose and shape for both full-body and partial-body reconstruction.

s_Tag: Fabrication, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Scale-invariant Monocular Depth Estimation via SSI Depth
Contributors: S. Mahdi H. Miangoleh, Mahesh Reddy, Yağız Aksoy
Abstract: We propose leveraging SSI depth estimation to achieve highly detailed SI-only depth in the wild. This streamlines the network's role and facilitates in-the-wild generalization for SI-only depth estimation. Using a synthetic dataset and a novel sparse ordinal loss, our method generates detailed depth with practical usability in computational photography applications.

s_Tag: Fabrication, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Self-supervised Video Defocus Deblurring With Atlas Learning
Contributors: Lingyan Ruan, Mojtaba Bemana, Krzysztof Wolski, Martin Bálint, Hans-Peter Seidel, Karol Myszkowski, Bin Chen
Abstract: Misfocus is ubiquitous for almost all video producers, degrading video quality and often causing expensive delays and reshoots. We address this problem by introducing a self-supervised video defocus deblurring pipeline consisting of layered atlases, COC map estimation, and lens reblur, allowing consistent, sharp video reconstruction and effective subject-focus correction.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: LOOSECONTROL: Lifting ControlNet for Generalized Depth Conditioning
Contributors: Shariq Bhat, Niloy Mitra, Peter Wonka
Abstract: LooseControl introduces a generalized approach for depth-conditioned image generation, overcoming ControlNet's reliance on detailed depth maps. It enables scene creation with boundary and 3D box controls for object layout. This method simplifies complex environment design, showing promise as a versatile design tool, and supports image editing, creating stop-motion videos, etc.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: ReFiNe: Recursive Field Networks for Cross-modal Multi-scene Representation
Contributors: Sergey Zakharov, Katherine Liu, Adrien Gaidon, Rares Ambrus
Abstract: The common trade-offs of state-of-the-art methods for multi-shape representation involve trading modeling accuracy against memory and storage. We show how a recursive hierarchical architecture can be used to encode multiple shapes represented as continuous neural fields with a higher degree of precision than previously possible and with low memory usage.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: DiffCAD: Weakly-supervised Probabilistic CAD Model Retrieval and Alignment From an RGB Image
Contributors: Daoyi Gao, David Rozenberszki, Stefan Leutenegger, Angela Dai
Abstract: DiffCAD introduces probabilistic CAD retrieval and alignment to an RGB image. It models the disentangled distributions of scene scale, object pose, and shape leveraging diffusion. This enables cross-domain multi hypothesis CAD reconstruction, capturing the inherent ambiguities in depth/scale and object shape/pose, while only trained on synthetic data.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: RealFill: Reference-driven Generation for Authentic Image Completion
Contributors: Luming Tang, Nataniel Ruiz, Qinghao Chu, Yuanzhen Li, Aleksander Holynski, David E. Jacobs, Bharath Hariharan, Yael Pritch, Neal Wadhwa, Kfir Aberman, Michael Rubinstein
Abstract: Given a few reference images that roughly capture the same scene, and a target image with a missing region, RealFill is able to complete the target image with high-quality image content that is faithful to the true scene.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Separate-and-Enhance: Compositional Finetuning for Text-to-image Diffusion Models
Contributors: Zhipeng Bao, Yijun Li, Krishna Kumar Singh, Yu-Xiong Wang, Martial Hebert
Abstract: This work targets on improving the compositional capability of text-to-image models. Different from previous approaches that requires heavy test-time adaptation per prompt, we propose a compositional finetuning framework with two novel objectives. Through comprehensive evaluations, our model demonstrates superior performance in image realism, text-image alignment, and adaptability to novel concepts.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: DAE-Net: Deforming Auto-Encoder for Fine-grained Shape Co-segmentation
Contributors: Zhiqin Chen, Qimin Chen, Hang Zhou, Hao Zhang
Abstract: We present an unsupervised 3D shape co-segmentation method following the stipulation that corresponding parts in different shapes should have approximately the same shape. Our method learns the shapes of a set of part templates and composes each shape by selecting a subset of template parts which are affine-transformed and deformed.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Differentiable Geodesic Distance for Intrinsic Minimization on Triangle Meshes
Contributors: Yue Li, Logan Numerow, Bernhard Thomaszewski, Stelian Coros
Abstract: We present a novel approach for the intrinsic minimization of distance-based objectives defined on triangle meshes. We demonstrate our differentiable geodesic distance framework on geodesic networks and membranes on surfaces, two-way coupling between hosting surface and embedded system, differentiable Voronoi diagrams, and efficient computation of Karcher means on complex shapes.

s_Tag: Design, Fabrication, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Solid Knitting
Contributors: Yuichi Hirose, Mark Gillespie, Angelica M. Bonilla Fominaya, James McCann
Abstract: We introduce solid knitting, a new fabrication technique combining the layer-by-layer volumetric approach of 3D printing with the topologically entwined stitch structure of knitting to produce solid 3D objects. We present a solid knitting machine, a design tool using a volumetric block structure, and a low-level language to control the machine.

s_Tag: Animation, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: An Induce-on-Boundary Magnetostatic Solver for Grid-based Ferrofluids
Contributors: Xingyu Ni, Ruicheng Wang, Bin Wang, Baoquan Chen
Abstract: This paper introduces a novel Induce-on-Boundary (IoB) solver designed to address the magnetostatic problems based on a single-layer potential, which utilizes only the surface point cloud of the object and offers a lightweight, fast, and accurate solution for simulating ferrofluids.

s_Tag: Design, Fabrication, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Computational Homogenization for Inverse Design of Surface-based Inflatables
Contributors: Yingying Ren, Julian Panetta, Seiichi Suzuki, Uday Kusupati, Florin Isvoranu, Mark Pauly
Abstract: Surface-based inflatables are composed of two sheet materials joined along selected fusing curves, gaining stiffness when inflated to deploy into bending-active shells. We present a computational framework employing numerical homogenization and physics-based simulation for optimizing over arbitrary fusing patterns and designing structures that approximate a wide range of doubly curved surfaces.

s_Tag: Rendering, VR/AR/MR, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: PEA-PODs: Perceptual Evaluation of Algorithms for Power Optimization in XR Displays
Contributors: Kenneth Chen, Thomas Wan, Nathan Matsuda, Ajit Ninan, Alexandre Chapiro, Qi Sun
Abstract: Displays are a major battery drain on untethered XR devices. Energy-efficient rendering reduces power consumption but sacrifices visual quality. We investigated popular VR display and rendering architectures through our electronic measurement prototype and a large-scale perceptual study. Our milliwatt-to-quality model guides battery-aware rendering, display hardware design, and eye-tracking decisions.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Mesh Neural Cellular Automata
Contributors: Ehsan Pajouheshgar, Yitao Xu, Alexander Mordvintsev, Eyvind Niklasson, Tong Zhang, Sabine Süsstrunk
Abstract: MeshNCA directly creates dynamic textures on 3D meshes without UV maps. MeshNCA's training targets include PBR textures, text prompts, and motion-vector fields. Trained only on an Icosphere mesh, we create textures on unseen meshes and interactively edit the synthesized textures, both in real time. Our online demo showcases the capabilities.

s_Tag: Animation, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Automatic Digital Garment Initialization From Sewing Patterns
Contributors: Chen Liu, Weiwei Xu, Yin Yang, Huamin Wang
Abstract: Leveraging a combination of AI classification, heuristics, and numerical optimization, we have developed an innovative hybrid system designed for the automatic initialization of digital garments and requiring minimal user intervention.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: BrepGen: A B-rep Generative Diffusion Model With Structured Latent Geometry
Contributors: Xiang Xu, Joseph Lambourne, Pradeep Jayaraman, Zhengqing Wang, Karl Willis, Yasutaka Furukawa
Abstract: BrepGen is a diffusion-based generative approach that directly outputs a Boundary representation (B-rep) CAD model. It uses a novel structured latent geometry to encode the topology and geometry as a hierarchical tree. A top-down latent diffusion sequentially denoises the faces, edges, vertices, and joins them to form the final B-rep.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Binary Opacity Grids: Capturing Fine Geometric Detail for Mesh-based View Synthesis
Contributors: Christian Reiser, Stephan Garbin, Pratul Srinivasan, Dor Verbin, Richard Szeliski, Ben Mildenhall, Jonathan Barron, Peter Hedman, Andreas Geiger
Abstract: We reconstruct meshes from multi-view images that contain fine geometric detail yet are suitable for high-quality view synthesis on low-powered devices. To this end, we model the scene as a high-resolution binary opacity grid and shoot multiple rays per pixel to be able to reason about subpixel structures.

s_Tag: Animation, Machine Learning, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Neural Control Variates With Automatic Integration
Contributors: Zilu Li, Guandao Yang, Qingqing Zhao, Xi Deng, Leonidas Guibas, Bharath Hariharan, Gordon Wetzstein
Abstract: We present a method that uses arbitrary neural network architectures as control variates with automatic differentiation to improve Monte Carlo methods. Our approach creates unbiased, low-variance, and numerically stable Monte Carlo estimators for various problem setups. We demonstrate our method's advantages in solving Laplace and Poisson equations using Walk-on-Sphere.

s_Tag: Animation, Machine Learning, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Stochastic Computation of Barycentric Coordinates
Contributors: Fernando de Goes, Mathieu Desbrun
Abstract: We introduce an approach for computing barycentric coordinates inside and outside a cage domain using only cage queries such as closest points and ray intersections. We show that this stochastic construction reproduces existing barycentric coordinates, e.g., harmonic and (positive) mean-value coordinates, while seamlessly accommodating a variety of cage representations.

s_Tag: Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Specular Polynomials
Contributors: Zhimin Fan, Jie Guo, Yiming Wang, Tianyu Xiao, Hao Zhang, Chenxi Zhou, Zhenyu Chen, Pengpei Hong, Yanwen Guo, Ling-Qi Yan
Abstract: A reformulation of specular constraints into polynomial systems that enables efficiently finding a complete set of all admissible specular paths connecting two arbitrary endpoints in a scene, by converting the problem into finding zeros of the determinant of univariate matrix polynomials.

s_Tag: Machine Learning, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Conditional Mixture Path Guiding for Differentiable Rendering
Contributors: Zhimin Fan, Pengcheng Shi, Mufan Guo, Ruoyu Fu, Yanwen Guo, Jie Guo
Abstract: This work develops a path guiding based on a distribution mixture that improves the performance of differentiable rendering processes. It demonstrates why the mixture is required, how to obtain this distribution mixture, how to update each distribution at each iteration, and how to handle negative gradients.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Semantic Gesticulator: Semantics-aware Co-speech Gesture Synthesis
Contributors: Zeyi Zhang, Tenglong Ao, Yuyao Zhang, Qingzhe Gao, Chuan Lin, Baoquan Chen, Libin Liu
Abstract: We introduce Semantic Gesticulator, a novel framework designed to synthesize realistic co-speech gestures with strong semantic correspondence. Semantic Gesticulator fine-tunes an LLM to retrieve suitable semantic gesture candidates from a motion library. Combined with a novel, GPT-style generative model, the generated gesture motions demonstrate strong rhythmic coherence and semantic appropriateness.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: DiLightNet: Fine-grained Lighting Control for Diffusion-based Image Generation
Contributors: Chong Zeng, Yue Dong, Pieter Peers, Youkang Kong, Hongzhi Wu, Xin Tong
Abstract: This paper presents a novel method for exerting fine-grained lighting control during text-driven, diffusion-based image generation. We demonstrate our lighting-controlled diffusion model on a variety of text-prompt generated images and under different types of lighting, ranging from point lights to environment lighting.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: A Neural Network Model for Efficient Musculoskeletal-driven Skin Deformation
Contributors: Yushan Han, Yizhou Chen, Carmichael Ong, Jingyu Chen, Jennifer Hicks, Joseph Teran
Abstract: We present a comprehensive neural network pipeline that realistically models soft tissue deformation of animated human characters. This network, trained with layered quasi-static simulation of muscle, fascia, and fat, can effectively replicate musculoskeletal behaviors determined by skeletal kinematics and computed muscle activation.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Analogist: Out-of-the-box Visual In-context Learning With Image Diffusion Model
Contributors: Zheng Gu, Shiyuan Yang, Jing Liao, Jing Huo, Yang Gao
Abstract: Analogist is a novel visual In-context Learning approach combining visual and textual prompts with a diffusion model. It introduces self-attention cloning and cross-attention masking to enhance analogy accuracy, offering a flexible, out-of-the-box solution that outperforms existing methods without needing fine-tuning or optimization.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: MoConVQ: Unified Physics-based Motion Control via Scalable Discrete Representations
Contributors: Heyuan Yao, Zhenhua Song, Yuyang Zhou, Tenglong Ao, Baoquan Chen, Libin Liu
Abstract: We present MoConVQ, a uniform framework enabling simulated avatars to acquire diverse skills from large, unstructured datasets. Leveraging a rich and scalable discrete skill representation, MoConVQ supports a broad range of applications, including pose estimation, interactive control, text-to-motion generation, and, more interestingly, integrating motion generation with Large Language Models (LLMs).

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Dragon's Path: Synthesizing User-centered Flying Creature Animation Paths for Outdoor Augmented Reality Experiences
Contributors: Minyoung Kim, Rawan Alghofaili, Changyang Li, Lap-Fai Yu
Abstract: We present a novel approach to automatically generate user-centered flying creature animation paths for outdoor augmented reality experiences. Given a sequence of storyline actions, our approach finds suitable locations for the character to perform its actions, generating a corresponding animation path optimized with respect to the user's perspective.

s_Tag: Fabrication, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Aperture-aware Lens Design
Contributors: Arjun Teh, Ioannis Gkioulekas, Matthew O'Toole
Abstract: We present a method for designing lenses that uses a gradient-based optimization procedure to increase light collection. Our proposed specular warp field enables the differentiation of light throughput with respect to lens parameters and gives us access to loss functions that explicitly depend on light throughput.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Neural Geometry Fields for Meshes
Contributors: Venkataram Edavamadathil Sivaram, Tzu-Mao Li, Ravi Ramamoorthi
Abstract: Neural geometry fields are a novel 3D surface representation which leverage advances in neural implicit functions to represent discrete triangle meshes. By discretizing a surface into quadrangular patches, a neural function can be adapted to learn high frequency surface details, ultimately enabling state-of-the-art mesh compression.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Recompose Grammars for Procedural Architecture
Contributors: Niklaus Houska, Cheryl Lau, Matthias Specht
Abstract: Recomp overcomes fundamental limitations of split grammars by introducing structural shape recomposition and geometry component tagging. It allows for selectively reversing the subdivision process, enabling a flexible decompose-refine-recompose workflow and precise geometric control, leading to significantly enhanced geometric expressiveness and context sensitivity in procedural modeling of architecture.

s_Tag: Rendering, VR/AR/MR, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Cybersickness Reduction via Gaze-contingent Image Deformation
Contributors: Colin Groth, Marcus Magnor, Steve Grogorick, Martin Eisemann, Piotr Didyk
Abstract: We introduce a novel technique to mitigate cybersickness by gaze-contingent geometrical distortions that reduce vection. Based on pre-study insights, we formulate a perceptual model that defines noticeability limits for these modifications. Our technique, implemented as a real-time post-processing step in current rendering frameworks, was favored over alternatives in VR scenarios.

s_Tag: Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Spin-weighted Spherical Harmonics for Polarized Light Transport
Contributors: Shinyoung Yi, Donggun Kim, Jiwoong Na, Xin Tong, Min H. Kim
Abstract: We introduce polarized spherical harmonics (PSH), based on spin-weighted spherical harmonics theory, offering a rotation-invariant representation of Stokes vector fields. Our approach includes frequency domain formulations of polarized rendering and spherical convolution with PSH, making it the first real-time polarization rendering with polarized environment lighting through precomputed polarized radiance transfer.

s_Tag: Design, Fabrication, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Modal Folding: Discovering Smooth Folding Patterns for Sheet Materials Using Strain-space Modes
Contributors: Pengbin Tang, Ronan Hinchet, Roi Poranne, Bernhard Thomaszewski, Stelian Coros
Abstract: In this paper, we develop a computational approach for automatically discovering complex folding patterns. We demonstrate the effectiveness of our method with simulation results for a range of shapes and materials, and we validate our designs with physical prototypes.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Rip-NeRF: Anti-aliasing Radiance Fields With Ripmap-encoded Platonic Solids
Contributors: Junchen Liu, Wenbo Hu, Zhuo Yang, Jianteng Chen, Guoliang Wang, Xiaoxue Chen, Yantong Cai, Huan-ang Gao, Hao Zhao
Abstract: Rip-NeRF is an anti-aliasing 3D scene representation that integrates anisotropic pre-filtering with Platonic solid faces. It captures high-frequency anisotropic details with swift training times, achieving 37.23 PSNR on the Blender dataset within 2.6 hours of training. Due to its simplicity, other tri-plane-based methods can easily extend Rip-NeRF for better performance.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Interactive Character Control With Auto-regressive Motion Diffusion Models
Contributors: Yi Shi, Jingbo Wang, Xuekun Jiang, Bingkun Lin, Bo Dai, Xue Bin Peng
Abstract: We present A-MDM, an auto-regressive diffusion model for kinematic motion synthesis. A-MDM can be effectively trained with large motion datasets to synthesize high-quality and diverse motions. Once trained, A-MDM can be combined with various control methods to generate motions for new downstream tasks.

s_Tag: Rendering, VR/AR/MR, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Towards Motion Metamers for Foveated Rendering
Contributors: Taimoor Tariq, Piotr Didyk
Abstract: We demonstrate that foveated rendering may damage motion perception in AR/VR, leading to an under-estimation of cues such as velocity. To mitigate this, we propose the concept of motion metamers; videos that are structurally different but induce the same spatial and motion perception for the human visual system.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Alignment Conditions for NURBS-based Design of Mixed Tension-compression Grid Shells
Contributors: Masaaki Miki, Toby Mitchell
Abstract: We introduce a novel PDE that can align conjugate stress and curvature nets for shell form-finding. Users can adjust the grid using a reference grid. This allows users to design a metal-glass grid shell that can withstand gravity with bending-free axial forces and be covered by planar quadrilateral glass panels.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: MVD^2: Efficient Multiview 3D Reconstruction for Multiview Diffusion
Contributors: Xin-Yang Zheng, Hao Pan, Yu-Xiao Guo, Xin Tong, Yang Liu
Abstract: Multiview diffusion (MVD) has emerged as a prominent 3D generation technique, but faces challenges with inconsistency and view sparseness, impacting the quality of multiview 3D reconstruction. Our learning-based MVD^2 method tackles these challenges, ensuring efficient and robust 3D reconstruction with superior quality from various multiview diffusion images.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: NeRF as a Non-distant Environment Emitter in Physics-based Inverse Rendering
Contributors: Jingwang Ling, Ruihan Yu, Feng Xu, Chun Du, Shuang Zhao
Abstract: We propose utilizing NeRF as a non-distant environment lighting model in an inverse rendering pipeline. We demonstrate that our NeRF-based emitter more precisely models scene lighting than the conventional environment map, consequently enhancing the accuracy of inverse rendering.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Super-resolution Cloth Animation With Spatial and Temporal Coherence
Contributors: Jiawang Yu, Zhendong Wang
Abstract: We propose a framework for enhancing cloth animations with high-resolution details while maintaining spatial and temporal consistency. Our method combines a simulator with a GNN corrector to address discrepancies in low-resolution mesh sequences and uses an image-based, super-resolution network to enhance wrinkle details, improving cloth animation resolution by eight times.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: ColorVideoVDP: A Visual Difference Predictor for Image, Video, and Display Distortions
Contributors: Rafal K. Mantiuk, Param Hanji, Maliha Ashraf, Yuta Asano, Alexandre Chapiro
Abstract: ColorVideoVDP is a differentiable image and video quality metric that models human color and spatiotemporal vision. It is targeted and calibrated to assess image distortions due to AR/VR display technologies and video streaming, and it can handle both SDR and HDR content.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Curvature-driven Conformal Deformations
Contributors: Etienne Corman
Abstract: We introduce a novel approach for computing conformal deformations in Euclidean space while minimizing curvature-based energies. These energies serve as fundamental tools in geometry processing, essential for tasks such as surface fairing, deformation, approximations using cone metric surfaces. We establish a fundamental connection between conformal deformations and changes in curvature.

s_Tag: Animation, Machine Learning, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Velocity-based Monte Carlo Fluids
Contributors: Ryusuke Sugimoto, Christopher Batty, Toshiya Hachisuka
Abstract: We present a velocity-based Monte Carlo fluid solver with operator splitting and walk-on-boundary boundary handling, which overcomes the limitations of its existing vorticity-based counterpart. Our method can readily incorporate various techniques drawn from conventional non-Monte Carlo methods, such as buoyancy effects, divergence control capabilities, and numerical dissipation reduction methods.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: CLAY: A Controllable Large-scale Generative Model for Creating High-quality 3D Assets
Contributors: Longwen Zhang, Ziyu Wang, Qixuan Zhang, Qiwei Qiu, Anqi Pang, Haoran Jiang, Wei Yang, Lan Xu, Jingyi Yu
Abstract: Discover CLAY, the innovative 3D generative tool designed to transform imagination into digital form with ease. Powered by a 1.5 billion-parameter model, CLAY excels in creating high-quality, realistic 3D assets, enabling experts and novices alike to reignite their creative spark and bring vibrant ideas to life.

s_Tag: Animation, Geometry, Machine Learning, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: VRMM: A Volumetric Relightable Morphable Head Model
Contributors: Haotian Yang, Mingwu Zheng, Chongyang Ma, Yu-Kun Lai, Pengfei Wan, Haibin Huang
Abstract: We present the Volumetric Relightable Morphable Model (VRMM), a novel volumetric and parametric facial prior. Our VRMM utilizes a novel training framework to efficiently disentangle and encode identity, expression, and lighting into low-dimensional representations. It facilitates the reconstruction of high-quality, animatable, and relightable volumetric avatars from few-shot captures.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: I2V-Adapter: A General Image-to-Video Adapter for Diffusion Models
Contributors: Xun Guo, Mingwu Zheng, Liang Hou, Yuan Gao, Yufan Deng, Pengfei Wan, Di Zhang, Yufan Liu, Weiming Hu, Zhengjun Zha, Haibin Huang, Chongyang Ma
Abstract: We propose I2V-Adapter, a lightweight adapter module for Image-to-Video generation. Our method achieves excellent performance in general I2V scenarios and is also compatible with various plugins from the Stable Diffusion open-source community. Additionally, we propose Frame-Similarity-Prior to control the motion intensity in videos generated by the I2V model.

s_Tag: Animation, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: DressCode: Autoregressively Sewing and Generating Garments From Text Guidance
Contributors: Kai He, Kaixin Yao, Qixuan Zhang, Jingyi Yu, Lingjie Liu, Lan Xu
Abstract: DressCode presents an advanced Generative AI framework specifically designed for 3D garments. Leveraging the power of natural language, Dresscode incorporates SewingGPT for sewing pattern generation and a fine-tuned diffusion model for PBR texture synthesis, which showcases interaction-friendly applications for garment generation, completion, and editing.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: ContourCraft: Learning to Resolve Intersections in Neural Multi-garment Simulations
Contributors: Artur Grigorev, Giorgio Becherini, Michael Black, Otmar Hilliges, Bernhard Thomaszewski
Abstract: We present a learning-based solution for handling collisions and self-intersections. Our method robustly recovers from intersections introduced through missed collisions, self-penetrating bodies, or manually designed multi-layer outfits. The technical core of our method is a novel intersection contour loss that penalizes inter-penetrations and encourages rapid resolution thereof.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Bilateral Guided Radiance Field Processing
Contributors: Yuehao Wang, Chaoyi Wang, Bingchen Gong, Tianfan Xue
Abstract: Given a set of multi-view images with photometric variation, our method reconstructs a high-quality radiance field without floaters by disentangling the inconsistent camera processing across different views. Furthermore, we propose a radiance-finishing approach that can lift user-provided 2D retouching to 3D, achieving compelling renditions consistently over the entire scene.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Object-level Scene Deocclusion
Contributors: Zhengzhe Liu, Qing Liu, Chirui Chang, Jianming Zhang, Daniil Pakhomov, Haitian Zheng, Zhe Lin, Daniel Cohen-Or, Chi-Wing Fu
Abstract: In this paper, we present a new self-supervised framework, named PACO, for object-level scene deocclusion to deocclude each of the objects of a real-world scene. Our approach allows multiple downstream applications, including scene-level, single-image 3D reconstruction and object rearrangement in images and 3D scenes.

s_Tag: Animation, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Cyclogenesis: Simulating Hurricanes and Tornadoes
Contributors: Jorge Alejandro Amador Herrera, Jonathan Klein, Daoming Liu, Wojtek Pałubicki, Sören Pirk, Dominik L. Michels
Abstract: We propose a physically based approach to describe the 3D development of cyclones in a visually convincing and physically plausible manner. Modeling these processes enables us to simulate multiple hurricane and tornado phenomena.

s_Tag: Machine Learning, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Woven Fabric Capture With a Reflection-transmission Photo Pair
Contributors: Yingjie Tang, Zixuan Li, Milos Hasan, Jian Yang, Beibei Wang
Abstract: We expend previous woven fabric capture pipeline to support transmission. For that, we propose a two-layer BSDF model including a new azimuthally invariant phase function that matches multiple scattering of real fabrics well. Then we take reflection-transmission photo pair using simple setup, recovered both reflection and transmission of woven fabric.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Transparent Image Layer Diffusion Using Latent Transparency
Contributors: Lvmin Zhang, Maneesh Agrawala
Abstract: We present an approach enabling large-scale pretrained latent diffusion models like Stable Diffusion to generate transparent images and layers.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Neural-assisted Homogenization of Yarn-level Cloth
Contributors: Xudong Feng, Huamin Wang, Yin Yang, Weiwei Xu
Abstract: We introduce a neural-assisted homogenization method for yarn-level cloth. Our approach incorporates a warm-start strategy to enhance the efficiency of the homogenization process. We then use tailored loss functions in constitutive models, ensuring stability for large time-step simulations (up to 1/30 second) while boosting accuracy.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: CNS-Edit: 3D Shape Editing via Coupled Neural Shape Optimization
Contributors: Jingyu Hu, Ka-Hei Hui, Zhengzhe Liu, Hao Zhang, Chi-Wing Fu
Abstract: This paper introduces a new approach based on a coupled representation and a neural volume optimization to perform 3D shape editing in latent space. Besides, we provide a set of operators, i.e., copy, delete, resize, and drag, for the users to achieve semantic-aware and high-fidelity shape editing.

s_Tag: Design, Fabrication, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Fabric Tessellation: Realizing Freeform Surfaces by Smocking
Contributors: Aviv Segall, Jing Ren, Amir Vaxman, Olga Sorkine-Hornung
Abstract: The paper introduces a method for utilizing an embroidery technique called smocking to realize freeform surfaces from a flat piece of fabric. By combining directional field computation and continuous planar graph optimization, our algorithm outputs a stitching pattern that generates an approximation of the target shape upon stitching.

s_Tag: Animation, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Media2Face: Co-speech Facial Animation Generation With Multi-modality Guidance
Contributors: Qingcheng Zhao, Pengyu Long, Qixuan Zhang, Dafei Qin, Han Liang, Longwen Zhang, Yingliang Zhang, Jingyi Yu, Lan Xu
Abstract: Media2Face can generate highly realistic and expressive 3D facial animations from diverse multimedia inputs — audio, text, and images — trained on the largest ever co-speech 3D facial animation dataset. With Media2Face, avatars can now embody complex inner emotions with unprecedented fidelity and versatility in rich multi-modality guidance.

s_Tag: Animation, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Differentiable Voronoi Diagrams for Simulation of Cell-based Mechanical Systems
Contributors: Logan Numerow, Yue Li, Stelian Coros, Bernhard Thomaszewski
Abstract: We present a computational model leveraging analytical derivatives of Voronoi diagram geometry for simulation of cell-based mechanical systems. Boundary coupling formulation enables interaction with rigid bodies, elastic membranes, and free surfaces. Examples model complex dynamic processes involving frequent neighborhood changes, including foam coarsening and embryonic cleavage.

s_Tag: Animation, Machine Learning, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Walkin’ Robin: Walk on Stars With Robin Boundary Conditions
Contributors: Bailey Miller, Rohan Sawhney, Keenan Crane, Ioannis Gkioulekas
Abstract: We develop a grid-free Monte Carlo method for solving boundary value problems like the Poisson equation with Dirichlet, Neumann, and Robin boundary conditions. Unlike conventional PDE solvers, our method does not require volumetric meshing or global solves. It is robust, embarrassingly parallel, scalable to complex geometry, and allows view-dependent evaluation.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Flexible Motion In-betweening With Diffusion Models
Contributors: Setareh Cohan, Guy Tevet, Daniele Reda, Xue Bin Peng, Michiel van de Panne
Abstract: We introduce CondMDI, a simple and unified diffusion-based approach for text and keyframe guided motion in-betweening. CondMDI accommodates flexible keyframe placements and partial keyframes, generating high-quality and diverse motions coherent with the input constraints. Evaluation on the HumanML3D dataset showcases CondMDI's effectiveness on a diverse set of motion in-betweening tasks.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: GEM3D: GEnerative Medial Abstractions for 3D Shape Synthesis
Contributors: Dmitrii Petrov, Pradyumn Goyal, Vikas Thamizharasan, Vladimir Kim, Matheus Gadelha, Melinos Averkiou, Siddhartha Chaudhuri, Evangelos Kalogerakis
Abstract: We introduce GEM3D — a deep, topology-aware model for generating and reconstructing 3D shapes. Our key ingredient is a neural skeleton-based representation compactly encoding both shape topology and geometry. Experiments show significantly more faithful surface reconstruction and diverse shape generation compared to prior work, especially for structurally complex shapes.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Position-based Nonlinear Gauss-Seidel for Quasistatic Hyperelasticity
Contributors: Yizhou Chen, Yushan Han, Jingyu Chen, Zhan Zhang, Alex McAdams, Joseph Teran
Abstract: We show that a position-based, rather than constraint-based, nonlinear Gauss-Seidel approach resolves a number of issues with PBD, particularly in the quasistatic setting. Our approach retains the essential PBD feature of stable behavior with constrained computational budgets but also allows for convergent behavior with expanded budgets.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
