sub_Title: Split-and-Fit: Learning B-Reps via Structure-aware Voronoi Partitioning
Contributors: Yilin Liu, Jiale Chen, Shanshan Pan, Daniel Cohen-Or, Hao Zhang, Hui Huang
Abstract: The Split-and-Fit method introduces a top-down, structure-aware strategy for reconstructing B-Rep models, using Voronoi diagrams to partition the space and followed by primitive fitting. We design NVD-Net to accurately predict these partitions from point clouds or distance fields, resulting in significantly improved reconstruction quality and generalizability compared to previous methods.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: 3Doodle: Compact Abstraction of Objects With 3D Strokes
Contributors: Changwoon Choi, Jaeah Lee, Jaesik Park, Young Min Kim
Abstract: We propose 3Doodle, a compact and efficient representation to convey characteristics of an object. Our approach generates 3D strokes from multi-view images. We express 3D sketch with contour of superquadrics (view-dependent component) and 3D cubic Bezier curves (view-independent component). 3Doodle can robustly obtain 3D sketch of various class of objects.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: BoostMVSNeRFs: Boosting MVS-based NeRFs to Generalizable View Synthesis in Large-scale Scenes
Contributors: Chih-Hai Su, Chih-Yao Hu, Shr-Ruei Tsai, Jie-Ying Lee, Chin-Yang Lin, Yu-Lun Liu
Abstract: BoostMVSNeRFs revolutionizes 3D scene visualization by improving the quality of large-scale MVS-based NeRFs. This innovative technique combines multiple cost volumes with 3D visibility scores to enhance novel view synthesis without additional training. Compatible with current frameworks, it sets new 3D reconstruction and visualization standards, offering significant quality and efficiency improvements.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: GaussianPrediction: Dynamic 3D Gaussian Prediction for Motion Extrapolation and Free View Synthesis
Contributors: Boming Zhao, Yuan Li, Ziyu Sun, Lin Zeng, Yujun Shen, Rui Ma, Yinda Zhang, Hujun Bao, Zhaopeng Cui
Abstract: We present a novel framework, GaussianPrediction, for forecasting future scenarios in dynamic scenes. GaussianPrediction employs a 3D Gaussian canonical space with deformation modeling and lifecycle property to represent changes effectively. Additionally, a novel concentric motion distillation technique with key points simplifies complex scene motion prediction with a GCN.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: GPU-accelerated Rendering of Vector Brush Strokes
Contributors: Shen Ciao, Zhongyue Guan, Qianxi Liu, Li-Yi Wei, Zeyu Wang
Abstract: This paper introduces GPU-accelerated rendering techniques for digital painting and animation to bridge the gap between raster and vector stroke representations, including the support for different brush types (vanilla, stamp, airbrush) and an open-source prototype system that can dynamically update stroke appearances and color fills given edited vector paths.

s_Tag: AI, Machine Learning, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Training-free Consistent Text-to-image Generation
Contributors: Yoad Tewel, Omri Kaduri, Rinon Gal, Yoni Kasten, Lior Wolf, Gal Chechik, Yuval Atzmon
Abstract: Text-to-image models allow users to generate individual images guided by language. In this work, we enable Stable Diffusion XL (SDXL) to generate consistent subjects across a series of images, without additional training.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Reach for the Arcs: Reconstructing Surfaces From SDFs via Tangent Points
Contributors: Silvia Sellán, Yingying Ren, Christopher Batty, Oded Stein
Abstract: We introduce an algorithm to reconstruct a mesh from discrete signed distance function (SDF) samples. We use the information contained in the SDF to construct an oriented point cloud that is then converted into a triangle mesh. Our method has no restrictions on topology.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Surface-filling Curve Flows via Implicit Medial Axes
Contributors: Yuta Noma, Silvia Sellán, Nicholas Sharp, Karan Singh, Alec Jacobson
Abstract: We introduce a fast, robust, and user-controllable algorithm to generate surface-filling curves. We compute these curves through the gradient flow of a simple sparse energy. Our algorithm makes minimal assumptions on the input surface, achieving improved robustness. Our framework provides tuneable parameters, making it ideal for interactive design applications.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: CWF: Consolidating Weak Features in High-quality Mesh Simplification
Contributors: Rui Xu, Longdu Liu, Ningna Wang, Shuangmin Chen, Shiqing Xin, Xiaohu Guo, Zichun Zhong, Taku Komura, Wenping Wang, Changhe Tu
Abstract: In this paper, we propose an objective function that concurrently integrates the requirements of accuracy, triangle quality, and feature alignment in high-quality mesh simplification. Our function incorporates the normal anisotropy term and the CVT energy term, balanced with a decaying weight.

s_Tag: Rendering, VR/AR/MR, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Saccade-contingent Rendering
Contributors: Yuna Kwak, Eric Penner, Xuan Wang, Mohammad R. Saeedpour-Parizi, Olivier Mercier, Xiuyun Wu, Scott Murdison, Phillip Guan
Abstract: In this work we introduce saccade-contingent rendering, a perceptually optimized rendering technique which takes advantage of reductions in visual acuity after saccades.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: A Hierarchical 3D Gaussian Representation for Real-time Rendering of Very Large Scenes
Contributors: Bernhard Kerbl, Andreas Meuleman, Georgios Kopanas, Michael Wimmer, Alexandre Lanvin, George Drettakis
Abstract: We introduce a hierarchy for 3D Gaussian splatting, merging primitives in a way that preserves speed and quality. We divide the scene into chunks, each having a hierarchy that is further optimized. A consolidated hierarchy allows reconstruction and real-time rendering of very large scenes of tens of thousands of images.

s_Tag: Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Stylized Rendering as a Function of Expectation
Contributors: Rex West, Sayan Mukherjee
Abstract: We propose a generalization of the rendering equation that captures both realistic light transport and a class of stylized visuals in the same formulation. This allows physical effects like glossy reflections and color bleed to affect stylized visuals, and vice versa.

s_Tag: Animation, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Portrait3D: Text-guided High-quality 3D Portrait Generation Using Pyramid Representation and GANs Prior
Contributors: Yiqian Wu, Hao Xu, Xiangjun Tang, Xien Chen, Siyu Tang, Zhebin Zhang, Chen Li, Xiaogang Jin
Abstract: We present Portrait3D, a novel text-to-3D-portrait generation framework that produces high-quality, view-consistent, realistic, and canonical 3D portraits that are in alignment with the input text prompts.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Neural Gaussian Scale-space Fields
Contributors: Felix Mujkanovic, Ntumba Elie Nsampi, Christian Theobalt, Hans-Peter Seidel, Thomas Leimkühler
Abstract: We present a method to learn a fully continuous Gaussian scale-space from raw data. This allows efficient and flexible anisotropic filtering and can be used to create multiscale representations across a broad range of modalities and applications.

s_Tag: Animation, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Going With the Flow
Contributors: Yousuf Soliman, Marcel Padilla, Oliver Gross, Felix Knöppel, Ulrich Pinkall, Peter Schröder
Abstract: Given a sequence of poses of a body in a fluid medium, we derive generalized rigid body dynamics equations. These account for fluid inertia and drag-lift forces based on local approximations. This obviates the need for simulating the fluid itself and yet yields subtle fluid mediated motion effects.

s_Tag: Animation, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: A Vortex Particle-on-mesh Method for Soap Film Simulation
Contributors: Ningxiao Tao, Liangwang Ruan, Yitong Deng, Bo Zhu, Bin Wang, Baoquan Chen
Abstract: We introduce a sophisticated vortex particle method for precise tangential flow simulations on membranes. It uniquely splits membrane velocity into circulation and expansion, employing a hybrid particle-mesh technique to integrate surfactant and thickness dynamics. This method accurately captures complex thin film interactions, facilitating highly realistic simulations.

s_Tag: Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: A Free-space Diffraction BSDF
Contributors: Shlomi Steinberg, Ravi Ramamoorthi, Benedikt Bitterli, Arshiya Mollazainali, Eugene d'Eon, Matt Pharr
Abstract: Free-space diffractions are an optical phenomenon where light diffracts (bends) around the geometric edges and corners of scene objects. In this paper, we present an efficient method to simulate such effects and show that we can run wave simulations on scenes orders-of-magnitude more complex than what's possible with the state of the art.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Creating LEGO Figurines From Single Images
Contributors: Jiahao Ge, Mingjun Zhou, Wenrui Bao, Hao Xu, Chi-Wing Fu
Abstract: This paper introduces a three-stage computational pipeline for creating personalized LEGO figurines from portrait photos: CLIP-guided template-model creation, decal extraction and generation, and physical construction. The resulting figurines not only look like the inputs in the portrait photos with good visual quality but are also physically assemble-able by LEGO pieces.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Semantic Shape Editing With Parametric Implicit Templates
Contributors: Uday Kusupati, Mathieu Gaillard, Jean-Marc Thiery, Adrien Kaiser
Abstract: We introduce a new way to edit meshes using interpretable parameters by leveraging a parametric implicit representation as the underlying template. For a generic parametric implicit, we fit the template to the input mesh and realize parametric edits on the mesh using our mesh deformation algorithm that tracks implicit signatures.

s_Tag: Rendering, VR/AR/MR, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Holographic Parallax Improves 3D Perceptual Realism
Contributors: Dongyeon Kim, Seung-Woo Nam, Suyeon Choi, Jong-Mo Seo, Gordon Wetzstein, Yoonchan Jeong
Abstract: Holographic displays offer promising solutions for future VR/AR display platforms. In this study, we investigate the perceptual implications of various CGH algorithms. Our results reveal that the inclusion of parallax cues significantly enhances perceptual realism and will help guide the community toward passing the visual Turing test of displays.

s_Tag: Animation, Geometry, Machine Learning, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Spatial and Surface Correspondence Field for Interaction Transfer
Contributors: Zeyu Huang, Honghao Xu, Haibin Huang, Chongyang Ma, Hui Huang, Ruizhen Hu
Abstract: We introduce a new method for the task of interaction transfer. Given an example interaction between a source object and an agent, our method can automatically infer both surface and spatial relationships for the agent and target objects within the same category, yielding more accurate and valid transfers.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: LGTM: Local-to-Global Text-driven Human Motion Diffusion Model
Contributors: Haowen Sun, Ruikun Zheng, Haibin Huang, Chongyang Ma, Hui Huang, Ruizhen Hu
Abstract: We introduce LGTM, a novel Local-to-Global pipeline for Text-to-Motion generation based on diffusion model. It decomposes motion description to body-part level with LLMs and encodes them with corresponding body part motion individually, then optimizes whole body motion by attention encoder. As a result, it can generate local semantics well-matched motion.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Cross-image Attention for Zero-shot Appearance Transfer
Contributors: Yuval Alaluf, Daniel Garibi, Or Patashnik, Hadar Averbuch-Elor, Daniel Cohen-Or
Abstract: Our zero-shot appearance transfer approach leverages the semantic understanding of text-to-image models to transfer visual appearance across semantically similar objects. Using our cross-image attention, we establish semantic correspondences between two images, combining one image's structure with another's appearance during generation. This allows transferring appearance across diverse inputs with no model training.

s_Tag: Real-Time, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Mob-FGSR: Frame Generation and Super Resolution for Mobile Real-time Rendering
Contributors: Sipeng Yang, Qingchuan Zhu, Junhao Zhuge, Qiang Qiu, Chen Li, Yuzhong Yan, Huihui Xu, Ling-Qi Yan, Xiaogang Jin
Abstract: We propose Mob-FGSR, a lightweight supersampling framework designed specifically for mobile devices, integrating frame generation with super-resolution to significantly enhance real-time rendering performance. This method operates efficiently without high-end GPUs or dedicated hardware, surpassing other lightweight solutions in extensive testing, and shows great potential for mobile real-time rendering applications.

s_Tag: AI, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Coin3D: Controllable and Interactive 3D Assets Generation With Proxy-guided Conditioning
Contributors: Wenqi Dong, Bangbang Yang, Lin Ma, Xiao Liu, Liyuan Cui, Hujun Bao, Yuewen Ma, Zhaopeng Cui
Abstract: Coin3D is a controllable and interactive 3D assets generation framework, which integrates 3D-aware controllability from coarse geometry to the 3D generation using a volumetric-based 3D adapter. Our interactive modeling workflow facilitates seamless part-aware editing, allows for previewing the edited results in seconds, and supports high-quality mesh reconstruction.

s_Tag: Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: A Realistic Multi-scale Surface-based Cloth Appearance Model
Contributors: Junqiu Zhu, Christophe Hery, Lukas Bode, Carlos Aliaga, Adrian Jarabo, Ling-Qi Yan, Matt Jen-Yuan Chiang
Abstract: We present a multi-scale, surface-based cloth appearance model which is efficient and photo-realistic. We propose a comprehensive micro-scale model focusing on correct parallax effects and a practical meso-scale integration scheme, emphasizing efficiency while losslessly preserving accurate highlights and self-shadowing. Our multi-scale model achieves a 30x acceleration compared to the state of the art.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: A Construct-optimize Approach to Sparse View Synthesis Without Camera Pose
Contributors: Kaiwen Jiang, Yang Fu, Mukund Varma T, Yash Belhe, Xiaolong Wang, Hao Su, Ravi Ramamoorthi
Abstract: We leverage the 3D Gaussian splatting method to develop a novel construct-and-optimize method for sparse view synthesis without camera poses. We demonstrate results on the Tanks and Temples and Static Hikes datasets with as few as three widely spaced views, showing significantly better quality than competing pose-required and pose-free methods.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: 2D Gaussian Splatting for Geometrically Accurate Radiance Fields
Contributors: Binbin Huang, Zehao Yu, Anpei Chen, Andreas Geiger, Shenghua Gao
Abstract: 2D Gaussian Splatting (2DGS) improves upon 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS) by converting 3D volumes into 2D Gaussian disks. It employs perspective-accurate 2D splatting, integrates depth distortion and normal consistency for improved reconstructions, and offers detailed geometry reconstruction with fast training and real-time rendering through a differentiable renderer.

s_Tag: AI, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: DreamMat: High-quality PBR Material Generation With Geometry- and Light-aware Diffusion Models
Contributors: Yuqing Zhang, Yuan Liu, Zhiyu Xie, Lei Yang, Zhongyuan Liu, Mengzhou Yang, Runze Zhang, Qilong Kou, Cheng Lin, Wenping Wang, Xiaogang Jin
Abstract: This paper introduces DreamMat, a novel approach for creating high-quality appearances on an untextured mesh by generating PBR materials from a geometry- and light-aware diffusion model. The resulting PBR materials are free from baked-in lighting and shadows, suitable for applications in gaming or film production.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: A Linear Method to Consistently Orient Normals of a 3D Point Cloud
Contributors: Craig Gotsman, Kai Hormann
Abstract: Consistently orienting the normals of a point cloud is vital for subsequent geometry processing. We use Stokes' theorem to turn this problem into finding the least-squares solution of a sparse linear system. Our method successfully orients normals computed locally from a point cloud and is considerably faster than state-of-the-art methods.

s_Tag: AI, Machine Learning, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: The Chosen One: Consistent Characters in Text-to-image Diffusion Models
Contributors: Omri Avrahami, Amir Hertz, Yael Vinker, Moab Arar, Shlomi Fruchter, Ohad Fried, Daniel Cohen-Or, Dani Lischinski
Abstract: Given a text prompt describing a character, our method distills a representation that enables consistent depiction of the same character in novel contexts.

s_Tag: Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Quad-optimized Low-discrepancy Sequences
Contributors: Victor Ostromoukhov, David Coeurjolly, Nicolas Bonneel, Jean-Claude Iehl
Abstract: This paper introduces multi-dimensional low-discrepancy sequences, in base 3 instead of the usual base 2, optimized over groups of 4 consecutive dimensions, while keeping good uniformity for non-optimized n-tuples of dimensions. We improve over Sobol' sequences in terms of sample uniformity in 2D and 4D.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: NeurCADRecon: Neural Representation for Reconstructing CAD Surfaces by Enforcing Zero Gaussian Curvature
Contributors: Qiujie Dong, Rui Xu, Pengfei Wang, Shuangmin Chen, Shiqing Xin, Xiaohong Jia, Wenping Wang, Changhe Tu
Abstract: In this paper, we present a self-supervised neural representation aimed at reconstructing CAD models from low-quality, unoriented point clouds. Our approach stands out from traditional reconstruction methods by applying a zero Gaussian curvature constraint, which emphasizes the characteristic of being almost developable and enhances the preservation of feature points/lines.

s_Tag: Fabrication, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Accelerating Saccadic Response Through Spatial and Temporal Cross-modal Misalignments
Contributors: Daniel Jiménez Navarro, Xi Peng, Yunxiang Zhang, Karol Myszkowski, Hans-Peter Seidel, Qi Sun, Ana Serrano
Abstract: We investigate how auditory cues affect saccadic latency to a visual target, showing that preceding sounds can significantly reduce latency. We study several factors: eccentricity of the visual stimulus and spatio-temporal shifts of the audio stimulus. We discuss various applications and validate our findings in a more realistic setting.

s_Tag: Animation, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: S3: Speech, Script, and Scene Driven Head and Eye Animation
Contributors: Yifang Pan, Rishabh Agrawal, Karan Singh
Abstract: Our method generates 3D head and eye animations for characters in conversation using audio, scripts, and scene inputs. It incorporates animator goals and psycho-linguistic insights, producing realistic animations that align with human behavior and compares favorably with existing approaches, as confirmed by both experts and non-experts.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Stabler Neo-Hookean Simulation: Absolute Eigenvalue Filtering for Projected Newton
Contributors: Honglin Chen, Hsueh-Ti Derek Liu, David I.W. Levin, Changxi Zheng, Alec Jacobson
Abstract: We introduce a novel eigenvalue filtering strategy for projected Newton's method to stabilize the optimization of Neo-Hookean energy under high Poisson's ratios (near 0.5) and large initial volume change. Our method only requires a single line of code change, while achieving significant improvement in both stability and convergence speed.

s_Tag: Animation, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Real-time Wing Deformation Simulations for Flying Insects
Contributors: Qiang Chen, Zhigang Deng, Feng Li, Yuming Fang, Tingsong Lu, Yang Tong, Yifan Zuo
Abstract: This paper presents an efficient skeleton-driven model specifically designed to real-time simulate realistic wing deformations across a wide range of flying insects. Various simulation experiments, comparisons, and user studies demonstrated the effectiveness, robustness, and adaptability of the proposed model.

s_Tag: AI, Machine Learning, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Blue Noise for Diffusion Models
Contributors: Xingchang Huang, Corentin Salaun, Cristina Vasconcelos, Christian Theobalt, Cengiz Oztireli, Gurprit Singh
Abstract: Most existing diffusion models use Gaussian noise for training. We introduce a novel class of deterministic diffusion models using time-varying noise (i.e., from white to blue noise) to incorporate correlation within images during training. Further, our framework allows introducing correlation across images within a single mini-batch to improve gradient flow.

s_Tag: Machine Learning, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: ZeroGrads: Learning Local Surrogates for Non-differentiable Graphics
Contributors: Michael Fischer, Tobias Ritschel
Abstract: ZeroGrads learns a mapping between a graphic pipeline's input parameters and the corresponding loss. The gradient of this mapping can then be used for inverse optimization, enabling the optimization of black-box graphics problems.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Repulsive Shells
Contributors: Josua Sassen, Henrik Schumacher, Martin Rumpf, Keenan Crane
Abstract: Shape spaces are a powerful tool for nonlinear interpolation, extrapolation, and averaging of geometric data, but previous shape spaces permit geometry to self-intersect in nonphysical ways. We introduce a shape space where geometry naturally avoids intersection, as well as an adaptive collision potential that prevents collision while converging under refinement.

s_Tag: Design, Fabrication, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: FlexScale: Modeling and Characterization of Flexible Scaled Sheets
Contributors: Juan Sebastian Montes Maestre, Yinwei Du, Ronan Hinchet, Stelian Coros, Bernhard Thomaszewski
Abstract: We present a computational approach for modeling the mechanical behavior of flexible scaled sheet materials — 3D-printed hard scales embedded in a soft substrate. We propose a contact-aware homogenization approach that distills native-level simulation data into a novel macro-mechanical model combining bi-quadratic uniaxial fits with polar interpolation using circular harmonics.

s_Tag: Animation, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Physical Non-inertial Poser (PNP): Modeling Non-inertial Effects in Sparse-inertial Human Motion Capture
Contributors: Xinyu Yi, Yuxiao Zhou, Feng Xu
Abstract: We propose a novel approach for human motion capture using sparse inertial sensors, considering the non-inertial behavior of the root frame during acceleration and rotation. By modeling fictitious forces and using a novel IMU measurement synthesis technique, accurate motion capture is achieved with improved robustness.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Strategy and Skill Learning for Physics-based Table Tennis Animation
Contributors: Jiashun Wang, Jungdam Won, Jessica Hodgins
Abstract: We present a strategy and skill learning approach for physics-based table tennis animation. We demonstrate a hierarchical control system for diversified skill learning and a strategy learning framework for effective decision-making. Our strategy learning framework is validated through both agent-agent interaction and human-agent interaction in virtual reality.

s_Tag: Real-Time, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Real-time Physically Guided Hair Interpolation
Contributors: Jerry Hsu, Tongtong Wang, Zherong Pan, Xifeng Gao, Cem Yuksel, Kui Wu
Abstract: Linear interpolation can often cause severe deformation artifacts in hair for which alternatives often entail expensive training or precomputation. Instead, we present a novel force-based hair interpolation scheme to leverage existing real-time simulation data for a robust interpolation with very little overhead and no expensive training.

s_Tag: Animation, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Proxy Asset Generation for Cloth Simulation in Games
Contributors: Zhongtian Zheng, Tongtong Wang, Qijia Feng, Zherong Pan, Xifeng Gao, Kui Wu
Abstract: This paper presents an automatic pipeline to convert an ill-conditioned high-resolution visual mesh into a single-layer, low-poly proxy mesh. Our approach simulates proxy mesh based on specific use scenarios and optimizes skinning weights, relying on differential skinning with several well-designed loss functions to ensure skinned mesh appears plausible in simulation.

s_Tag: Animation, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Kinetic Simulation of Turbulent Multifluid Flows
Contributors: Wei Li, Kui Wu, Mathieu Desbrun
Abstract: We propose a LBM-based simulation of separated multiphase flows. Our use of HOME-LBM encoded velocity-based distributions offers a fast, accurate, and low-memory solver enabling efficient turbulent multiphase simulations of miscible, immiscible, or even partially miscible fluids.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Vertex Block Descent
Contributors: Anka H. Chen, Ziheng Liu, Yin Yang, Cem Yuksel
Abstract: We introduce an efficient and unconditionally stable solution for the variational form of implicit time integrator through vertex-level position updates with Gauss-Seidel iterations. It can achieve numerical convergence and provides superior performance to alternative techniques for elastic body dynamics. It can also be used for particle-based simulations and rigid bodies.

s_Tag: Animation, Machine Learning, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Neural Monte Carlo Fluid Simulation
Contributors: Pranav Jain, Ziyin Qu, Peter Yichen Chen, Oded Stein
Abstract: We present a novel neural network representation for fluid simulation that augments neural fields with explicitly enforced boundary conditions and a Monte Carlo pressure solver to eliminate all weakly enforced boundary conditions. Our method is mesh-free and can accurately represent vorticity phenomena like the von Kármán vortex street.

s_Tag: Real-Time, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Deep Fourier-based Arbitrary-scale Super-resolution for Real-time Rendering
Contributors: Haonan Zhang, Jie Guo, Jiawei Zhang, Haoyu Qin, Zesen Feng, Ming Yang, Yanwe Guo
Abstract: By observing that high-resolution G-buffers possess similar spectrum to high-resolution rendered frame, we propose a method by supporting arbitrary-scale super-resolution for a trained neural model. The key is a Fourier-based implicit neural representation which maps arbitrary and naturally continuous coordinates to valid pixel values.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Eulerian-Lagrangian Fluid Simulation on Particle Flow Maps
Contributors: Junwei Zhou, Duowen Chen, Molin Deng, Yitong Deng, Yuchen Sun, Sinan Wang, Shiying Xiong, Bo Zhu
Abstract: We introduce Particle Flow Maps (PFM), a fluid simulation method outperforming Neural Flow Maps (NFM) in efficiency and maintaining high accuracy. By leveraging particle trajectories and an Eulerian-Lagrangian framework, PFM achieves up to 49 times faster computation and 41\% less memory usage while better preserving vorticity in complex fluid dynamics.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Implicit Swept Volume SDF: Enabling Continuous Collision-free Trajectory Generation for Arbitrary Shapes
Contributors: Jingping Wang, Tingrui Zhang, Qixuan Zhang, Chuxiao Zeng, Jingyi Yu, Chao Xu, Lan Xu, Fei Gao
Abstract: Our innovative approach to trajectory generation seamlessly navigates the complexities of continuous collision avoidance for objects in challenging environments. Leveraging the Swept Volume Signed Distance Field, our hierarchical pipeline outperforms traditional methods by deftly handling non-convex geometries without sacrificing solution space or succumbing to the tunnel effect.

s_Tag: Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Target-aware Image Denoising for Inverse Monte Carlo Rendering
Contributors: Jeongmin Gu, Jonghee Back, Sung-Eui Yoon, Bochang Moon
Abstract: We present a novel image denoiser to improve the convergence of inverse rendering optimization, which infers scene parameters by matching a rendering image to a user-specified target image. We reformulate a regression-based denoiser using the target image to make the optimization with our denoising robust for various inverse rendering tasks.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Taming Diffusion Probabilistic Models for Character Control
Contributors: Rui Chen, Mingyi Shi, Shaoli Huang, Ping Tan, Taku Komura, Xuelin Chen
Abstract: We present a novel character control framework that enables real-time generation of high-quality, diverse character animations in response to user interactive control. Our framework supports the animation of characters in various styles using a single, unified model.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: High-quality Surface Reconstruction Using Gaussian Surfels
Contributors: Pinxuan Dai, Jiamin Xu, Wenxiang Xie, Xinguo Liu, Huamin Wang, Weiwei Xu
Abstract: We introduce Gaussian surfels, a novel point-based representation that flattens 3D Gaussian ellipsoids into 2D ellipses. This representation combines the advantages of the flexible optimization procedure in 3D Gaussian points and the surface alignment property of surfels, resulting in superior performance in both surface reconstruction and view synthesis.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: 3D-Layers: Bringing Layer-based Color Editing to VR Painting
Contributors: Emilie Yu, Fanny Chevalier, Karan Singh, Adrien Bousseau
Abstract: We introduce 3D-Layers, a new data structure and companion rendering algorithm to perform layered painting in VR. We define 3D-Layers as groups of 3D strokes, and we distinguish the ones that represent 3D geometry from the ones that represent color modifications of the geometry.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Neural Bounding
Contributors: Stephanie Wenxin Liu, Michael Fischer, Paul D. Yoo, Tobias Ritschel
Abstract: Our research introduces a neural approach to bounding volumes, conservatively classifying space across diverse dimensions and scenes. The key is a novel loss function that produces minimal false negatives. Our method extends to non-neural and hybrid representations. We also propose an early exit strategy that accelerates query speeds by 25%.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Simplicits: Mesh-free, Geometry-agnostic Elastic Simulation
Contributors: Vismay Modi, Nicholas Sharp, Or Perel, Shinjiro Sueda, David Levin
Abstract: Simplicits is a versatile framework for reduced elastic simulations of 3D objects in any geometric representation such as gaussian splats, SDFs, point-clouds, an even medical scans. Our mesh-free, grid-free method utilizes implicit neural fields to construct a physics-aware subspace of the object via our data-free training process.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Temporal Acoustic Point Holography
Contributors: Giorgos Christopoulos, Lei Gao, Diego Martinez Plasencia, Marta Betcke, Ryuji Hirayama, Sriram Subramanian
Abstract: In this work, we develop temporal phase retrieval algorithms for acoustic point holography. We satisfy acoustic field amplitude objectives, while suppressing transducers’ phase change over time, to enable dynamic 3D particle displays with minimum geometric restrictions. We experimentally demonstrate our algorithms’ capabilities with levitated particle displays of human character animations.

s_Tag: AI, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: TexSliders: Diffusion-based Texture Editing in CLIP Space
Contributors: Julia Guerrero-Viu, Milos Hasan, Arthur Roullier, Midhun Harikumar, Yiwei Hu, Paul Guerrero, Diego Gutiérrez, Belen Masia, Valentin Deschaintre
Abstract: We propose a novel, diffusion-based approach for texture editing. We define editing directions using simple text prompts, map these to CLIP image-embedding space, and project the directions to a CLIP subspace that minimizes identity variations. Our editing pipeline facilitates the creation of arbitrary sliders using text only, without ground-truth data.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: RGB↔X: Image Decomposition and Synthesis Using Material- and Lighting-aware Diffusion Models
Contributors: Zheng Zeng, Valentin Deschaintre, Iliyan Georgiev, Yannick Hold-Geoffroy, Yiwei Hu, Fujun Luan, Ling-Qi Yan, Miloš Hašan
Abstract: We present models for image decomposition into intrinsic channels (RGB→X) and image synthesis from such channels (X→RGB) in a unified conditional diffusion framework. We believe it can bring benefits to a wide range of downstream editing tasks including material editing, relighting, and realistic rendering from simple/under-specified scene definitions.

s_Tag: Fabrication, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: AONeuS: A Neural Rendering Framework for Acoustic-optical Sensor Fusion
Contributors: Mohamad Qadri, Kevin Zhang, Akshay Hinduja, Michael Kaess, Adithya Pediredla, Christopher Metzler
Abstract: Underwater 3D surface reconstruction has broad applications. Often, submersibles must capture measurements from a small baseline. Small baselines make 3D reconstruction more challenging. We present an acoustic-optical neural surface reconstruction framework (AONeuS), which fuses complementary sonar and optical measurements to reconstruct accurate 3D surfaces from measurements captured over small baselines.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Iterative Motion Editing With Natural Language
Contributors: Purvi Goel, Kuan-Chieh Wang, C. Karen Liu, Kayvon Fatahalian
Abstract: We present a method for using natural language to iteratively and conversationally specify local edits to existing character animations. Our key idea is to represent a space of motion edits using a set of operators that have well-defined semantics for how to modify specific frames of a target motion.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: VR-GS: A Physical Dynamics-aware Interactive Gaussian Splatting System in Virtual Reality
Contributors: Ying Jiang, Chang Yu, Tianyi Xie, Xuan Li, Yutao Feng, Huamin Wang, Minchen Li, Henry Lau, Feng Gao, Yin Yang, Chenfanfu Jiang
Abstract: We introduce VR-GS, a physics-aware, interactive VR system for immersive manipulation of 3D content represented with Gaussian Splatting. We utilize XPBD simulation to ensure real-time interactivity, where Gaussian kernels are deformed by cage meshes using two-level embeddings. Our system integrates segmentation, inpainting, and shadow maps to ensure an immersive experience.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: A Dynamic Duo of Finite Elements and Material Points
Contributors: Xuan Li, Minchen Li, Xuchen Han, Huamin Wang, Yin Yang, Chenfanfu Jiang
Abstract: DynamicDuo is a novel framework designed to integrate FEM and MPM seamlessly. The IMEX framework combines the optimal performance of implicit FEM and the flexibility of explicit MPM in applying plasticity. We achieve this through asynchronous time-splitting, where IPC is applied to model inter-domain frictional contact between FEM and MPM.

s_Tag: Real-Time, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Modeling Hair Strands With Roving Capsules
Contributors: Alexander Reshetov, David Hart
Abstract: The paper derives a parametric representation for swept sphere shapes and proposes an efficient ray-surface intersection algorithm using capsules that are dynamically defined per ray at runtime. This new algorithm is more than twice as fast as previous approaches and can be used for hair and fur rendering.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: QT-Font: High-efficiency Font Synthesis via Quadtree-based Diffusion Models
Contributors: Yitian Liu, Zhouhui Lian
Abstract: We propose a novel sparse glyph representation via quadtree and an efficient font synthesis method via dual quadtree and discrete diffusion model, QT-Font. QT-Font, compared to existing approaches, can generate high-resolution glyph images with superior quality and more visually pleasing details, meanwhile significantly reducing both parameter sizes and computational costs.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Generative Escher Meshes
Contributors: Noam Aigerman, Thibault Groueix
Abstract: This work achieves a text-guided automatic technique for generating visually pleasing 2D tilings similar to the works of M.C. Escher. The method relies on a new parameterization of the space of valid tiles using Orbifold Tutte Embeddings and spaces of Laplacians, which enables simple gradient-based optimization.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Capacitive Touch Sensing on General 3D Surfaces
Contributors: Gianpaolo Palma, Narges Pourjafarian, Jürgen Steimle, Paolo Cignoni
Abstract: The paper proposes a new method to adapt the common grid of electrodes of a mutual-capacitive sensor to generic 3D surfaces, minimizing the number of controllers and input/output pins. The tested prototypes show precise and robust multi-touch detection with excellent Signal-to-Noise Ratio and spatial accuracy.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Fabricable 3D Wire Art
Contributors: Kenji Tojo, Ariel Shamir, Bernd Bickel, Nobuyuki Umetani
Abstract: We computationally create fabricable 3D wire sculptures from various input modalities, including 3D models, images, and texts. Our curve design algorithm automatically abstracts the various inputs using a pre-trained, vision-language model and ensures fabricability using geometrical constraints. 3D-printable jigs are also computationally generated to bend wires to fabricate the design.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Efficient Position-based Deformable Colon Modeling for Endoscopic Procedures Simulation
Contributors: Marcelo Martins, Lucas Morais, Rafael Torchelsen, Luciana Nedel, Anderson Maciel
Abstract: Longstanding challenges hinder the realism of surgery simulators. Explicitly focusing on colonoscopy, traditional algorithms fail to represent the complexities of the endoscope interacting with the colon. Our approach, rooted in XPBD with a Cosserat rod constraint and a novel contact detection algorithm for tubular structures, enables accurate modeling of colonoscopy.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: RTG-SLAM: Real-time 3D Reconstruction at Scale Using Gaussian Splatting
Contributors: Zhexi Peng, Tianjia Shao, Yong Liu, Jingke Zhou, Yin Yang, Jingdong Wang, Kun Zhou
Abstract: RTG-SLAM is a real-time 3D reconstruction system using Gaussian splatting. It is also memory efficient, enabling reconstruction of large-scale environments. Comparisons demonstrate RTG-SLAM runs at around twice the speed of the state-of-the-art, NeRF-based SLAM, with around half the memory cost (e.g., 17.9 fps, 8.8 GB versus 8.65 fps, 17.3 GB).

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: NeuralTO: Neural Reconstruction and View Synthesis of Translucent Objects
Contributors: Yuxiang Cai, Jiaxiong Qiu, Zhong Li, Bo Ren
Abstract: We introduce a novel, two-stages framework, which is geared toward high-fidelity surface reconstruction and the novel-view synthesis of translucent objects. In our framework, we propose a theoretical model for the neural radiance field of translucent objects, which parametrizes the density field using a constant extinction coefficient.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: StopThePop: Sorted Gaussian Splatting for View-consistent Real-time Rendering
Contributors: Lukas Radl, Michael Steiner, Mathias Parger, Alexander Weinrauch, Bernhard Kerbl, Markus Steinberger
Abstract: StopThePop, our novel hierarchical rasterizer, enhances 3D Gaussian Splatting by eliminating popping artifacts caused by global sorting. Our proposed hierarchical, approximate per-pixel sort significantly improves view-consistency for novel-view synthesis, while sophisticated culling and load balancing strategies compensate for the implied computational overhead.

s_Tag: AI, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: BlockFusion: Expandable 3D Scene Generation Using Latent Tri-plane Extrapolation
Contributors: Zhennan Wu, Yang Li, Han Yan, Taizhang Shang, Weixuan Sun, Senbo Wang, Ruikai Cui, Weizhe Liu, Hiroyuki Sato, Hongdong Li, Pan Ji
Abstract: BlockFusion is a 3D diffusion-based model that generates and expands 3D scenes using unit blocks. The denoising diffusion process allows high-quality and diverse scene generation and auto-regressive scene expansion. BlockFusion generates large, high-quality 3D scenes for indoor and outdoor scenarios.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: 3D Gaussian Splatting With Deferred Reflection
Contributors: Keyang Ye, Qiming Hou, Kun Zhou
Abstract: We present a deferred shading method to effectively render specular reflection with Gaussian splatting, achieving high-quality rendering superior to state-of-the-art methods for both synthetic and real-world scenes. It runs at real-time frame rates almost identical to vanilla Gaussian splatting and produces accurate normal and environment map estimation.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: SMEAR: Stylized Motion Exaggeration With ARt-direction
Contributors: Jean Basset, Pierre Bénard, Pascal Barla
Abstract: Smear frames are routinely used by artists for the expressive depiction of motion in animations. In this paper, we present an automatic, art-directable method and its Blender implementation for the generation of smear frames in 3D, with a focus on elongated in-betweens where an object is stretched along its trajectory.

s_Tag: Animation, Geometry, Modeling, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Learning a Generalized Physical Face Model From Data
Contributors: Lingchen Yang, Gaspard Zoss, Prashanth Chandran, Markus Gross, Barbara Solenthaler, Eftychios Sifakis, Derek Bradley
Abstract: In this work, we aim to democratize physics-based facial animation by proposing a generalized physical face model that we learn from a large 3D face dataset. Once trained, our model can be quickly fit to any unseen identity and automatically produce a ready-to-animate physical face model.

s_Tag: AI, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Diffusion Texture Painting
Contributors: Anita Hu, Nishkrit Desai, Hassan Abu Alhaija, Seung Wook Kim, Maria Shugrina
Abstract: We present a technique that leverages 2D generative diffusion models for interactive texture painting on the surface of 3D meshes. Unlike existing texture painting systems, our method allows artists to paint with any complex image texture. Our brush generates seamless strokes in real-time and inpaint realistic transitions between different textures.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: X-Portrait: Expressive Portrait Animation With Hierarchical Motion Attention
Contributors: You Xie, Hongyi Xu, Guoxian Song, Chao Wang, Yichun Shi, Linjie Luo
Abstract: We propose X-Portrait, an innovative conditional diffusion model tailored for generating expressive and temporally coherent portrait animation. Specifically, given a single portrait as appearance reference, we aim to animate it with motion derived from a driving video, capturing both highly dynamic and subtle facial expressions along with wide-range head movements.

s_Tag: Animation, Machine Learning, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: A Differential Monte Carlo Solver for the Poisson Equation
Contributors: Zihan Yu, Lifan Wu, Zhiqian Zhou, Shuang Zhao
Abstract: We introduce a general technique that differentiates solutions to the Poisson equation with Dirichlet boundary conditions. Specifically, we devise a new boundary-integral formulation for the derivatives with respect to arbitrary parameters including shapes of the domain. Further, we develop an efficient walk-on-spheres technique based on our new formulation.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Learning Images Across Scales Using Adversarial Training
Contributors: Krzysztof Wolski, Adarsh Djeacoumar, Alireza Javanmardi, Hans-Peter Seidel, Christian Theobalt, Guillaume Cordonnier, Karol Myszkowski, George Drettakis, Xingang Pan, Thomas Leimkühler
Abstract: We propose a novel paradigm to learn a scale space from an unstructured image collection using adversarial training. Enabling zoom-in factors of 256x, our approach can be used to train a multiscale generative model and for reconstructions of scale spaces from unstructured patches.

s_Tag: AI, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Spice-E: Structural Priors in 3D Diffusion Using Cross-Entity Attention
Contributors: Etai Sella, Gal Fiebelman, Noam Atia, Hadar Averbuch-Elor
Abstract: Text-to-3D diffusion models can generate high-quality 3D shapes in seconds, but they are hard to control. In this work we introduce Spice-E — a neural network that adds structural guidance to 3D diffusion models, allowing for solving a variety of 3D to 3D tasks with SOTA performance.

s_Tag: Animation, Geometry, Modeling, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: 3D Gaussian Blendshapes for Head Avatar Animation
Contributors: Shengjie Ma, Yanlin Weng, Tianjia Shao, Kun Zhou
Abstract: We introduce the 3D Gaussian blendshape representation for modeling photorealistic head avatars. The avatar model of an arbitrary expression can be effectively generated through linear blending of Gaussian blendshapes with the expression coefficients. Compared to state-of-the-art methods, our method better captures high-frequency details and achieves superior animation performance (370fps).

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Contact Detection Between Curved Fibres: High Order Makes a Difference
Contributors: Octave Crespel, Emile Hohnadel, Thibaut Metivet, Florence Bertails-Descoubes
Abstract: When simulating fibre assemblies with standard techniques, we identify spurious artifacts in the contact forces which are caused by the use of low-order proxys for collision detection. We fix this issue by developing an efficient and accurate high-order detection scheme between two smooth curves, which is successfully applied to super-helices.

s_Tag: Animation, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Scintilla: Simulating Combustible Vegetation for Wildfires
Contributors: Andrzej Kokosza, Helge Wrede, Daniel Gonzalez Esparza, Milosz Makowski, Daoming Liu, Dominik L. Michels, Soren Pirk, Wojtek Palubicki
Abstract: This paper introduces a new method for simulating wildfires, integrating detailed vegetation models and dynamic interactions like convection and combustion. It realistically depicts fire progression, ember transport, and the impact of interventions, validated through experiments and real-world data comparisons.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: 4D-Rotor Gaussian Splatting: Towards Efficient Novel View Synthesis for Dynamic Scenes
Contributors: Yuanxing Duan, Fangyin Wei, Qiyu Dai, Yuhang He, Wenzheng Chen, Baoquan Chen
Abstract: We present 4D-Rotor Gaussian Splatting that represents dynamic scenes with anisotropic 4D XYZT Gaussians and rotor-based 4D rotations for novel-view synthesis of dynamic scenes. The proposed method outperforms prior arts in rendering quality and achieves 277 FPS inference speed on an RTX 3090 GPU at Plenoptic Dataset.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: SMERF: Streamable Memory Efficient Radiance Fields for Real-time Large-scene Exploration
Contributors: Daniel Duckworth, Peter Hedman, Christian Reiser, Peter Zhizhin, Jean-François Thibert, Mario Lučić, Richard Szeliski, Jonathan T. Barron
Abstract: SMERF is a method for real-time view-synthesis of large, multi-room spaces on resource-constrained devices. By distilling state-of-the-art NeRF models into a compact, hierarchical representation, SMERF enables the exploration of spaces as large as 300 m^2 with quality approaching that of its teacher while rendering three orders of magnitude faster.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Spin-It Faster: Quadrics Solve All Topology Optimization Problems That Depend Only on Mass Moments
Contributors: Christian Hafner, Mickaël Ly, Chris Wojtan
Abstract: We show that a class of topology optimization problems used to design statically or rotationally balanced rigid bodies admits optimal solutions with material interfaces formed by quadrics, such as ellipsoids or hyperboloids. This reduces the number of unknowns from infinite to less than 10 and yields a provably equivalent problem.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: N-BVH: Neural Ray Queries With Bounding Volume Hierarchies
Contributors: Philippe Weier, Alexander Rath, Élie Michel, Iliyan Georgiev, Philipp Slusallek, Tamy Boubekeur
Abstract: N-BVH, a compressed neural architecture, enables efficient ray queries in rendering. Our method seamlessly integrates neural ray queries into standard pipelines. By optimizing parameters through an adaptive BVH-driven probing scheme, N-BVH can serve accurate ray queries from a compact representation while providing faithful approximations of visibility, depth, and appearance attributes.

s_Tag: Animation, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Ultra Inertial Poser: Scalable Motion Capture and Tracking From Sparse Inertial Sensors and Ultra-Wideband Ranging
Contributors: Rayan Armani, Changlin Qian, Jiaxi Jiang, Christian Holz
Abstract: Ultra Inertial Poser addresses sparse inertial pose estimation challenges by integrating inter-sensor distances measured through Ultra-Wideband ranging. Its pipeline leverages commodity IMU and UWB sensors, and a graph-based method to integrate distance constraints into existing frameworks. It is supported by a new dataset combining raw sensor data and SMPL references.

s_Tag: Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: One Noise to Rule Them All: Learning a Unified Model of Spatially-Varying Noise Patterns
Contributors: Arman Maesumi, Dylan Hu, Krishi Saripalli, Vladimir Kim, Matthew Fisher, Soeren Pirk, Daniel Ritchie
Abstract: We present a generative model that can synthesize a diverse array of spatially-varying noise patterns, even without spatially-varying training data. Our model offers a versatile and controllable way to generate noise textures for computer graphics applications. We also demonstrate its utility in inverse procedural material design.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Into the Portal: Directable Self-similarity
Contributors: Alexa Schor, Theodore Kim
Abstract: We present a novel method to create self-similar fractals from arbitrary input shapes. Our method introduces portals into an iterated map, allowing for user placement of self-similarities and bridging the aesthetics of iterated maps with the fine-grained control of iterated function systems (IFS) in both 2D and 3D.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Soft Pneumatic Actuator Design Using Differentiable Simulation
Contributors: Arvi Gjoka, Espen Knoop, Moritz Bächer, Denis Zorin, Daniele Panozzo
Abstract: We propose a computational design pipeline for pneumatically actuated soft robots interacting with their environment through contact. Our approach optimizes the shape of the robot using a shape optimization approach based on a physically accurate high-order finite element model for forward simulation.

s_Tag: Fabrication, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Cricket: A Self-powered Chirping Pixel
Contributors: Shree Nayar, Jeremy Klotz, Nikhil Nanda, Mikhail Fridberg
Abstract: Cricket is a novel light sensor that can measure light without the use of a power supply or a battery. Since it is self-powered and untethered, it can be used in a variety of applications including measuring environmental illumination, the control of indoor lighting, and the generation of low-resolution video.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Fluid Control With Laplacian Eigenfunctions
Contributors: Yixin Chen, David Levin, Timothy Langlois
Abstract: We introduce a novel physics-based fluid control pipeline using Laplacian Eigenfluids. Utilizing the adjoint method, the derivative computation of the control problem is efficient and easy to formulate. Our method is fast enough to support real-time fluid editing and control, which also naturally supports multi-resolution and frequency control.

s_Tag: AI, Machine Learning, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Subject-Diffusion: Open Domain Personalized Text-to-image Generation Without Test-time Fine-tuning
Contributors: Jian Ma, Junhao Liang, Chen Chen, Haonan Lu
Abstract: We present Subject-Diffusion, a novel open-domain personalized image generation model that, in addition to not requiring test-time fine-tuning, also only requires a single reference image to support personalized generation of single- or two-subjects in any domain.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Deep Sketch Vectorization via Implicit Surface Extraction
Contributors: Chuan Yan, Yong Li, Deepali Aneja, Matthew Fisher, Edgar Simo-Serra, Yotam Gingold
Abstract: We propose a sketch vectorization algorithm based on surface extraction from unsigned distance fields. Our representation is naturally controllable, which we demonstrate in an interactive topology refinement interface. We achieve far more accurate vectorizations on complex input than previous approaches with efficient running time.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Lifting Directional Fields to Minimal Sections
Contributors: David R. Palmer, Albert Chern, Justin M. Solomon
Abstract: By lifting direction fields to currents on a circle bundle, we unlock a new convex relaxation of field optimization that treats singularities as first-class citizens.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Lite2Relight: 3D-aware Single Image Portrait Relighting
Contributors: Pramod Rao, Gereon Fox, Abhimitra Meka, Mallikarjun B R, Fangneng Zhan, Tim Weyrich, Bernd Bickel, Hanspeter Pfister, Wojciech Matusik, Mohamed Elgharib, Christian Theobalt
Abstract: Lite2Relight presents a novel approach for achieving 3D consistent viewpoint editing and relighting in portraits at interactive speeds. Lite2Relight expands upon the generative capabilities of EG3D with an efficient lighting manipulation in the latent manifold, leveraging a lightstage dataset to model face reflectance and enable relighting within desired environment maps.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Lightning-fast Method of Fundamental Solutions
Contributors: Jiong Chen, Florian Schaefer, Mathieu Desbrun
Abstract: This work introduces a variational preconditioner, based on the inverse Cholesky factorization, to improve the efficiency of solving dense systems discretized from boundary integral equations, effectively addressing the scalability issue commonly encountered in boundary-based approaches.

s_Tag: AI, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: ThemeStation: Generating Theme-aware 3D Assets From Few Exemplars
Contributors: Zhenwei Wang, Tengfei Wang, Gerhard Hancke, Ziwei Liu, Rynson W.H. Lau
Abstract: ThemeStation is an advanced tool for crafting theme-consistent 3D models. From a few exemplars to a universe of 3D assets, our two-stage framework and dual distillation process ensure a good blend of unity and diversity. Unleash your creativity with ThemeStation and step into the realm of effortless 3D content generation.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Terrain Amplification Using Multi Scale Erosion
Contributors: Hugo Schott, Eric Galin, Eric Guérin, Axel Paris, Adrien Peytavie
Abstract: We present a multi-scale amplification method producing a high-resolution, hydrologically consistent terrain. The method relies on a fast and accurate approximation of different erosion processes, including thermal, stream power erosion and deposition performed at different scales to obtain a range of effects.

s_Tag: Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Ray Tracing Harmonic Functions
Contributors: Mark Gillespie, Denise Yang, Mario Botsch, Keenan Crane
Abstract: We introduce a sphere-tracing-like method for visualizing surfaces encoded as level sets of harmonic functions. We show examples visualizing smooth surfaces from point clouds or polygon soups (without linear solves or mesh extraction), nonplanar polygons, architectural grid shells, mesh exoskeletons, and key mathematical objects including Seifert and Riemann surfaces.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Seamless Parametrization in Penner Coordinates
Contributors: Ryan Capouellez, Denis Zorin
Abstract: We introduce a simple and efficient algorithm for seamless parametrization with prescribed angles at singularities and rotations along homology loops. Our algorithm performs exceptionally well on a large dataset based on Thingi10k [Zhou and Jacobson 2016] and on a challenging smaller dataset of [Myles et al . 2014].

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: IntrinsicDiffusion: Joint Intrinsic Layers From Latent Diffusion Models
Contributors: Jundan Luo, Duygu Ceylan, Jae Shin Yoon, Nanxuan Zhao, Julien Philip, Anna Frühstück, Wenbin Li, Christian Richardt, Tuanfeng Wang
Abstract: Estimating intrinsic images, such as albedo, shading, and normals, is challenging. We propose leveraging the implicit priors learned by the large-scale generation model. Our novel conditioning mechanism allows predicting multiple intrinsic modalities jointly and training with mixed datasets that only have partial annotations. It achieves state-of-the-art performance qualitatively and quantitatively.

s_Tag: Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Real-time Path Guiding Using Bounding Voxel Sampling
Contributors: Haolin Lu, Wesley Chang, Trevor Hedstrom, Tzu-Mao Li
Abstract: We propose a real-time path guiding method, Voxel Path Guiding (VXPG), that significantly improves fitting efficiency under limited sampling budget. We show that our method can outperform other real-time path guiding and virtual point light methods, particularly in handling complex dynamic scenes.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Text-to-vector Generation With Neural Path Representation
Contributors: Peiying Zhang, Nanxuan Zhao, Jing Liao
Abstract: We propose a novel pipeline to generate high-quality vector graphics based on text prompts. Utilizing neural path representation and a two-stage path optimization process, we can incorporate geometric constraints while preserving expressivity in the generated SVGs.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: TIP-Editor: An Accurate 3D Editor Following Both Text-prompts and Image-prompts
Contributors: Jingyu Zhuang, Di Kang, Yan-Pei Cao, Guanbin Li, Liang Lin, Ying Shan
Abstract: We propose a 3D scene editing framework, TIP-Editor, that accepts both text and image prompts. With the image prompt, users can conveniently specify the detailed appearance/style of the target content in complement to the text description, enabling accurate control on the appearance.

s_Tag: Machine Learning, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Path-space Differentiable Rendering of Implicit Surfaces
Contributors: Siwei Zhou, Youngha Chang, Nobuhiko Mukai, Hiroaki Santo, Fumio Okura, Yasuyuki Matsushita, Shuang Zhao
Abstract: We extend the theory of path-space differentiable rendering to include implicit surfaces and propose Monte Carlo estimators for the boundary integrals. This widens the application of physics-based differentiable rendering and opens up new possibilities for inverse rendering applications.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Controllable Neural Style Transfer for Dynamic Meshes
Contributors: Guilherme Gomes Haetinger, Jingwei Tang, Raphael Ortiz, Paul Kanyuk, Vinicius Azevedo
Abstract: A novel mesh neural style transfer technique is presented. We improve upon the previous stylization works through implicit re-parametrizations of meshes, controllable style orientations, better temporal coherency treatment, and volume conservation. These improvements enable high-quality mesh stylizations, creating unique looks for both simulations and 3D assets.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Interactive Invigoration: Volumetric Modeling of Trees With Strands
Contributors: Bosheng Li, Nikolas Schwarz, Wojtek Palubicki, Soeren Pirk, Bedrich Benes
Abstract: We introduce an interactive tree modeling approach that mimics tree secondary growth with strand-based volumetric representation. Our model enables interactive generation of complex detailed tree models with minimal effort by integrating strands with an interactive tree development model and a set of editing operators.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Consistent Point Orientation for Manifold Surfaces via Boundary Integration
Contributors: Weizhou Liu, Xingce Wang, Haichuan Zhao, Xingfei Xue, Zhongke Wu, Xuequan Lu, Ying He
Abstract: This paper introduces a robust method for generating globally consistent normals for manifold point clouds, leveraging boundary integration and the harmonic properties of the generalized winding number field, demonstrating superiority and robustness.

s_Tag: AI, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: DreamFont3D: Personalized Text-to-3D Artistic Font Generation
Contributors: Xiang Li, Lei Meng, Lei Wu, Manyi Li, Xiangxu Meng
Abstract: This paper presents a novel text-to-3D font generation model. It allows text prompt to describe 3D font styles, and script-generated font masks or hand-drawn font layouts to constrain the 3D font structure at multi-views, achieving stunning 3D representation of artistic font and the control of local effects.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Smooth Bijective Projection in a High-order Shell
Contributors: Shibo Liu, Yang Ji, Jia-Peng Guo, Ligang Liu, Xiao-Ming Fu
Abstract: We propose a new high-order shell structure for the smooth attribute transfer between meshes inside the shell, along with a robust construction algorithm. The high-order shell is enveloped by three B\'{e}zier triangles and three side surfaces, with a smooth bijective projection inside.

s_Tag: Animation, Geometry, Machine Learning, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Compressed Skinning for Facial Blendshapes
Contributors: Ladislav Kavan, John Doublestein, Martin Prazak, Matthew Cioffi, Doug Roble
Abstract: We present a new skinning decomposition method and its application to facial animation, specifically blendshape compression. Our new algorithm based on Adam with projection outperforms SOTA (Dem Bones) and even allows us to sparsify the bone-bone transformations for further compression.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Biharmonic Coordinates and Their Derivatives for Triangular 3D Cages
Contributors: Jean-Marc THIERY, Elie Michel, Jiong Chen
Abstract: We provide closed-form expressions for biharmonic coordinates for triangular cages in 3D, as well as for their gradients and Hessians. We demonstrate new cage-based deformations, a novel subspace for variational cage-based modeling, and we establish closed-form expressions for Somigliana coordinates in 3D that are linked to our coordinates.

s_Tag: Animation, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Categorical Codebook Matching for Embodied Character Controllers
Contributors: Sebastian Starke, Paul Starke, Taku Komura, Yuting Ye
Abstract: This work presents a generative VQ framework to translate movements of a real user onto a virtual embodied avatar using VR inputs. Our proposed codebook matching technique enables simultaneously learning and sampling the motions in form of Categorical probabilities and produces realistic full-body motion behaviors, accurately and with zero delay.

s_Tag: Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Area ReSTIR: Resampling for Real-time Defocus and Antialiasing
Contributors: Song Zhang, Daqi Lin, Markus Kettunen, Chris Wyman, Cem Yuksel
Abstract: We introduce Area ReSTIR, extending ReSTIR reservoirs to also integrate each pixel’s 4D ray space, including 2D areas on the film and lens. We design novel subpixel-tracking temporal reuse and shift mappings that maximize resampling quality in high-frequency regions, thereby allowing efficient rendering of antialiasing and depth of field.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: TensoSDF: Roughness-aware Tensorial Representation for Robust Geometry and Material Reconstruction
Contributors: Jia Li, Beibei Wang, Lu Wang, Lei Zhang
Abstract: We propose a novel framework for robust geometry and material reconstruction. The framework's core is the roughness-aware incorporation of the radiance and reflectance fields to reconstruct arbitrary reflective objects. The proposed TensoSDF representation enhances the geometry details while accelerating the training, and the explicit-implicit fusion strategy enables accurate material estimation.

s_Tag: Animation, Geometry, Modeling, Rendering, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: InvertAvatar: Incremental GAN Inversion for Generalized Head Avatars
Contributors: Xiaochen Zhao, Jingxiang Sun, Lizhen Wang, Jinli Suo, Yebin Liu
Abstract: Our Incremental 3D GAN Inversion framework advances avatar reconstruction with flexible-number multiple frames, incorporating a unique animatable GAN prior for precise expressions control, UV parameterization for high-fidelity appearance recovery, and a ConvGRU-based recurrent network for temporal aggregation. We achieve photorealistic one-/few-shot 3D facial avatar modeling under one second.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Navigation-driven Approximate Convex Decomposition
Contributors: James Andrews
Abstract: We introduce a new approach to approximate convex decomposition based on protecting the space around input shapes that objects in a game or simulation must be able to navigate. Our method is efficient, customizable, and provides novel guarantees that the resulting decompositions will meet application-specific requirements when used for collision.

s_Tag: Animation, Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Toonify3D: StyleGAN-based 3D Stylized Face Generator
Contributors: Wonjong Jang, Yucheol Jung, Hyomin Kim, Gwangjin Ju, Chaewon Son, Jooeun Son, Seungyong Lee
Abstract: We present a StyleGAN-based 3D stylized face generation framework, Toonify3D, which automatically creates full-head 3D stylized avatar mesh models and supports GAN-based 3D facial expression editing.

s_Tag: Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Direct-a-Video: Customized Video Generation With User-directed Camera Movement and Object Motion
Contributors: Shiyuan Yang, Liang Hou, Haibin Huang, Chongyang Ma, Pengfei Wan, DI Zhang, Xiaodong Chen, Jing Liao
Abstract: We introduce Direct-a-Video, a text-to-video generation tool that goes beyond simple text instructions by allowing individual or joint control over camera movements and object motion. It simplifies customized video creation, enabling users to craft videos with their preferred motion patterns, as if they were directing a video.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Part123: Part-aware 3D Reconstruction From a Single-view Image
Contributors: Anran Liu, Cheng Lin, Yuan Liu, Xiaoxiao Long, Zhiyang Dou, Hao-Xiang Guo, Ping Luo, Wenping Wang
Abstract: This paper proposes Part123, a novel framework for part-aware 3D reconstruction from a single-view image. Based on the multiview images generated by multiview diffusion, we apply contrastive learning to incorporate their 2D image segmentations into the 3D reconstruction process, thus enabling the generation of 3D models with high-quality part segments.

s_Tag: Animation, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
sub_Title: Physics-informed Learning of Characteristic Trajectories for Smoke Reconstruction
Contributors: Yiming Wang, Siyu Tang, Mengyu Chu
Abstract: We introduce Neural Characteristic Trajectory Fields, a novel representation utilizing Eulerian neural fields to implicitly model Lagrangian fluid trajectories for video-based fluid reconstruction. This topology-free, auto-differentiable representation facilitates end-to-end supervision, encompassing long-term conservation and short-term physics priors. It offers advancements in high-fidelity fluid reconstruction across synthetic and real scenes.

s_Tag: Geometry, Modeling, Research & Education, Full Conference, Full Conference Supporter, Virtual Access, Exhibitor Full Conference
